summary: The 22nd Cooperative Design, Visualization, and Engineering (CDVE) conference will be held in Bangkok, Thailand, from October 19-22, 2025, hosted by the School of Information Technology, King Mongkut's Institute of Technology. The conference focuses on "cooperative" concepts across design, visualization, and engineering, inviting participation from researchers worldwide. Keynote speaker will be Prof. Jaime Lloret, discussing "Intelligent collaborative sensor networks for Precision Agriculture." Accepted papers will be published in Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS).
callForPapers:
# CDVE 2025: Call for Papers

The Cooperative Design, Visualization, and Engineering (CDVE) conference series, now in its 22nd year, invites submissions of original papers focusing on the "cooperative" concept. The conference will be held in **Bangkok, Thailand, from October 19-22, 2025**.

## Conference Focus

The conference scope encompasses multiple users, multiple locations, multiple units, and multiple sensors, with a strong emphasis on cooperative aspects.

## Major Areas and Topics

### Cooperative Design (CD)

*   Multiple user, multiple location collaborative design applications
*   Concurrent design, collaborative editing, real-time user interactions
*   Cooperative User Experience (UX) design
*   Demonstrating feasibility and applicability in CD
*   Multi-modal interface design (e.g., cooperative design using interactive tabletops and surfaces)
*   Design for total life cycle support: from design to manufacturing or construction
*   Cooperative design analysis, verification, integration, and interoperability, standards
*   Scenarios, case studies of cooperative design in mechanical engineering, aero-space engineering, building architecture, engineering and construction, automobile, microelectronics, software engineering, entertainment, and other areas
*   Special issues in cooperative design

### Cooperative Visualization (CV)

*   System architecture, prototypes, user interfaces for CV: web applications, textual and multimedia 2D, 3D desktop interfaces, 3D virtual world environments, and multiple user embedded systems.
*   Visualization for multiple users, multiple locations, concurrent visualization
*   Cooperative visual analytics and communication
*   Large scale, big data storage, access, exploration, and manipulation for cooperative visualization
*   Multi-resolution and other efficient computer graphics, visualization algorithms for cooperative visualization
*   Visualization in multiple user games, networked games, simulation visualization for multiple users

### Cooperative Engineering (CE)

*   Collaborative process planning, scheduling, control, conformance testing and interoperability checking, cooperative decision making.
*   Human-machine interfaces, frameworks, reference models, architectures, tools, and systems for CE
*   Concurrent prototyping, manufacturing, and engineering.
*   Concurrent process modeling, product modeling, reference models, business models, data representations, and standards.
*   Integration and interoperability, intelligent infrastructures, and automated methods for integrating systems, multi-level integration, enterprise integration
*   Long-term large scale project data archiving, access, concurrent data control for CE
*   Smart grids
*   Industrial scenarios, case studies of CE: in mechanical engineering, aerospace engineering, AEC (architecture, engineering and construction), automobile, microelectronics, and others
*   Methods, applications for total life cycle support: from conceptual design to manufacturing and construction

### Cooperative Applications (CA)

*   Human computer interface for cooperative working
*   Cooperation between humans and autonomous systems
*   Social networks
*   Crowd sourcing
*   Collective intelligence
*   Cooperative learning, multi-modal learning
*   Multiple user gaming
*   Multiple platform payment systems
*   Multimodal user interface for cooperation
*   Cooperative decision making
*   Cooperative Internet of Things (IoT)
*   Nano networks, nano-communication, nano sensors
*   Collaborative Information seeking
*   Information integration in sensor networks
*   Collaborations in emergency response and disaster management
*   Collaborative mobile systems, group interaction in mobile systems and mobility communities
*   Collaborative simulation
*   Collaborative robots and human-robot interaction, social robots
*   Collaboration technologies and systems for healthcare
*   Web-based cooperation tools, cooperative web design (e.g., Wikis)
*   Cooperative service-oriented applications
*   Other cooperative applications

### Basic Theories, Methods, and Technologies that support CDVE (BT)

*   Modeling of group behavior
*   Distributed systems, grid systems, real-time systems, groupware
*   Cooperation issues in metaverse, digital twins
*   Cloud computing, edge computing for cooperative work
*   Fog computing for cooperative storage, cooperative working
*   Big data processing, fusion
*   Multi-sensor data processing, fusion
*   Neural networks for CDVE
*   Blockchains, distributed ledger technology
*   Algorithms, architectures, frameworks, platforms for CDVE
*   Data consistency, concurrent processing, middleware
*   Agent-based methods, conversational agents, hybrid conversational agents combining human and machine intelligence (cooperative CAs)
*   Collaborative and multi-mode working environments
*   Design patterns, re-usability, and component-based methods
*   Communication, transport, application protocols for CDVE
*   Internet computing, web environment for collaborative working
*   Knowledge management, information systems, large databases, data-mining
*   Semantic Technologies for Information-Integrated Collaboration
*   Ontology for information sharing, cooperative applications
*   Security for CDVE
*   Human machine interaction for CDVE
*   Artificial intelligence for CDVE

## Special Issue Opportunity

CDVE2025 Special Issue on IEEE Systems, Man, and Cybernetics Magazine: "Advance in cooperative design, visualization, engineering, and other cooperative applications." The best quality papers from CDVE2025 will be selected for publication. To be considered, authors must submit a paper to CDVE2025 first.

## Deadlines

*   **Submission:** (Extended by 2 weeks for the special issue call)
*   **Notification:** (Not specified in Call for Papers section, but typically follows submission)
*   **Registration:** Begins now (Early registration welcome for accepted papers or general participation).

## Submission Process

*   All submissions should be made through the EasyChair system: **cdve2025@easychair.org**.
*   Papers should be original and not under review elsewhere.

## Publication

All accepted full papers and short papers with valid registration will be published in the **Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS)** series by Springer.

Each paper will have an independent DOI and will be indexed in major systems including:

*   Conference Proceedings Citation Index (CPCI)
*   Zentralblatt MATH
*   EI Engineering Index (Compendex and Inspec databases)
*   Scopus
*   ACM Digital Library
*   IO-Port
*   dblp
*   MathSciNet
*   Google Scholar

## Organizers

*   School of Information Technology, King Mongkut's Institute of Technology
*   University of Balearic Islands
*   Luxembourg Institute of Science and Technology

## Technical Sponsor

*   Visual Analytics and Communication Technical Committee (IEEE SMC)

## Supporting Organizations

*   Information Visualization Society
*   Interaction Design Foundation

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: CISIS 2025

The 18th International Conference on Computational Intelligence in Security for Information Systems (CISIS 2025) aims to offer a meeting opportunity for academic and industry-related researchers from the fields of Computational Intelligence, Information Security, Cybersecurity, and Data Mining. The conference is intended to catalyze and aggregate efforts towards intelligent, flexible systems, particularly in mission-critical domains.

CISIS 2025 is part of the **International Joint Conferences HAIS-SOCO-CISIS-ICEUTE & STARTUP OLÉ** and will be held on **16-17 October 2025** in **Salamanca, Spain**.

## Topics of Interest

*   Computational Intelligence
*   Information Security
*   Cybersecurity
*   Data Mining

For a detailed list of topics, please visit: [http://cisisconference.eu/topics/](http://cisisconference.eu/topics/)

## Submission Types and Guidelines

*   **Paper Length:** Papers must be prepared according to the **LNNS style template** and must be no more than **ten (10) pages** long, including figures and bibliography. Additional pages (over 10 pages) will be charged **150 euros** for each page.
*   **Presentation:** All accepted papers must be presented by one of the authors, who must register for the conference and pay the fee.
*   **Format:** Templates are available at [http://sococonference.eu/paper-submission-publication](http://sococonference.eu/paper-submission-publication).

## Publication

*   CISIS’25 proceedings will be published by **Springer** in a special volume of **Lecture Notes in Networks and Systems (LNNS)**.
*   Indexed by **SCOPUS, INSPEC, WTI Frankfurt eG, zbMATH, SCImago**.

## Special Issues

All accepted papers (submitted to general track and special sessions) will be considered for possible inclusion in a special issue of **Neurocomputing (ELSEVIER)** (2024 JCR Impact Factor: 5.5 – Q1).

## Call for Special Sessions

Researchers are invited to submit proposals for organizing Special Sessions. Proposals are due by **15th March 2025**.

**Conditions for Organizers:**

*   Select a topic of interest to conference delegates.
*   Obtain a minimum of 5 papers for the session, with at least 60% by authors not affiliated with the session chairs or reviewers.
*   Manage the review process for session papers according to deadlines.
*   Provide suitable reviewers.
*   Ensure final paper versions are uploaded before the deadline.
*   Attend the conference and chair the session.
*   Disseminate the call for papers for the special session.

**Proposal Requirements:**

*   Title of the special session and selected conference (SOCO’25, CISIS’25, and ICEUTE’25).
*   Name of chair/co-chairs, email/s, and affiliation/s.
*   One or two paragraphs describing the session content.
*   List of at least 10 international reviewers (including chairs) from at least three different universities (name, family name, email, affiliation).
*   Description of the plan to disseminate the special session (CFPs, etc.).

Submit proposals via email to [hector.quintian@udc.es](mailto:hector.quintian@udc.es).

## Important Dates

*   **Special Sessions proposal deadline:** 15th March 2025
*   **Paper submission deadline:** 1st June 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** 15th June 2025
*   **Submission of revised papers:** 30th June 2025
*   **Final version submission:** 5th July 2025
*   **Payment deadline:** 10th July 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** 16th–17th October 2025

## Submission System

Submissions should be made through the following EasyChair links:

*   **CISIS’25:** [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cisis2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cisis2025)

## Committees

**General Chair:**
*   Dr. Emilio Corchado (University of Salamanca, Spain)

**Co-Chairs:**
*   Dr. Alicia Troncoso Lora (Pablo de Olavide University, Spain)
*   Dr. Hilde Pérez García (University of León, Spain)
*   Dr. Esteban Jove (University of A Coruña, Spain)
*   Dr. José Luis Calvo Rolle (University of A Coruña, Spain)
*   Dr. Francisco Javier Martínez de Pisón (University of La Rioja, Spain)
*   Dr. Pablo García Bringas (University of Deusto, Spain)
*   Dr. Francisco Martínez Álvarez (Pablo de Olavide University, Spain)
*   Dr. Alvaro Herrero Cosio (University of Burgos, Spain)
*   Dr. Paolo Fosci (University of Bergamo, Italy)
*   Dr. Héctor Quintián (University of A Coruña, Spain)

## Contact

For conference-related issues or doubts, please contact: [hector.quintian@udc.es](mailto:hector.quintian@udc.es)

# CLEI 2025: Call for Papers

The 51st Latin American Conference on Informatics (CLEI) invites papers reporting results of a theoretical and/or practical nature that advance the state of the art or present relevant applications or cases in the areas of interest of the symposia and associated events.

CLEI LI will take place in **Valparaiso, Chile**.

## Tracks

*   Software Systems
*   Intelligent Systems
*   Systems in Practice
*   Information Technology
*   Computer Education

## Associated Events

*   LAWCC – XVII Latin American Women in Computing Congress
*   CLTM – XXXII Latin American Master’s Thesis Competition
*   CLTD – XI Latin American Doctoral Thesis Competition
*   ELI – IV Latin American School of Informatics
*   TLISC – II Latin American Workshop on Quantum Engineering and Software
*   LADC – Latin American Symposium on Trustworthy and Secure Computing
*   Chilean Computer Science Conference 2025
*   IEEE CHILECON2025 – 2025 IEEE Chilean Conference on Electrical, Electronic Engineering, Informatics and Communications Technology

## Contact

clei2025@pucv.cl

## General Information

The Latin American Conference on Informatics (CLEI) is an annual event organized by the Latin American Center for Informatics Studies, held since 1974. It is the most important Latin American space for the exchange of ideas, experiences, and research results among researchers, professionals, teachers, and students of Computer Science and Informatics, as well as their technological applications.

Its objective is the exchange of ideas, experiences, and research results in areas of interest to the community, through conferences, workshops, tutorials, and panels.

*Note: Specific submission deadlines and formatting guidelines are not provided in the main content. Please refer to the "Call for Papers" PDF for detailed information.*

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The International Conference on Cloud Computing and Services Science (CLOSER) is a premier event focused on the critical area of Cloud Computing and its integral link to Services Science. CLOSER explores how Cloud Computing is transforming IT through externalized systems, on-demand delivery, and various 'as a service' models, fostering creativity and competitive advantage.

## SCOPE

The conference delves into Cloud Computing where Services Science provides the theoretical framework, methods, and techniques for designing, analyzing, managing, marketing, and studying various aspects of Cloud Computing. It addresses the impact of emerging enterprise technologies on IT economics, efficiency, processes, and usage models.

## CONFERENCE AREAS

1.  **CLOUD COMPUTING ENABLING TECHNOLOGY**
    *   API Management
    *   Virtualization Technologies
    *   Containers, Containerization and Enablement
    *   Container Composition and Orchestration
    *   Container Performance
    *   Microservices
    *   Multi-Cloud Solutions Enablement
    *   Cloud Quality and Performance
    *   Cloud Optimization and Automation
    *   Cloud Management and Operations
    *   High Performance Cloud Computing
    *   Cloud Migration
    *   Monitoring of Services, Quality of Service, Service Level Agreements
    *   Function-as-a-Service and Serverless Computing

2.  **CLOUD COMPUTING FUNDAMENTALS**
    *   Cloud Application Portability
    *   Federated Cloud
    *   Cloud Computing Architecture
    *   Cloud Delivery Models
    *   Cloud Deployment Models: Public/Private/Hybrid Cloud
    *   Cloud Interoperability
    *   Cloud Risk, Challenges and Governance
    *   Cloud Standards
    *   QoS for Applications on Clouds
    *   Resource Management
    *   Energy Efficient Cloud Computing

3.  **CLOUD COMPUTING PLATFORMS AND APPLICATIONS**
    *   Development Methods for Cloud Applications
    *   XaaS
    *   Cloud Services
    *   Cloud Data Centers, Storage and Networking Technologies
    *   Cloud Workflow Management Systems
    *   Cloud Solution Design Patterns
    *   Native Cloud Applications
    *   Cloud Application Architectures
    *   Cloud Application Scalability and Availability
    *   Cloud Applications Performance and Monitoring
    *   Cloud Middleware Frameworks
    *   Digital Twinning
    *   Blockchains
    *   Metaverse, Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality
    *   Web 3.0 / Spatial Web
    *   Mobile Cloud Architectures and Models
    *   Mobile Cloud Networking
    *   Cloud Cost Analysis

4.  **EDGE CLOUD AND FOG COMPUTING**
    *   Edge Cloud Orchestration
    *   Cluster Management
    *   Edge Cloud Network Management
    *   Edge Cloud Data Management
    *   IoT-Cloud Integration
    *   AI-enabled Edge Cloud
    *   Multi-access Edge Cloud
    *   Cloud Continuum

5.  **SERVICES**
    *   Service Modeling and Specification
    *   Service Monitoring and Control
    *   Service Ecosystems
    *   Service Simulation
    *   Service Performance Analytics
    *   Analytics and Services
    *   Business Process Management and Web Services
    *   Service Innovation
    *   Service Lifecycle Management
    *   Service-Oriented Architecture
    *   Service Management
    *   Service Platforms
    *   Enterprise Architectures and Services
    *   Industrial Applications of Services Science
    *   Internet of Services
    *   Microservices: Automation, Deployment and Management, Resource Allocation Elasticity, Service State and Resilience

6.  **CLOUD SECURITY AND PRIVACY**
    *   Container Security and Isolation
    *   Security, Privacy and Compliance Management
    *   Privacy, Security and Trust
    *   Access Control
    *   Services Security and Reliability
    *   (Multi Factor) Authorization
    *   Privacy and Privacy Assurance
    *   (Decentralized) Trust
    *   Intrusion Detection

## KEYNOTE SPEAKERS

*   Aaron Ding, TU Delft, Netherlands
*   Sonia Ben Mokhtar, LIRIS CNRS, France
*   Philipp Leitner, Chalmers University of Technology, Sweden

## PAPER SUBMISSION

Authors can submit their work as a **complete paper** (for publication in proceedings) or an **abstract** (presented but not published). Accepted complete papers can be submitted as:

*   **Regular Paper:** For completed and validated research.
*   **Position Paper:** For works in progress or arguable opinions.

Authors must submit papers in English, ensuring correct grammar and spelling. Submissions should address conference areas and clearly state the contribution and applicability.

**Double-blind paper evaluation** is used: authors must exclude any personal details, acknowledgments, or references that could identify them.

Only original papers should be submitted. Authors must adhere to INSTICC's ethical norms regarding plagiarism and self-plagiarism. Substantially overlapping work or simultaneous submissions will be rejected.

Submissions must be made through the **PRIMORIS online submission platform**. Please follow the instructions and templates found under Guidelines and Templates. Authors will receive an automatic confirmation e-mail upon successful submission.

## PUBLICATIONS

All accepted complete papers will be published in the conference proceedings with an ISBN reference, in both paper and digital formats.

*   SCITEPRESS is a member of CrossRef, and each paper will receive a DOI (Digital Object Identifier).
*   Proceedings will be submitted for indexation by SCOPUS, Google Scholar, DBLP, Semantic Scholar, EI, and Web of Science / Conference Proceedings Citation Index.
*   A short list of best papers will be invited for a post-conference special issue of the Springer Nature Computer Science Journal.
*   Revised and extended versions of presented papers will be published with Springer in a CCIS Series book (final approval pending).

## IMPORTANT DATES

*   **Conference Date:** April 1-3, 2025

*Note: All dates refer to AOE time, i.e. "Anywhere on Earth".*

callForPapers:
# CICM 2025: Call for Papers

The 18th Conference on Intelligent Computer Mathematics (CICM 2025) will be held from **October 6-11, 2025**, in **Brasilia, Brazil**.

## About CICM

CICM brings together communities working on theoretical and practical solutions for mathematical applications such as computation, deduction, knowledge management, and user interfaces. It offers a venue for discussing problems and solutions in these areas and their integration.

## Topics of Interest

We are inviting formal submissions on all topics relating to intelligent computer mathematics, in particular, but not limited to:

*   theorem proving and computer algebra
*   mathematical knowledge management
*   digital mathematical libraries

A comprehensive list of topics of interest can be found on the conference website: [https://cicm-conference.org/2025/cicm.php?event=&menu=topics](https://cicm-conference.org/2025/cicm.php?event=&menu=topics)

## Invited Speakers

*   Fabian Huch, Technische Universität München (TUM)
*   Assia Mahboubi, INRIA, Nantes
*   Daniele Nantes Sobrinho, University of Brasilia (UnB)
*   Josef Urban, Czech Institute of of Informatics, Robotics and Cybernetics (CIIRC)
*   Joint Invited Speaker with LSFA 2025: Temur Kutsia, Research Institute for Symbolic Computation (RISC), Johannes Kepler University

## Formal Paper Submissions

Formal submissions will be reviewed rigorously and accepted papers will be published in a volume of Springer LNAI:

*   **Regular papers:** (up to 15 pages + bibliography) present novel research results.
*   **Project and survey papers:** (up to 15 pages + bibliography) summarize existing results.
*   **System and dataset descriptions:** (4 to 5 pages + bibliography) present digital artifacts.

## Doctoral Symposium

*   **Submission Type:** Two-page abstracts describing the focus and research questions of the PhD theses, along with details on completed research tasks and remaining research plans.
*   **Additional Submission:** A two-page CV of the applicant detailing background information (name, university, supervisor), education, employments, and relevant research experience.
*   **Chairs:** Claudia Nalon (UnB Brasilia) and Marcelo Finger (USP Sao Paulo).

## Important Dates

### Formal Submissions:

*   **Abstract deadline:** May 12, 2025
*   **Full paper deadline:** May 19, 2025
*   **Reviews sent to authors:** June 30, 2025
*   **Rebuttals due:** July 5, 2025
*   **Notification of acceptance:** July 16, 2025
*   **Camera-ready copies due:** July 28, 2025

### Conference Dates:

*   **Conference:** October 6-11, 2025

### Dates for Workshops:

*   **Workshop proposals:** April 29, 2025
*   **Notification:** May 03, 2025

### Dates for Doctoral Programme:

*   **Submission deadline:** August 15, 2025
*   **Notification to candidates:** September 15, 2025

## Submissions

All submissions should be made via EasyChair at [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cicm2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cicm2025) using the Springer LNCS style files: [https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines)

If software or data is relevant to a paper, a link that provides access to the software/data must be provided to enable reproduction of results.

## Best Papers

CICM 2025 honors the best paper and best student paper with respect to reviews and program committee discussions with an award.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers for CHES 2025

The Workshop on Cryptographic Hardware and Embedded Systems (CHES) is the premier venue for research in all aspects of cryptographic hardware and embedded systems. CHES 2025 will be held in **Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia**, from **September 14-18, 2025**.

Papers accepted and published by the *Transactions on Cryptographic Hardware and Embedded Systems (TCHES)* journal during the 2025 volumes will be presented at CHES 2025.

## Scope and Topics

CHES focuses on research pertaining to **cryptographic hardware and embedded systems**. This includes, but is not limited to, the design and analysis of cryptographic primitives, implementations of cryptographic algorithms, attacks against implementations, and defenses against such attacks in various hardware and embedded contexts.

## Submission Process

Submissions to CHES are handled through the *Transactions on Cryptographic Hardware and Embedded Systems (TCHES)* journal, which operates on a continuous submission model with four fixed deadlines per year. Authors are encouraged to submit their work to any of the upcoming TCHES volumes that align with the CHES 2025 presentation schedule.

Submissions are made via the dedicated submission portal for TCHES. Further details on the submission process, including formatting requirements and guidelines, are available on the [paper submission page](https://ches.iacr.org/2025/papersubmission.php).

## Important Dates for TCHES 2025 Issues

All submission deadlines are at **23:59:59 Anywhere on Earth (AoE)**.

### Schedule for TCHES Volume 2025/1

*   **Submission deadline:** July 15, 2024
*   **Rebuttal phase:** August 19–23, 2024
*   **Notification:** September 15, 2024
*   **Final version due:** October 14, 2024

### Schedule for TCHES Volume 2025/2

*   **Submission deadline:** October 15, 2024
*   **Rebuttal phase:** November 20–25, 2024
*   **Notification:** December 15, 2024
*   **Final version due:** January 14, 2025

### Schedule for TCHES Volume 2025/3

*   **Submission deadline:** January 15, 2025
*   **Rebuttal phase:** February 24–28, 2025
*   **Notification:** March 15, 2025
*   **Final version due:** April 14, 2025

### Schedule for TCHES Volume 2025/4

*   **Submission deadline:** April 15, 2025
*   **Rebuttal phase:** May 26–30, 2025
*   **Notification:** June 15, 2025
*   **Final version due:** July 14, 2025

> **Note:** The camera-ready deadline relates to (conditionally) accepted papers. Dates marked with an asterisk (*) indicate a deadline that was moved or extended.

## Publication

Accepted papers will be published in the *Transactions on Cryptographic Hardware and Embedded Systems (TCHES)*. TCHES is an open-access journal published by the IACR.

## Conference Presentation

Authors of papers accepted and published in TCHES will be invited to present their work at the CHES 2025 conference in Kuala Lumpur.

callForPapers:
# CODES+ISSS: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Hardware/Software Codesign and System Synthesis (CODES+ISSS) is the premier event in system-level design, hardware/software co-design, modeling, analysis, and implementation of modern Embedded Systems, Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS), and Internet-of-Things (IoT), from system-level specification and optimization to system synthesis of multi-processor hardware/software implementations. The conference is a forum bringing together academic research and industrial practice for all aspects related to system-level and hardware/software co-design.

## Calls for Contribution

*   [Call for Papers](http://esweek.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/ESWeek2025_CFP.pdf)
*   [Call for Contributions](href="")
*   [Call for Special Sessions](https://esweek.org/call-for-special-session-proposals/)
*   [Call for Tutorials](https://esweek.org/call-for-tutorial-proposals-page/)
*   [Call for Workshops](https://esweek.org/call-for-workshop-proposals/)
*   [Call for LB (Late Breaking/Work-in-Progress Papers)](http://esweek.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/ESWeek2023_CFP_LBWIP.pdf)
*   [Call for Artifacts (for EMSOFT)](https://esweek.org/call-for-artifacts/)

## Submission Tracks

*   **Journal Track:** For full research papers.
*   **Late Breaking Tracks:** For work-in-progress and other shorter contributions.
*   **Special Session Proposals:** Proposals for dedicated sessions on specific topics.
*   **Tutorial Proposals:** Proposals for educational tutorials.
*   **Workshops Proposals:** Proposals for co-located workshops.

## Important Dates

*   **March 23, 2025 (AOE):** Journal Track: Abstract Submission
*   **March 30, 2025 (AOE, firm):** Journal Track: Full Paper Submission, Special Session Proposals, Tutorial Proposals, Workshops Proposals
*   **May 18, 2025:** Journal track: First Round Notification
*   **June 01, 2025 (AOE, firm):** Late Breaking Tracks: Paper Submission
*   **June 15, 2025 (AOE, firm):** Journal track: Revised paper submission
*   **July 13, 2025:** Journal Track, Late Breaking Track: Notification
*   **August 11, 2025:** All tracks (full paper, LB, Special Session): Camera ready
*   **TBD:** Submission deadline for the Embedded System Software Competition (ESSC) and the ACM SIGBED Student Research Competition.

## Program Chairs

*   **Prabhat Mishra** (University of Florida, FL, US) - CODES+ISSS TPC Chair
*   **Paul Bogdan** (University of Southern California, CA, US) - CODES+ISSS TPC Co-Chair

## Submission

*   [Submit an Article to CODES+ISSS 2025](https://codesisss25.hotcrp.com/)
*   [Author Information](https://esweek.org/author-information/)

## About CODES+ISSS

CODES+ISSS is a conference within ESWEEK, focusing on the intersection of hardware and software for system synthesis and design, covering embedded systems, CPS, and IoT.

## ESWEEK 2025

ESWEEK 2025 will take place as an in-person event from September 28th to October 3rd, 2025, in Taipei, Taiwan.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - IEEE Cluster 2025

IEEE Cluster 2025 is the 27th edition of the IEEE Cluster conference series, held in cooperation with SIGHPC. The conference will take place in **Edinburgh, United Kingdom, from September 2-5, 2025**.

Computing clusters are essential for high-performance computing, cloud computing, machine learning, and big data. This conference solicits high-quality original work advancing the state-of-the-art in clusters and related fields.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Paper Format:** PDF, conforming to IEEE Xplore layout (single-spaced, 2-column numbered pages, 8.5x11-inch paper, margins: top: 0.75, bottom: 1.0, sides:0.625, between columns:0.25, main text: 10pt).
*   **Page Limit:** Maximum 10 pages (excluding references).
*   **Review Process:** Dual-anonymous review. Author names and affiliations should NOT be included in the submitted paper. For more details, refer to [https://clustercomp.org/2025/dual_anonymous.html](https://clustercomp.org/2025/dual_anonymous.html).
*   **AI-Generated Text:** Disclosure of AI-generated content is required in the acknowledgments section, identifying the AI system used and the extent of its use. See [IEEE Submission Policies](https://conferences.ieeeauthorcenter.ieee.org/author-ethics/guidelines-and-policies/submission-policies/) for more details.
*   **Templates:** LaTeX and Word Templates are available [here](https://clustercomp.org/2025/authors/).
*   **Submission System:** Submit your paper via the [online submission system](https://ssl.linklings.net/conferences/ieeecluster/).
*   **Presentation Requirement:** For an accepted paper to be included in the proceedings, at least one author must register, attend in person, and present the paper at the conference.

## Topic Areas

Authors must indicate the primary topic area of their submissions. Transversal and emerging topics are welcome.

### Area 1: Application, Algorithms, and Libraries

*   HPC and Big Data application studies on large-scale clusters
*   Applications at the boundary of HPC and Big Data
*   New applications for converged HPC/Big Data clusters
*   Application-level performance and energy modeling and measurement
*   Novel algorithms on clusters
*   Hybrid programming techniques in applications and libraries (e.g., MPI+X)
*   Cluster benchmarks
*   Application-level libraries on clusters
*   Effective use of clusters in novel applications
*   Performance evaluation tools

### Area 2: Architecture, Network/Communications, and Management

*   Node and system architecture for HPC and Big Data clusters
*   Architecture for converged HPC/Big Data clusters
*   Energy-efficient cluster architectures
*   Packaging, power and cooling
*   Accelerators, reconfigurable and domain-specific hardware
*   Heterogeneous clusters
*   Interconnect/memory architectures
*   Single system/distributed image clusters
*   Administration, monitoring and maintenance tools

### Area 3: Programming and System Software

*   Cluster system software/operating systems
*   Programming models for converged HPC/Big Data/Machine Learning systems
*   System software supporting the convergence of HPC, Big Data, and Machine Learning processing
*   Cloud-enabling cluster technologies and virtualization
*   Energy-efficient middleware
*   Cluster system-level protocols and APIs
*   Cluster security
*   Management of local, center-wide and disaggregate resources and job
*   Programming and software development environments on clusters
*   Fault tolerance and high-availability
*   Administration, monitoring and maintenance tools

### Area 4: Data, Storage, and Visualization

*   Cluster architectures for Big Data storage and processing
*   Middleware for Big Data management
*   Cluster-based cloud architectures for Big Data
*   Storage systems supporting the convergence of HPC and Big Data processing
*   File systems and I/O libraries
*   Support and integration of non-volatile memory
*   Visualization clusters and tiled displays
*   Big Data/Large scale visualization tools
*   Big Data application studies on cluster architectures

## Important Dates

*   Submission site open: **February 3, 2025**
*   Full Papers due: **May 6, 2025**
*   Paper Acceptance Notification: **July 4, 2025**
*   Camera-ready deadline: **August 8, 2025**
*   Conference: **September 2--5, 2025**

All deadlines are Anywhere on Earth (AoE).

## Contact

**Program Co-Chairs:**
*   Adrian Jackson, EPCC, University of Edinburgh, United Kingdom
*   Toni Peña, Barcelona Supercomputing Centre, Spain

Complete committee list is available [here](https://clustercomp.org/2025/committees/).

callForPapers:
# CHI 2025: Call for Papers

The ACM CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems is the premier international conference dedicated to Human-Computer Interaction (HCI).

## Conference Details

*   **Theme:** Ikigai (a Japanese concept referring to what gives a person a sense of purpose, a reason for living).
*   **Location:** Yokohama, Japan, at the PACIFICO Yokohama.
*   **Dates:** April 26 to May 1, 2025.
*   **Participation:** Onsite and remote attendance options are available.

## Submission Types and Deadlines

All times are in Anywhere on Earth (AoE) time zone.

### Papers

*   Submission Site Open: **August 1, 2024**
*   Abstract/metadata deadline: **September 5, 2024** (Hard deadline for all author names and metadata).
*   Full paper deadline: **September 12, 2024**
*   Video figures (optional) and Supplementary Material deadline: **September 19, 2024**
*   Reviews Released: **November 5, 2024**
*   Revise Papers: November 6 – December 10, 2024
*   Resubmission deadline: **December 10, 2024**
*   PC Meeting: **January 14, 2025**
*   Decision Notification: **January 16, 2025**

### Other Submission Tracks (Selected Deadlines)

*   **Case Studies of HCI in Practice & Courses:**
    *   Submission: **October 10, 2024**
    *   Notification: **November 28, 2024**
*   **Workshops:**
    *   Submission: **October 24, 2024**
    *   Notification: **December 5, 2024**
*   **In-Person Doctoral Consortium:**
    *   Submission: **December 5, 2024**
    *   Notification: **January 30, 2025**
*   **alt.CHI, Panels, SIG:**
    *   Submission: **December 19, 2024**
    *   Notification: **January 16, 2025**
*   **Journals:**
    *   Submission: **January 22, 2025**
    *   Notification: **January 27, 2025**
*   **Student Volunteer:**
    *   Submission: **January 23, 2025**
    *   Notification: **February 20, 2025**
*   **Late Breaking Work, Interactivity, Remote Doctoral Consortium, Student Design Competition, Student Game Competition, Student Research Competition, Video Showcase:**
    *   Submission: Deadlines vary, please refer to the specific track pages.

## Submission Guidelines for Papers

*   **Originality:** Submissions must be original and not published or under concurrent review elsewhere. Multiple distinct submissions are allowed.
*   **Paper Length:**
    *   Short Papers: 5,000 words or less (excluding references, captions, appendices).
    *   Standard-Length Papers: 5,000 to 12,000 words (approx. 7,000-8,000 words on average).
    *   Submissions over 12,000 words require strong justification and may be desk rejected.
*   **Stand-Alone Requirement:** Papers must be self-contained. All crucial information must be in the main text; appendices are optional for reviewers.
*   **Format:**
    *   Use the correct href="https://chi2025.acm.org/chi-publication-formats/" - CHI 2025 template .
    *   A single-column format is required for the reviewing phase.
*   **Anonymization:** Submissions must be anonymized according to the href="https://chi2025.acm.org/submission-guides/chi-anonymization-policy/" - Anonymization Policy . Violations may result in desk rejection.
*   **Accessibility:** Follow the href="https://sigchi.org/resources/guides-for-authors/accessibility/" - SIGCHI Guide to an Accessible Submission . Contact accessibility@chi2025.acm.org for assistance.
*   **Inclusivity:** Ensure work and writing are inclusive. Acknowledge if inclusivity is not possible. Use gender-inclusive language.
*   **Large Language Models (LLMs):** Text generated by LLMs must be clearly marked. Refer to ACM's Policy on Authorship and the SIGCHI blog for guidance.
*   **Human Participants:** Research involving human subjects must meet applicable ethics review requirements. Provide a short note to reviewers regarding context.
*   **Concurrent Submissions:** Closely related submissions to other venues must be declared. Failure to do so may result in desk rejection.
*   **Supplementary Materials:** Optional video figures and supplementary materials (code, data, etc.) must also be anonymized. They should not be necessary for understanding the core contribution of the paper.
*   **Submission Portal:** Submissions must be made through the href="https://new.precisionconference.com/" - Precision Conference Submission Portal .

## Review Process

*   **Revise and Resubmit:** Papers exceeding a certain threshold may undergo a revise and resubmit phase.
*   **Quality:** Papers are evaluated for originality, significance, validity, research quality, and presentation clarity.

## Video Presentation (Mandatory)

All accepted authors are required to upload a video presentation by **Thursday, March 13, 2025**.

## Publication

Accepted papers appear in the ACM Digital Library. Authors can choose between Gold and Green open access options. Extended versions may be invited for IARIA Journals.

## Contact Us

*   **Papers Chairs:** Phoebe Toups-Dugas, Bongshin Lee, Marshini Chetty
*   **Email:** href="mailto:papers@chi2025.acm.org" - papers@chi2025.acm.org

© 2025 | ACM SIGCHI

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: CISIS 2025

The **18th International Conference on Computational Intelligence in Security for Information Systems (CISIS 2025)** aims to provide a platform for academic and industry researchers from the fields of Computational Intelligence, Information Security, Cybersecurity, and Data Mining.

The conference will take place in **Salamanca, Spain**, from **October 16-17, 2025**. CISIS 2025 is part of a larger congress including the International Joint Conferences HAIS 2025, SOCO 2025, and ICEUTE 2025.

## About CISIS

CISIS aims to offer a meeting opportunity for academic and industry-related researchers belonging to the various, vast communities of Computational Intelligence, Information Security, Cybersecurity, and Data Mining. The need for intelligent, flexible behaviour by large, complex systems, especially in mission-critical domains, is intended to be the catalyst and the aggregation stimulus for the overall event.

## Topics

For a detailed list of topics, please visit the [Topics page](http://cisisconference.eu/topics/).

## Special Issues

Accepted papers (from the general track and special sessions) will be considered for possible inclusion in a special issue of **Neurocomputing (ELSEVIER)**.

## Special Sessions

Proposals for special sessions are open until **15th March 2025**. Organizers are responsible for:

*   Selecting a topic of interest to delegates.
*   Obtaining a minimum of 5 papers (at least 60% from authors not involved in the session as chairs, team members, or reviewers).
*   Managing the review process within deadlines and providing suitable reviewers.
*   Ensuring final versions of papers are uploaded before the deadline.
*   Attending the conference and chairing the session.
*   Disseminating the call for papers for the special session.

To submit a special session proposal, please send an e-mail to hector.quintian@udc.es including:

*   Title of the special session and selected conference (SOCO’25, CISIS’25, and ICEUTE’25)
*   Name of chair/co-chairs, email/s and affiliation/s
*   A description of the session content (one or two paragraphs).
*   A list of at least 10 international reviewers (including chairs) from at least three different universities (name, family name, email, affiliation).
*   Description of the plan to disseminate the special session (CFPs, etc).

## Important Dates

*   **Special Sessions proposal deadline:** 15th March 2025
*   **Paper submission deadline:** 1st June 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** 15th June 2025
*   **Submission of revised papers:** 30th June 2025
*   **Final version submission:** 5th July 2025
*   **Payment deadline:** 10th July 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** 16th – 17th October 2025

## Paper Submission & Publication

*   **Proceedings:** SOCO’25, CISIS’25, and ICEUTE’25 proceedings will be published by **Springer in Lecture Notes in Networks and Systems (LNNS)**. They will be indexed by SCOPUS, INSPEC, WTI Frankfurt eG, zbMATH, SCImago.
*   **Paper Length:** Papers must be prepared according to the LNNS style template and must be no more than **ten (10) pages long**, including figures and bibliography. Additional pages (over 10 pages) will be charged **150 euros** for each page.
*   **Submission System:** All submissions must be made through the EasyChair system: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cisis2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cisis2025)
*   **Presentation Requirement:** All accepted papers must be presented by one of the authors who must register for the conference and pay the fee.

## Committees

### General Chair
*   Dr. Emilio Corchado (University of Salamanca, Spain)

### Co-Chairs
*   Dr. Alicia Troncoso Lora (Pablo de Olavide University, Spain)
*   Dr. Hilde Pérez García (University of León, Spain)
*   Dr. Esteban Jove (University of A Coruña, Spain)
*   Dr. José Luis Calvo Rolle (University of A Coruña, Spain)
*   Dr. Francisco Javier Martínez de Pisón (University of La Rioja, Spain)
*   Dr. Pablo García Bringas (University of Deusto, Spain)
*   Dr. Francisco Martínez Álvarez (Pablo de Olavide University, Spain)
*   Dr. Alvaro Herrero Cosio (University of Burgos, Spain)
*   Dr. Paolo Fosci (University of Bergamo, Italy)
*   Dr. Héctor Quintián (University of A Coruña, Spain)

## Sponsors

*   Startup OLÉ
*   BISITE

## Contact

For conference-related issues or doubts, please contact: [hector.quintian@udc.es](mailto:hector.quintian@udc.es)

callForPapers:
# CGO 2025: Call for Papers

The International Symposium on Code Generation and Optimization (CGO’25) will be held in **Las Vegas, USA**, from **March 1st to March 5th, 2025**. CGO is the premier venue to bring together researchers and practitioners working at the interface of hardware and software on a wide range of optimization and code generation techniques and related issues. The conference spans the spectrum from purely static to fully dynamic approaches, and from pure software-based methods to specific architectural features and support for code generation and optimization.

CGO will be held in conjunction with PPoPP, CC, and HPCA.

CGO uses a **two-submission-per-year model**. Papers submitted to the first round can either be directly accepted, rejected, or invited to submit a revised version for the second round.

## Topics

Original contributions are solicited on, but not limited to, the following topics:

*   Code Generation, Translation, Transformation, and Optimization for performance, energy, virtualization, portability, security, or reliability concerns, and architectural support
*   Efficient execution of dynamically typed and higher-level languages
*   Optimization and code generation for emerging programming models, platforms, domain-specific languages
*   Dynamic/static, profile-guided, feedback-directed, and machine learning-based optimization
*   Static, Dynamic, and Hybrid Analysis for performance, energy, memory locality, throughput or latency, security, reliability, or functional debugging
*   Program characterization methods
*   Profiling and instrumentation techniques; architectural support
*   Novel and efficient tools
*   Compiler design, practice and experience
*   Compiler abstraction and intermediate representations
*   Vertical integration of language features, representations, optimizations, and runtime support for parallelism
*   Solutions that involve cross-layer (HW/OS/VM/SW) design and integration
*   Deployed dynamic/static compiler and runtime systems for general purpose, embedded system and Cloud/HPC platforms
*   Parallelism, heterogeneity, and reconfigurable architectures
*   Optimizations for heterogeneous or specialized targets, GPUs, SoCs, CGRA and Quantum Computers
*   Compiler support for vectorization, thread extraction, task scheduling, speculation, transaction, memory management, data distribution and synchronization

## Submission Guidelines

### General Requirements

*   The paper must be original material that has not been previously published or is currently under review by another conference or journal.
*   Submissions are limited to **eleven (11) letter-size (8.5"x11") pages**, excluding references. An appendix is allowed with no page limit, but reviewers are not required to read it. Papers must be self-contained.
*   **Format:** ACM format (using the sample-sigplan.tex template).
*   **Language:** English.
*   **File Format:** PDF only.
*   **Printing:** Must be formatted for black-and-white printers; readable graphs are essential; pages must be numbered.
*   **Fonts:** Use of Times, Helvetica, Courier, and Symbol is suggested.

### Double-Blind Review

*   Papers are to be submitted for double-blind review. Author names and identifying information must be removed.
*   Reference prior work by yourself in the third person, as if extending someone else's research.

### Author Responsibilities

*   Authors must register all their conflicts of interest on the submission site.
*   ORCID IDs are required for publication.
*   Authors are subject to all ACM Publications Policies.

## Tool and Practical Experience Papers

*   This category requires either a clear account of a tool's functionality or a summary of practical experience with realistic case studies.
*   **Artifact Evaluation:** Mandatory for Tool Papers; optional for Practical Experience Papers. Successful evaluation is required for final acceptance.
*   **Criteria:** Originality, Usability, Documentation, Benchmark Repository, Availability, Foundations, Artifact Evaluation.
*   Same page limit (11 pages excluding references) and format as regular papers.

## Geographic Diversity and Inclusion

*   Remote presentation is allowed for authors unable to travel due to reasons beyond their control (e.g., visa issues).
*   Efforts will be made to make attendance affordable, especially for students from under-represented countries.

## Artifact Evaluation

*   A separate committee assesses artifacts to improve reproducibility. Papers with successful AE will receive a seal of approval.
*   Authors can indicate interest in submitting an artifact at the time of paper submission.

## Submission Site

*   [https://cgo25-second-round.hotcrp.com/](https://cgo25-second-round.hotcrp.com/)

## Deadlines (AoE - UTC-12h)

**First Submission Round (R1):**

*   **Submission Deadline:** **May 30, 2024**
*   Author Rebuttal Period: July 9-11, 2024
*   Paper Notification: July 22, 2024

**Second Submission Round (R2):**

*   **Submission Deadline:** **September 12, 2024**
*   Author Rebuttal Period: October 22 - 24, 2024
*   Paper Notification: November 4, 2024

## Program Committee

*   **Co-chairs:** Hugh Leather (Meta), P. (Saday) Sadayappan (University of Utah)

(A full list of program committee members is available on the conference website.)

callForPapers:
# IEEE CLOUD 2025: Call for Papers

The IEEE International Conference on Cloud Computing (CLOUD 2025) invites researchers, practitioners, and innovators to submit original papers addressing all aspects of cloud computing infrastructure, technologies, applications, and business innovations.

## Conference Details

*   **Conference:** IEEE International Conference on Cloud Computing (CLOUD 2025)
*   **Part of:** 2025 IEEE World Congress on SERVICES
*   **Dates:** July 7-12, 2025
*   **Location:** Helsinki, Finland
*   **Sponsorship:** Solely sponsored by the IEEE Computer Society under the auspice of the Technical Community on Services Computing (TCSVC).

## Topics of Interest

Topics include, but are not limited to:

### Cloud Architecture and Infrastructure

*   Data center architectures
*   Virtualization and multi-tenancy
*   Cloud storage
*   Cloud-native programming models (serverless, microservices, service mesh, etc.)
*   Software-based networking technologies (SDN, NFV)
*   Multi-cloud and cloud federation environments
*   Private and hybrid cloud environments
*   Edge and fog computing infrastructure

### Cloud Management and Operation

*   Performance monitoring and optimization
*   Fault tolerance, high availability, and reliability
*   Resource allocation and scheduling
*   Load balancing and automated scaling
*   Cost optimization strategies
*   DevOps, CI/CD, IaC and cloud automation
*   Optimizing AI workloads on heterogeneous infrastructure
*   Optimizing heterogeneous infrastructure for AI workloads

### Sustainable Cloud Computing

*   Carbon footprint measurement for hardware and software systems
*   Carbon-aware and grid-aware system management
*   Sustainable data center design
*   Sustainable software development practices for cloud services
*   Energy-efficient service architectures
*   Green cloud architectures and solutions

### Cloud Security and Privacy

*   Trusted environments and Zero trust architectures
*   Identity and access management, authorization, and authentication
*   Assurance, audit, certification, regulatory compliance
*   Privacy-aware and cross-data center data management

### Cloud Computing in Emerging Technologies

*   AI and ML in cloud environments
*   Edge intelligence & AI analytics at the edge
*   IoT cloud platforms
*   Digital twins & metaverse Applications
*   Quantum computing integration
*   5G/6G and cloud integration
*   Blockchain in cloud services

### Cloud Economics

*   Strategies for enterprise business transformation
*   Cloud Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and Service Level Objectives (SLOs)
*   Economic and business models for XaaS (including RoI analysis)
*   Economic models for AI cloud deployments
*   Adaptive pricing strategies
*   Cross-cloud market mechanisms

## Submission Information

*   Authors are invited to prepare early and submit original papers.
*   Submissions can be made through [www.easychair.org](http://www.easychair.org).
*   All submitted manuscripts will be peer-reviewed by at least three reviewers.
*   Accepted and presented papers will appear in the conference proceedings published by the IEEE Computer Society Press.

## Key Dates

*   **Early Bird Registration Deadline:** June 20

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: IEEE International Conference on Cybernetics and Intelligent Systems (SMC 2025)

The 2025 IEEE International Conference on Systems, Man, and Cybernetics (SMC) is the flagship conference of the IEEE Systems, Man, and Cybernetics Society. It provides an international forum for researchers, educators, and practitioners to learn, share knowledge, report most recent innovations and developments, and exchange ideas and advances in all aspects of systems science and engineering, human-machine systems, and cybernetics. The theme of the IEEE SMC 2025 conference is “**Navigating Frontiers: Smart Systems for a Dynamic World**”.

## Submission Guidelines

*   Authors must adhere to the IEEE conference written paper format (including paper title, authors and affiliations, figures, and references).
*   Submit the draft version of the paper for review before the due submission deadlines via the PaperCept submission system.
*   **Templates:** Use the IEEE provided templates in MS Word and LaTeX format. Letter page size should be used. Do not modify the style or format.
    *   [IEEE-ConfPaper-Template-Word.doc](call-for-papers.html?file=files/content/test-files/IEEE-ConfPaper-Template-Word.doc&cid=541)
    *   [IEEE-ConfPaper-Template-LaTeX.zip](call-for-papers.html?file=files/content/test-files/IEEE-ConfPaper-Template-LaTeX.zip&cid=541)
*   Submit only original work, not previously published or copyrighted (including not submitted elsewhere).
*   The conference uses the CrossCheck automated screening system.
*   **Review Process:** Single-blind review process (reviewers are aware of authors' identities, but authors are unaware of reviewers' identities).
*   **Presentation:** Accepted papers must be presented at the conference, either by the authors themselves or via proxy. Non-presented papers will be considered "no-show" and removed from post-conference distribution.
*   **Publication:** Accepted and presented papers will be copyrighted to IEEE and published in conference proceedings, eligible for inclusion in the IEEE Xplore® Digital Library after meeting IEEE quality review requirements. They will also be submitted to Scopus for indexing.

## Submission Portal

*   [PaperCept System](https://conf.papercept.net/conferences/scripts/start.pl)

## Paper Types

*   **Regular Papers:** Full-length papers (up to 6 pages, with max. 2 overlength pages for an extra fee). Papers should be concise but contain sufficient details for critical review. Reviewed (single-blinded) by at least two referees.
*   **Special Sessions Papers:** Focused discussion of new topics. Organizers must collect at least six papers. All submitted special session papers undergo the same review process as regular papers.
*   **Work-in-Progress and Industrial Papers:** For work-in-progress and contributions from industries. Limited to four (4) pages (total length including references). Follow guidelines for regular papers.
*   **Workshop Papers:** For applied research and applications, including work in progress. Undergo the same review process as regular papers.

## Topics

Contributions are invited in theory and practice across the following areas:

### Cybernetics (CYB)

*   Agent-Based Modeling
*   Artificial Immune Systems
*   Artificial Life
*   Biometric Systems and Bioinformatics
*   Cloud IoT and Robotics Integration
*   Complex Network
*   Computational Intelligence
*   Computational Life Science
*   Cybernetics for Informatics
*   Deep Learning
*   Evolutionary Computation
*   Expert and Knowledge-Based Systems
*   Fuzzy Systems and their applications
*   Heuristic Algorithms
*   Hybrid Models of Neural Networks Fuzzy Systems and Evolutionary Computing
*   Image Processing and Pattern Recognition
*   Information Assurance and Intelligence
*   Intelligent Internet Systems
*   Knowledge Acquisition Machine Learning
*   Machine Vision
*   Media Computing
*   Medical Informatics
*   Multimedia Computation
*   Neural Networks and their Applications
*   Optimization and Self-Organization Approaches
*   Quantum Cybernetics
*   Quantum Machine Learning
*   Representation Learning
*   Swarm Intelligence
*   Transfer Learning

### Human-Machine Systems (HMS)

*   Assistive Technology
*   Augmented Cognition
*   Brain-based Information Communications
*   Design Methods
*   Entertainment Engineering
*   Human Factors
*   Human Performance Modeling
*   Human-centered Learning
*   Human-Computer Interaction
*   Human-Machine Cooperation and Systems
*   Human-Machine Interface
*   Information Systems for Design
*   Information Visualization
*   Intelligence Interaction
*   Interactive and Digital Media
*   Interactive Design Science and Engineering
*   Kansei (sense/emotion) Engineering
*   Medical Informatics
*   Multimedia Systems
*   Multi-User Interaction
*   Resilience Engineering
*   Supervisory Control Systems Safety and Security
*   Team Performance and Training Systems
*   User Interface Design
*   Virtual and Augmented Reality Systems
*   Wearable Computing

# HCOMP 2024: Call for Papers

The Twelfth AAAI Conference on Human Computation and Crowdsourcing (HCOMP 2024) will be held **October 16–19, 2024**, in **Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania**. The conference theme is **''Responsible Crowd Work for Better AI.''**

HCOMP is the premier venue for disseminating the latest research findings on human computation and crowdsourcing, promoting interdisciplinary research across AI, HCI, economics, social computing, digital humanities, policy, and ethics.

HCOMP 2024 is colocated with ACM UIST 2024 (October 13-16, 2024).

## Announcements

*   Registration is now open!
*   The HCOMP Test of Time and Award will be announced and given out this year. For more information, check the [technical program](/program.html).

## Quick Links

*   View the [keynote speakers](/keynotes.html).
*   View the list of [accepted papers](/papers.html).
*   View the list of [workshops](/workshops.html).
*   View the [Works-in-Progress](/papers.html#wip).

## Important Dates

All times are midnight AoE:

*   **Abstracts due:** June 5, 2024
*   **Full papers due:** June 12, 2024
*   **Notifications:** July 31, 2024
*   **HCOMP 2024 Conference Dates:** Oct 16–19, 2024

## Stay CONNECTED: HCOMP COMMUNITY

*   **Join crowd-hcomp Google Group:** [crowd-hcomp Google Group](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/crowd-hcomp) (mailing list) to post and receive crowdsourcing and human computation email announcements. To subscribe, send an email to [crowd-hcomp+subscribe@googlegroups.com](crowd-hcomp+subscribe@googlegroups.com).
*   View the [Google Group webpage](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/crowd-hcomp) to view the archive of past communications.
*   Keep track of our twitter hashtag: [#HCOMP2024](https://twitter.com/search?q=%23hcomp2024).
*   Join the [HCOMP Slack Community](https://hcomp.slack.com/) to connect with researchers, industry players, practitioners, and crowd workers.

callForPapers:
# HIC 2025: Call for Papers (CLOSED)

The Health Informatics Conference (HIC) 2025, Australia's leading digital health conference, will be held from **August 18-20, 2025**, at the **Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre, Melbourne, Australia**.

## Key Dates

*   **Call for Submissions opens:** Thursday, 21 November 2024
*   **Submissions close:** Friday, 17 January 2025
*   **Notifications:** Early April 2025
*   **Author revisions:** Mid April 2025
*   **Author registrations for HIC:** by Thursday, 10 July 2025

## Themes

*   Connected care
*   Data and innovation
*   First Nations People data sovereignty
*   Future focus
*   Interoperability
*   Research
*   Workforce models of care
*   Other

## Submission Types and Guidelines

### ACADEMIC

#### Oral Presentation Submission

*   **Content:** Descriptions of original research on the use of information methods, systems, and technologies to improve the quality and safety of care, enhance care outcomes, promote patient-centred care, facilitate translational research, enable precision medicine, and improve education and skills in digital health.
*   **Length:** Maximum of six pages, including references.
*   **Structure:** Abstract (150-200 words), Keywords, Introduction, Methods, Results, Discussion, Conclusions, Acknowledgements, References, and Address for Correspondence.
*   **Students:** Typically have the mentor/teacher/guide as the senior author, along with any other collaborators, mentors, or authors.
*   **Presentation:** Accepted papers will be allocated a 15-minute presentation in the concurrent program.
*   **Publication:** The abstract will be available on the conference app. The paper will be published in IOS Press, Studies in Health Technology and Informatics, unless selected for submission to the Applied Clinical Informatics Journal.
*   **Template:** [HIC-2025-Submission-Template_Abstract.docx](https://digitalhealth.org.au/hic/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2024/11/HIC-2025-Submission-Template_Abstract.docx)
*   **T&Cs:** [HIC-2025-Terms-and-conditions-Academic.pdf](https://digitalhealth.org.au/hic/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2024/11/HIC-2025-Terms-and-conditions-Academic.pdf)

#### Poster Submission Guidelines

*   **Content:** Descriptions of original research on the use of information methods, systems, and technologies to improve the quality and safety of care, enhance care outcomes, promote patient-centred care, facilitate translational research, enable precision medicine, and improve education and skills in informatics.
*   **Length:** Maximum of two pages, including references.
*   **Structure:** Abstract (75-100 words), Keywords, Introduction, Methods, Results, Discussion (may be removed), Conclusions, Acknowledgements, References, and Address for Correspondence.
*   **Students:** Typically have the mentor/teacher/guide as the senior author, along with any other collaborators, mentors, or authors.
*   **Presentation:** Accepted posters will be displayed digitally at HIC2025. An opportunity for pre-recorded audio to accompany the poster will be provided. The poster will be made available on the conference app.
*   **Publication:** The paper will be published in IOS Press, Studies in Health Technology and Informatics.
*   **Template:** [HIC-2025-Submission-Template_Abstract.docx](https://digitalhealth.org.au/hic/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2024/11/HIC-2025-Submission-Template_Abstract.docx)
*   **T&Cs:** [HIC-2025-Terms-and-conditions-Academic.pdf](https://digitalhealth.org.au/hic/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2024/11/HIC-2025-Terms-and-conditions-Academic.pdf)

### CLINICAL & INDUSTRY

#### Oral Presentation Abstract Submission

*   **Purpose:** Have your voice heard, showcase success, share impact, partner with others, stimulate discussion, increase networking.
*   **Abstract Length:** Maximum of 300 words.
*   **Content Guidance:** Describe the problem and healthcare setting, the approach (including technology/principles), implementation/status/outcomes, conclusions, and lessons learnt.
*   **Title:** Include a presentation title in sentence case.
*   **Language:** Check spelling and grammar, replacing American spelling with British English where applicable.
*   **Presentation Length:** 15 minutes for concurrent sessions or 5 minutes for Lightning Talks.
*   **Registration:** Accepted speakers must register and pay to attend the conference.
*   **Review:** Presentations are blind reviewed by a panel of industry leaders.
*   **Template:** [HIC-2025-Submission-Template_Abstract.docx](https://digitalhealth.org.au/hic/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2024/11/HIC-2025-Submission-Template_Abstract.docx)
*   **T&Cs:** [HIC-2025-TC-Industry-and-Clinical.pdf](https://digitalhealth.org.au/hic/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2024/11/HIC-2025-TC-Industry-and-Clinical.pdf)

#### Poster Submission

*   **Content:** Display ideas, innovation, and/or case studies visually. Option to pre-record audio.
*   **Abstract Length:** Maximum of 300 words.
*   **Content Guidance:** Describe the problem and healthcare setting, the approach (including technology/principles), implementation/status/outcomes, conclusions, and lessons learnt.
*   **Title:** Include a presentation title in sentence case.
*   **Language:** Check spelling and grammar, replacing American spelling with British English where applicable.
*   **Display:** Accepted posters will be displayed digitally on the exhibition floor.
*   **Registration:** Accepted speakers must register and pay to attend the conference.
*   **Review:** Presentations are blind reviewed by a panel of industry leaders.
*   **Template:** [HIC-2025-Submission-Template_Abstract.docx](https://digitalhealth.org.au/hic/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2024/11/HIC-2025-Submission-Template_Abstract.docx)
*   **T&Cs:** [HIC-2025-TC-Industry-and-Clinical.pdf](https://digitalhealth.org.au/hic/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2024/11/HIC-2025-TC-Industry-and-Clinical.pdf)

#### Lightning Talk Submission

*   **Purpose:** Deliver an impactful research insight, innovative idea, or compelling case study on the Ignite stage.
*   **Abstract Length:** Maximum of 300 words.
*   **Content Guidance:** Describe the problem and healthcare setting, the approach (including technology/principles), implementation/status/outcomes, conclusions, and lessons learnt.
*   **Title:** Include a presentation title in sentence case.
*   **Language:** Check spelling and grammar, replacing American spelling with British English where applicable.
*   **Presentation Length:** 10 minutes.
*   **Registration:** Accepted speakers must register and pay to attend the conference.
*   **Review:** Presentations are blind reviewed by a panel of industry leaders.
*   **Template:** [HIC-2025-Submission-Template_Abstract.docx](https://digitalhealth.org.au/hic/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2024/11/HIC-2025-Submission-Template_Abstract.docx)
*   **T&Cs:** [HIC-2025-TC-Industry-and-Clinical.pdf](https://digitalhealth.org.au/hic/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2024/11/HIC-2025-TC-Industry-and-Clinical.pdf)

### INDUSTRY

#### Learning Lab Submission

*   **Format:** Immersive, interactive, and practical workshops.
*   **Duration:** 90 minutes.
*   **Facilitators:** Led by expert facilitators with hands-on learning activities.
*   **Content:** Clearly articulated learning outcomes, problem-solving activities, case studies, or real-world scenarios.
*   **Guidelines:**
    *   Use only the provided template.
    *   Include brief biographies and specific contributions of facilitators.
    *   Basic AV equipment provided; additional equipment may incur costs.
    *   **Template:** [HIC-2025-Submission-Template_Learning-Lab.pdf](https://digitalhealth.org.au/hic/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2024/11/HIC-2025-Submission-Template_Learning-Lab.pdf)
    *   **T&Cs:** [HIC-2025-TC-Industry-and-Clinical.pdf](https://digitalhealth.org.au/hic/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2024/11/HIC-2025-TC-Industry-and-Clinical.pdf)

## Registration Information

*   Early bird registration deadline: **10 July 2025**.
*   [REGISTER TODAY](https://digitalhealth.org.au/hic/register/)

## Contact Information

For conference enquiries, please contact the Events Team via [events@digitalhealth.org.au](mailto:events@digitalhealth.org.au).

callForPapers:
# HLPP 2025: Call for Papers

The **18th International Symposium on High-level Parallel Programming and Applications (HLPP 2025)** will be held as a two-day event, hosted by the Computer Science Department of the University of Innsbruck in Austria, from **July 3-4, 2025**.

HLPP focuses on high-level parallel programming of multi-/many-core platforms, accelerator architectures, heterogeneous compute clusters, and highly parallel or distributed infrastructures. It serves as a forum for researchers and engineers in parallel computing, offering an excellent opportunity to present latest ideas and findings. The symposium especially encourages innovative approaches in parallel programming models and applications, high-level parallel languages, compilers, runtime systems, and programming tools for all classes of parallel machines.

HLPP 2025 aims to deliver an enriching conference experience, featuring impactful research, constructive discussions, and valuable networking opportunities.

## Keynote Speakers

*   **Prof. Dr. Gabriele Keller** from Utrecht University, Netherlands
*   **Prof. Dr. Martin Schulz** from the Technical University of Munich, Germany

## Important Dates

*   **Submissions closed:** May 12, 2025
*   **Author notification:** June 6, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** July 3-4, 2025
*   **Journal Special Issue paper submission:** End of September 2025

## Submission and Review Process

*   **Paper Length:** Up to **20 pages** including figures, tables, and references.
*   **Formatting:** Papers should adhere to the [Springer-Nature journal format](https://www.springernature.com/gp/authors/campaigns/latex-author-support#c17590862).
*   **Review Process:** Each paper will be peer-reviewed by at least three reviewers using a **single-blind review** process.
*   **Submission System:** Submissions are handled via EasyChair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=hlpp2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=hlpp2025)

## Registration

Registration for HLPP 2025 is now open. You can register [here](/hlpp-2025/registration).

## Program

The full program for HLPP 2025 is now available [here](/hlpp-2025/program). Please note that there may still be minor changes to the schedule.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The Twenty-sixth International Workshop on Mobile Computing Systems and Applications (ACM HotMobile 2025)

Sponsored by ACM SIGMOBILE

**Dates:** February 26-27, 2025
**Location:** Palm Springs, CA

## Workshop Focus

HotMobile 2025 continues the series of highly selective, interactive workshops focused on mobile applications, systems, and environments, as well as their underlying state-of-the-art technologies. Its small workshop format makes it ideal for presenting and discussing new directions or controversial approaches.

## Solicited Submissions

We solicit submissions of papers that focus primarily on systems and applications and propose new directions of research, advocate non-traditional approaches, or generate controversy and discussion. We encourage early work and papers likely to stimulate reflection and discussion.

Additionally, HotMobile seeks proposals for posters and live demonstrations describing novel work on mobile systems, applications, and services. Posters are suited for controversial work or promising new ideas, while live demos showcase feasibility and usefulness.

## Topics of Interest

We take a broad view of Mobile Systems research, including:

*   Novel applications, environments, and devices supporting mobility.
*   Operating system and distributed system support for mobile computing.
*   Wearable computing, internet of things, edge computing, sensing, and context-awareness.
*   HCI issues related to mobile computing.
*   Security and privacy of mobile computing.
*   Management, configuration, and deployment of systems supporting mobility.
*   Wireless technology, as it pertains to mobile systems and applications.
*   Social issues related to mobile computing.
*   System and application support for the use of ML and AI on mobile platforms.

## Important Dates

*   **Paper submission (original deadline):** ~~October 11, 2024~~ 
*   **Poster/Demo submission (extended):** January 20, 2025
*   **Notification of acceptance (Posters/Demos):** January 22, 2025
*   **Camera-ready deadline (Posters/Demos):** January 24, 2025
*   **Workshop Dates:** February 26-27, 2025

## Submission Guidelines

### For Papers

*   **Length:** Submissions should contain 6 or fewer U.S. letter pages, including all references, figures, and tables.
*   **Anonymity:** Submissions should **not** be anonymous.
*   **Formatting:**
    *   Font size no smaller than 10pt.
    *   Font size of the bibliography no smaller than 9pt.
    *   Double column format with each column having dimensions 9.25 inches x 3.33 inches, a space of 0.33 inches between the two columns, and with no more than 55 lines of text per column.
    *   Fit properly on US letter-sized paper (8.5 inches x 11 inches).
*   **Template:** We recommend the use of the "sigconf" ACM proceedings template, available at: [http://www.acm.org/](http://www.acm.org/).
*   **Submission Site:** [https://hotmobile2025.hotcrp.com/](https://hotmobile2025.hotcrp.com/) (Account creation required).
*   **Confidentiality:** Submissions will be handled as confidential material during the review.
*   **Originality:** Papers must not have been published elsewhere and may not be simultaneously under submission at another venue. Papers accompanied by nondisclosure agreement forms are not acceptable.
*   **Publication:** Accepted papers will be publicly available from the workshop's website for a limited time.

### For Posters and Demos

*   **Abstract Length:** Submissions must include an extended abstract no longer than one 8.5x11-inch page, including all figures and references.
*   **Submission Site:** [https://hotmobile25-posterdemo.hotcrp.com/](https://hotmobile25-posterdemo.hotcrp.com/)
*   **Formatting:**
    *   US letter size (8.5x11 inches).
    *   Two columns, using 10-pt font size for the text body, with at least one-inch margin on all sides.
    *   Submissions must be in Adobe PDF format.
*   **Content:** Include the title of the poster/demo and the author list, including affiliations in both the PDF file and in the body of the email. Prefix your title with “Poster:” for a poster submission and “Demo:” for a demo submission. Please do not anonymize your submissions.
*   **Final Version:** Accepted posters and demos will need to submit a one-page version using 9-pt font size.
*   **Demo Video:** For demo submissions, an optional companion video (no more than one minute) is encouraged, highlighting technical contributions. Include the YouTube URL in the extended abstract.
*   **Publication:** Accepted posters and demos will be published in the proceedings.
*   **Award:** This year's poster/demo session will feature a Best Poster/Demo award.

**Note:** Presenting at HotMobile is a good way to get early feedback on research ideas. A full-length paper on the same topic submitted to a conference in less than a year is unlikely to include sufficient new material.
