callForPapers:
# HotNets 2025: Call for Papers

The 24th ACM Workshop on Hot Topics in Networks (HotNets 2025) will bring together researchers to engage in a lively debate on the theory and practice of computer networking and networked systems. HotNets provides a venue to discuss innovative ideas and debate future research agendas for the field.

## Overview

We invite researchers and practitioners to submit short position papers. We encourage submissions that identify fundamental open questions, advocate for new approaches, offer constructive critiques of the state of networking research, re-frame or debunk existing work, report unexpected early results from a deployment, report promising but unproven ideas, or propose new evaluation methods. Authors need not support their ideas with full evaluations; well-reasoned arguments or preliminary evaluations are sufficient support for the possibility of the paper's claims in HotNets.

We seek interesting ideas over incremental, well-baked systems. An ideal submission has the potential to open a line of inquiry for the networking and adjacent communities. We strongly discourage "conference papers in the miniature." The program committee will explicitly favor early work and papers likely to stimulate reflection and discussion, ideally benefiting the networking community broadly, over incremental work that is ready for publication at a conference.

HotNets takes a broad view of networking research. The scope includes (but is not limited to) new ideas that relate to mobile, wide-area, data-center, home, and enterprise networks and that use a variety of link technologies (e.g. wired, wireless, optical, visual, and acoustic), as well as social networks and network architecture. HotNets encompasses all aspects of networks, which include (but is not limited to) packet-processing and transmission hardware and software, virtualization, mobility, provisioning and resource management, performance, energy consumption, sustainability, topology, robustness, measurement, diagnosis, verification, privacy, security, economics and evolution, theory, usability, machine learning, and interactions with applications.

This year, the program committee will do an initial fast round of reviewing that will provide early rejection or advancement to later rounds of more traditional, thorough reviewing. The program committee will select papers based on originality, likelihood to stimulate insightful discussion, and technical merit. Accepted papers will be posted online prior to the workshop and will be published in the ACM Digital Library to facilitate wide dissemination of the ideas discussed at the workshop.

## Important Dates

*   **Paper submission deadline:** July 9, 2025 (23:59 AoE)
*   **Author notification:** September 19, 2025

## Submission and Formatting

*   Papers should be formatted according to the **two-column ACM proceedings format**.
*   Each paper should have no more than **6 pages**, excluding references, in **10 point font**. There is no limit on the page count for references, however appendices are not allowed.
*   Papers must contain novel ideas and must differ significantly in content from previously published papers.
*   All submissions must be **blind**: they must not indicate the names or affiliations of the authors in the paper.
*   Only electronic submissions in **PDF** will be accepted.
*   Submissions must be written in English, render without error using standard tools (e.g., Acrobat Reader), and print on US Letter paper.
*   Each reference must list all authors of the paper (i.e., do not use "et al."). The citations should be in numeric style, e.g., [52].
*   Please ensure that figures and tables are legible, even after the paper is printed in gray-scale.
*   Papers that exceed the length requirement or deviate from the expected format will be rejected.

A LaTeX class file that follows the prescribed submission format is available: [hotnets25-template.zip](https://hotnets.acm.org/2025/docs/hotnets25-template.zip)

For the LaTeX template, the first two lines should be:
```latex
\documentclass[sigconf, 10pt, anonymous, nonacm]{acmart}
       \settopmatter{printfolios=true, printccs=false, printacmref=false}
```

Submit papers on the [HotCRP](https://hotnets25.hotcrp.com/).

## Policies

### Policy on Concurrent Submissions

Concurrent submissions to HotNets 2025 and any other peer-reviewed venue that cover the same work (differences in the degree of detail given the two venues' length limits notwithstanding) are prohibited, and will result in the immediate rejection of the HotNets submission in question. "Concurrent" means any other peer-reviewed venue whose reviewing period (i.e., between submission and notification) overlaps with that of HotNets. The "same work" means, for example, a submission overlapping significantly in content with a conference submission. However, a position paper submitted to HotNets (e.g., that reflects broadly on the state of some aspect of the field, adopts a position as to how the field should move forward, or articulates a broad avenue of future work) will not be considered the "same work" as a conference-length paper on a specific system that addresses a point under the broad umbrella covered by the position paper. Authors with questions about this policy should contact the PC co-chairs before submitting.

### Ethical Concerns

As part of the submission process, authors must attest that their work complies with all applicable ethical standards of their home institution(s), including, but not limited to privacy policies and policies on experiments involving humans. Note that submitting research for approval by one's institution's ethics review body is necessary, but not sufficient – in cases where the PC has concerns about the ethics of the work in a submission, the PC will have its own discussion of the ethics of that work. The PC takes a broad view of what constitutes an ethical concern, and authors agree to be available at any time during the review process to rapidly respond to queries from the PC chairs regarding ethical standards.

## Workshop Participation

HotNets attendance is limited to roughly 90 people in person to facilitate a lively discussion (potentially with additional virtual participants). In-person invitations will be allocated first to one author of each paper, HotNets organizers and committee members, and conference sponsors. We require the paper presentations to be in-person (if authors have any concerns about this, they are welcome to contact the PC chairs). To promote an inclusive workshop, HotNets will also make a limited number of open registration slots for in-person attendance available to the community.

## Location

Stamp Student Union at University of Maryland
3972 Campus Dr, College Park, MD, USA 20742

[Directions to Stamp Student Union](https://maps.google.com/?q=Stamp+Student+Union+at+University+of+Maryland+3972+Campus+Dr+College+Park+MD+20742)

Remote Attendance: TBD.

## Event Information

HotNets 2025 will be an in-person event.

callForPapers:
# HPCC 2025: Call for Papers

The **27th IEEE International Conference on High Performance Computing and Communications (HPCC-2025)** will be held from **13-15 August 2025** in **Exeter, England, UK**.

IEEE HPCC-2025 is sponsored by **IEEE**, **IEEE Computer Society**, and **IEEE Technical Committee on Scalable Computing (TCSC)**.

## Introduction

With the rapid growth in computing and communications technology, the past decade has witnessed a proliferation of powerful parallel and distributed systems and an ever increasing demand for practice of high performance computing and communications (HPCC). HPCC has moved into the mainstream of computing and has become a key technology in determining future research and development activities in many academic and industrial branches, especially when the solution of large and complex problems must cope with very tight timing schedules.

Among a series of highly successful International Conferences on High Performance Computing and Communications (HPCC), the HPCC-2025 conference is the 27th edition of a forum for engineers and scientists in academia, industry, and government to address the resulting profound challenges and to present and discuss their new ideas, research results, applications and experience on all aspects of high performance computing and communications.

Prospective authors are invited to submit their papers to HPCC-2025. Accepted papers will be submitted for inclusion into IEEE Xplore subject to meeting IEEE Xplore’s scope and quality requirements. The authors of selected best papers will be invited post conference to extend their contributions for special issues of prestigious journals to be planned in conjunction with the conference.

## Scope and Topics

Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

### Track 1: High Performance Computing and Applications

*   High Performance Computing Theory
*   High Performance Computing Architectures
*   System Software and Middleware
*   System Software Support for Scientific Workflows
*   Storage and I/O Systems
*   Resource Management
*   Instruction-Level and Thread-Level Parallelism
*   Performance Modeling and Evaluation
*   Massively Multicore Systems
*   Future Novel Computing Platforms
*   Database Applications and Data Mining
*   High Performance Computing for Bioinformatics
*   High Performance Computing for Big Data
*   High Performance Computing for AI
*   High Performance Computing for Block Chains
*   Green High Performance Computing

### Track 2: Parallel and Distributed Computing and Systems

*   Parallel and Distributed System Architectures
*   Parallel and Distributed Algorithms
*   Data Center Architectures
*   Resource Virtualization
*   Web Services and Internet Computing
*   Cloud Computing
*   Grid and Cluster Computing
*   Federated Learning
*   Embedded Systems
*   Distributed Systems and Applications
*   Pervasive/Ubiquitous Computing & Intelligence
*   Distributed Graphics and VR/AR/MR Systems
*   Distributed AI and Soft/Natural Computing
*   Power-Efficient and Green Computing Systems
*   Parallel and Distributed Computing for Big Data
*   Parallel and Distributed Computing for AI

### Track 3: Communications and Networking

*   Network and Interconnect Architectures
*   Computer Networks
*   Internet Architectures and Protocols
*   Telecommunications
*   Trust, Security, and Privacy
*   Energy-Aware Computing and Networking
*   5G Network
*   Software Defined Networking
*   Network Functions Virtualization
*   Machine Learning and Deep Learning
*   Social Networking and Computing
*   Performance Evaluation and Measurement

### Track 4: Computing Power Network(CPN) and Network for AI Computing

*   Computing and network convergence technology for AI application
*   Resource allocation and collaboration in CPN
*   Computing power identification and measurement technology
*   Lossless network design
*   Technology for RDMA
*   IPv6/SRv6-based hyperscale AI Datacenter

## Important Dates

*   **Workshop Proposal:** **1 March 2025**
*   **Submission Deadline:** **18 May 2025** (Firm Deadline - extended from 30 April 2025)
*   **Authors Notification:** **15 June 2025**
*   **Final Manuscript Due:** **15 July 2025**
*   **Registration Due:** **15 July 2025**

## Sponsors

*   IEEE
*   IEEE Computer Society
*   IEEE Technical Committee on Scalable Computing (TCSC)

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers and Discussions

The 20th Workshop on Hot Topics in Operating Systems (HotOS XX) solicits **position papers** proposing new directions of systems research, advocating innovative approaches to long-standing problems, or reporting on deep insights gained from experience with real-world systems. The program committee will explicitly favor papers likely to stimulate reflection and discussion. Early-stage work where authors can benefit from community feedback is highly encouraged.

HotOS takes a broad view of systems research, encompassing operating systems, storage, distributed systems, mobile and embedded systems, virtualization, programming languages, networking, security, dependability, and manageability. It also welcomes contributions influenced by fields such as hardware design, machine learning, verification, economics, social organization, and nontraditional computing systems.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Research and Position Papers:**
    *   Length: No longer than **5 pages** including figures and tables, plus as many pages as needed for references.
    *   Formatting: Adhere to ACM's formatting conventions using the `acmart` style (`\documentclass[sigconf,10pt]{acmart}`). This includes 10-point font, two columns, 8.5x11-inch paper, 10-point Times Roman or Libertine font on 12-point leading, 0.75-inch margins, and a 0.33-inch gutter.
    *   Anonymity: Submissions must be **double blind**. Authors must make a good faith effort to anonymize their submissions, avoiding explicit or implicit self-identification in references or acknowledgments. Pages should be numbered. Figures and tables must be legible in black and white.
    *   Rejection: Submissions not meeting these criteria will be rejected without review; no deadline extensions will be granted for reformatting.
    *   ORCID ID: Authors must obtain an ORCID ID for the publishing process.

*   **Panel and Event Proposals:**
    *   Length: 1-page proposal (using the same format as papers) plus pages for references and supporting letters.
    *   Anonymity: Unlike papers, panel and event proposals need **not be anonymous** (i.e., they may be single blind).
    *   Evaluation: Proposals will be evaluated based on topic relevance and potential to engage the audience. Topics such as industry perspectives on systems research, diversity and inclusion, under-appreciated open source technologies, and hardware trends are encouraged.

## Key Dates

*   **Paper or Panel Proposal Submission Deadline:** **January 15, 2025** (AoE)
*   **Author Notifications:** April 1, 2025
*   **Camera-ready Deadline:** April 15, 2025
*   **Workshop Dates:** May 14–16, 2025

## Submission Method

Submissions must be in PDF format via the web submission form: [https://hotos25.hotcrp.com/](https://hotos25.hotcrp.com/). Select your submission type (paper or proposal) on the form.

## Attendance and Registration

HotOS will be an **in-person workshop**. At least one author of each accepted paper is expected to present and participate. Alternatives may be considered in extreme cases (e.g., visa issues) upon contacting the chairs.

Registration will be limited to encourage deeper discussion. At least two authors per accepted paper will receive invitations to attend if desired. A separate invitation request process will be announced for non-authors, including students and industry practitioners.

## Policy

*   **Simultaneous submission, previously published work, or plagiarism** constitutes dishonesty and is prohibited. Prior or concurrent publication in non-peer-reviewed contexts (like arXiv) is permitted, but the submission must use an anonymized project name.
*   Authors are subject to all ACM Publications Policies, including those on Research Involving Human Participants and Subjects.

callForPapers:
# HPDC 2025: Call for Papers

## Overview

The ACM International Symposium on High-Performance Parallel and Distributed Computing (HPDC) is the premier annual conference for presenting the latest research on the design, implementation, evaluation, and use of parallel and distributed systems for high-end computing. The 34th HPDC will take place in **Notre Dame, Indiana, United States, July 20-23, 2025**.

## Scope and Topics

Submissions are welcomed on high-performance parallel and distributed computing (HPDC) topics including but not limited to: clouds, clusters, grids, big data, massively multicore, and extreme-scale computing systems. Experience reports of operational deployments that provide significantly novel insights for future research on HPDC applications and systems are also welcome.

In the context of high-performance parallel and distributed computing, the topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   Datacenter, HPC, cloud, serverless, and edge/IoT computing platforms
*   Heterogeneous computing accelerators and non-volatile memory systems
*   File and storage systems, I/O, and data management
*   Operating systems and networks
*   System software and middleware for parallel and distributed systems
*   Programming languages and runtime systems
*   Big data stacks and big data ecosystems
*   Scientific applications, algorithms, and workflows
*   Resource management and scheduling
*   Performance modeling, benchmarking, and engineering
*   Fault tolerance, reliability, and availability
*   Operational guarantees, risk assessment, and management
*   Energy efficiency and sustainability
*   AI topics, which must relate to parallel and distributed computing systems
*   Novel post-Moore computing technologies including neuromorphic, brain-inspired computing, and quantum computing

HPDC welcomes submissions that utilize AI to enhance the above topics of interest or that utilize distributed systems to enhance AI frameworks, but it is highlighted that an HPDC submission must address and articulate its connection with parallel and distributed computing research.

## Important Dates (AoE)

*   **Workshop and Tutorial Proposal Submission Deadline:** December 9, 2024
*   **Notification of Acceptance (Workshops and Tutorials):** December 16, 2024
*   **Paper Submission Deadline (Technical Papers):** February 6, 2025
*   **HPDC 2025 Achievement Award Nomination Deadline:** February 28, 2025
*   **Poster Submission Deadline:** March 13, 2025
*   **Notification for HPDC 2025 Achievement Award:** March 21, 2025
*   **Notification of Acceptance (Technical Papers):** April 4, 2025
*   **Notification of Acceptance (Posters):** April 7, 2025
*   **Travel Grant Application Deadline:** April 13, 2025
*   **Notification of Awards (Travel Grant):** April 21, 2025
*   **Camera-ready Version (Technical Papers):** May 1, 2025
*   **Hotel Booking Deadline:** June 20, 2025
*   **Late Registration Deadline:** June 23, 2025

## Paper Submission Categories

Submissions to HPDC can be made in one of the following two categories:

1.  **Regular Papers:** The primary focus should be to describe new research ideas supported by experimental implementation and evaluation.
2.  **Open-source Tools and Data Papers:** The primary focus should be to describe the design, development, and evaluation of new open-source tools or novel data sources.

Authors are required to indicate the category of the paper in the title (e.g., "Paper Type: Regular" or "Paper Type: Open-source tools and data paper"). Submissions in both categories will be evaluated to the same standards. The chosen category at the time of submission cannot be changed after the submission deadline.

## ACM Publication

Papers accepted and presented at HPDC 2025 will be published in the ACM Digital Library at no additional cost to the authors.

## Submission Guidelines

*   Authors are invited to submit technical papers of at most **11 pages** in PDF format, excluding references.
*   Accepted papers will have the flexibility to use an additional page in the camera-ready to incorporate feedback from the reviewers.
*   Papers should be formatted in the ACM Proceedings Style (using `sigconf` from [ACM Proceedings Template](https://www.acm.org/publications/proceedings-template)).
*   Submitted papers must be original work that has not appeared in and is not under consideration for another conference or a journal.

## Anonymizing Submissions

HPDC uses **dual-anonymous reviewing**. Avoid identifying yourself or your institution explicitly or by implication (e.g., through references or acknowledgments).

*   The first page should use the paper ID assigned during registration in place of author names.
*   Reference your past work in the third person, as you would any other piece of related work.
*   If your submission extends a previous workshop paper or relates to a submission under review, cite the other work anonymously and email the deanonymized work to the PC chairs.
*   If your submission reports on experiences with a system at your institution, refer to the system anonymously but describe the properties needed for evaluation.
*   Tool/data papers should also adhere to the double-blind submission policy.

## arXiv Submission Policy

Having an arXiv paper does not prohibit submission to HPDC. arXiv papers are not peer-reviewed and do not count as prior work. Authors are encouraged to use preventive measures to reduce the chances of accidental breach of anonymity (e.g., use a different title in the submission and do not upload/revise the arXiv version during the review period).

## Author List After Acceptance

The author list cannot be changed after acceptance.

## Conflict of Interest Declaration

At the time of submission, all authors must indicate their conflict of interest with PC members (institutional, collaborative, or personal).

## HPDC Policy on the use of AI

*   HPDC permits the use of AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Grammarly) for language rectification. Authors are responsible for the accuracy of the content.
*   AI tools are not eligible for authorship.
*   The use of any AI-generated text must be disclosed in the acknowledgments section, citing the AI system used. The acknowledgment section must still follow dual-anonymous submission guidelines.

## ACM Policy on Authorship

Refer to the [ACM Policy on Authorship](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/frequently-asked-questions) for all other guidelines, including policies on the use of generative AI tools.

## Contact PC Chairs

*   Ivona Brandić (ivona.brandic@tuwien.ac.at)
*   Robert Wisniewski (bobww123@gmail.com)

## Submissions

Click the button below to access the submission site:

[HPDC Submission Site](https://hpdc.sci.utah.edu/submission)

## Suggestions for Document Preparation for Authors

HPDC authors are encouraged to structure their introduction section as follows:

*   **Motivation:** State the objective and provide quantitative support.
*   **Limitation of state-of-art approaches:** Review prior works and articulate limitations.
*   **Key insights and contributions:** Specify novelty and contributions.
*   **Experimental methodology and artifact availability:** Specify infrastructure and methodology, indicate artifact availability.
*   **Limitations of the proposed approach:** Articulate limitations and conclusions sensitive to assumptions.

This format is a suggestion and not a requirement.

## Ethical Considerations

If your research describes a new security-related attack, please consider adding information about responsible disclosure. The paper should follow ethical principles and not alter security/privacy/equality expectations of users.

## Inclusive Description of Research Contributions

Consider using gender-neutral pronouns, diverse examples, engaging users from diverse backgrounds, and making the paper accessible to visually impaired or color-blind readers.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

IntelliSys 2025 focuses on intelligent systems and artificial intelligence and how they apply to the real world. IntelliSys provides a leading international forum that brings together researchers and practitioners from diverse fields with the purpose of exploring the fundamental roles, interactions, as well as practical impacts of Artificial Intelligence. It is part of the conference series started in 2013. The conference highlights groundbreaking advancements in generative AI, LLMs, and machine learning. The program will include paper presentations, poster sessions, and project demonstrations, along with prominent keynote speakers and industrial workshops. All submitted papers will be reviewed by experts in the field based on the criteria of originality, significance, quality, and clarity.

## Submission Rounds

### Round 1

*   **Submission Deadline:** **15 December 2024**
*   **Acceptance Notification:** **15 January 2025**
*   **Camera Ready Submission:** **15 February 2025**
*   **Conference Dates:** **28-29 August 2025**

### Round 2

*   **Submission Deadline:** **15 March 2025**
*   **Acceptance Notification:** **15 April 2025**
*   **Camera Ready Submission:** **01 May 2025**
*   **Conference Dates:** **28-29 August 2025**

## Downloads

*   Download MS Word Paper Format
*   Download Latex Paper Format
*   Download Presentation Format

## Submission Process

Authors are invited to submit their fully formatted papers, complete with results, tables, figures, and references. All paper submissions will be double-blind peer reviewed and evaluated based on originality, research content, correctness, relevance to conference theme, and readability. Please review the full call for papers guidelines before submitting.

*   **Online Submission:** Paper Submission can be completed online at [www.SAIConference.com/IntelliSys/Submit](www.SAIConference.com/IntelliSys/Submit)
*   **Email Submission:** If you experience difficulties with the online system, you may submit via email to [IntelliSys@SAIConference.com](mailto:IntelliSys@SAIConference.com) ensuring all required details are included.

## Submission Guidelines

*   Accepted formats: `.docx`, `.doc`, `.pdf`, or LaTeX PDF.
*   To comply with the double-blind peer review process, please refrain from including author details, university, country information, or any other author-related information in the paper.
*   Prior to submission, authors are responsible for ensuring their papers are thoroughly checked and proofread. Once submitted, no revisions are permitted during the review process. If accepted, the authors may make minor revisions before final publication to address any identified areas for improvement.
*   At the time of camera-ready submission, please include complete author information as per the paper format.
*   Submissions should be primarily original work. No more than 25% of the text can be drawn from previously published material by the same authors, and any such reuse must be properly cited. Therefore, at least 75% of the manuscript must consist of new, unpublished content.

## Formatting Guidelines

*   Manuscripts should generally be limited to **18 pages** for the main text (excluding references and appendices). Submissions exceeding this limit may be considered at the chair's discretion, particularly for review or survey articles.
*   Manuscripts must present original work and fall within the scope of the conference topics.
*   It is the authors' responsibility to ensure the accuracy of all quotations, citations, figures, maps, and tables within their manuscript.
*   Figures and tables must be positioned within the manuscript where they are discussed and should be clear and easily readable.
*   The manuscript must adhere to the provided template.

## Review Process

Submissions will be reviewed anonymously (double-blind). Therefore, your manuscript must not reveal your identity or affiliation. Specifically: omit author names and affiliations from the manuscript; anonymize citations and mentions of your own prior work that is closely related to the submitted paper; and exclude funding or other acknowledgments.

Each paper will undergo review by at least three regular program committee members or two senior program committee members. Acceptance will be based on:

*   **Novelty:** The paper should explore a new idea, project, or issue; offer new insights on existing research; present new research; or provide a novel perspective on existing information.
*   **Engaging:** The presentation should be interactive and engage the readers.
*   **Significant:** The paper should address and discuss key issues related to improving the effectiveness of current techniques, and its content should be easily understood and widely applicable.
*   **Quality:** Claims made in the paper must be substantiated with adequate data, reference relevant existing work, and honestly acknowledge any limitations.
*   **Clear:** The intended outcomes should be easily understood.
*   **Relevant:** The paper's topic must be relevant to at least one of the conference's designated tracks.

## Post Conference Publication and Indexing

IntelliSys 2025 proceedings will be published in Springer series "Lecture Notes in Networks and Systems" and submitted for indexing to Web of Science, SCOPUS, INSPEC, WTI Frankfurt eG, zbMATH and SCImago.

## Best Paper/Poster Awards

The SAI Conference Awards recognize the authors of the best paper and poster presented at the annual conference. Winners receive a trophy and a certificate detailing the award, which are presented during the conference's closing session.

## Conference Tracks

*   **Artificial Intelligence**

callForPapers:
# Call For Papers

The 31st IEEE International Symposium on High-Performance Computer Architecture (HPCA) will be held in **Las Vegas, NV** from **March 1st to March 5th, 2025**.

HPCA is a high-impact premier venue for presenting research results on a wide range of computer architecture topics.

## Topics of Interest

*   Processor, memory, and storage systems architecture
*   Instruction-, thread-, and data-level parallelism
*   Interconnection networks and network interface architecture
*   Domain-specific architectures and Accelerators
*   FPGA, CGRA, and Reconfigurable systems
*   Near/In-Memory computing
*   Cloud, Datacenters, cluster/distributed systems
*   Approximate computing
*   Compilers/Languages/Runtimes for novel architectures
*   IoT, Mobile, Edge, and Embedded architectures
*   Effects of circuits or technology on architecture (3D/chiplets/interposer/wafer-scale)
*   Architecture modeling and simulation methodologies
*   Neuromorphic computing
*   Quantum, Superconducting and Emerging technologies impacting computer architectures
*   Reliability/Fault Tolerance, Energy Efficiency and Sustainability of Computer Systems
*   Security/Privacy
*   Evaluation and measurement of real computing systems

## Industry Track

HPCA 2025 features a separate Industry Track with a separate call for papers. The goal of the HPCA Industry Track is to publish papers that are written by industry authors and their content relates to industrial products/processes.

## Important Dates

### Research Papers

*   **Abstract Deadline:** **July 26, 2024**
*   **Paper Submission:** **August 2, 2024**
*   **Revision/Rebuttal Period:** October 4, 2024 - October 16, 2024
*   **Notification:** November 5, 2024

### Industry Track

*   **Abstract Deadline:** **September 9, 2024**
*   **Paper Submission:** **September 16, 2024**
*   **Revision/Rebuttal Period:** November 8, 2024 - November 15, 2024
*   **Notification:** November 26, 2024

### General

*   **Final Papers Due:** January 17, 2025
*   **Conference Date:** March 1, 2025 - March 5, 2025

## Submission Guidelines

### Paper Registration and Abstract Submission

*   Please make the paper title as close to the final version as possible.
*   The author list should not change (order of authors can) after registration. If there is a change, you should send an email indicating the change at least 48 hours before the paper submission deadline to the PC chair.
*   Consequently the Conflict List should also be finalized by the abstract registration. Please ensure it is accurate at the time of registration.
*   Please make the abstract as close to the final version as possible.

*Flagrant violation of the above could result in an outright rejection of the submission*

### Paper Format

*   Papers must be submitted in printable **PDF format**.
*   Text must be in a minimum **10pt font**.
*   Papers must be at most **11 pages**, not including references.
*   Line spacing (leading) must be no less than **12pt**.
*   No page limit for references.
*   References must include all authors (i.e., do not use et al.).

### Templates and Submission Site

*   Download LaTeX Template: [hpca2025-latex-template.zip](https://hpca-conf.org/2025/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/hpca2025-latex-template.zip)
*   Sample Paper: [HPCA_2025_template.pdf](https://hpca-conf.org/2025/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/HPCA_2025_template-2.pdf)
*   Paper Registration/Submission Site: [Upload Abstracts and Papers to HotCRP](http://hpca2025.hotcrp.com/)

## Paper Evaluation Objectives

The committee will make every effort to judge each submitted paper on its own merits. There will be no target acceptance rate. We expect to accept a wide range of papers with appropriate expectations for evaluation – while papers that build on significant past work with strong evaluations are valuable, papers that open new areas with less rigorous evaluation are equally welcome and especially encouraged. We also acknowledge the wide range of evaluation methodologies in HPCA including modeling, simulation, prototyping, experimental implementation, real product evaluation, etc.

## Paper Formatting Details

*   **Page Limit:** 11 pages, not including references.
*   **Paper Size:** US Letter: 8.5in x 11in
*   **Margins:** Top/Bottom: 0.7in / 1in, Left/Right: 0.7in
*   **Body:** 2-column, single spaced
*   **Space Between Columns:** 0.1in
*   **Line Spacing (Leading):** 12pt
*   **Body Font:** 10pt, Times
*   **Abstract Font:** 9pt, Times, Bold
*   **Section Heading Font:** 12pt, Small caps, Roman numbering (I, II, …)
*   **Subsection Heading Font:** 10pt, Italic, Alpha numbering (A, B, …)
*   **Caption Font:** 9pt (minimum)
*   **References:** 8pt, no page limit, list all authors’ names

## Reviewing Process

Reviewing will be **double blind**. Authors must not include any author names on submitted documents except in the space provided on the submission form. Ensure that the metadata included in the PDF does not give away the authors. Refer to prior work in the third person and include a full citation for the work in the bibliography.

## Authorship Guidelines

IEEE guidelines dictate that authorship should be based on a substantial intellectual contribution. All authors must have met specific conditions related to intellectual contribution, drafting/revising the article, and approving the final version.

## Conflicts of Interest

Authors must register all their conflicts on the paper submission site. Conflicts include advisor-advisee relationships, family members, collaborations within the last 4 years, people from the same institution within the last 4 years, funding relationships, and members of the same research center where unpublished work is regularly discussed. 

*Scenarios that do NOT constitute a conflict include: authors of previously-published, closely related work; service collaborations; co-authoring community-wide tools; people working on similar topics; and people under the same umbrella funding award without close collaboration.*

## ArXiv Submissions

Authors may submit their work to HPCA 2025 even if it appears on Arxiv. However, authors are encouraged to reduce the possibility of their name being disclosed to avoid issues with the double-blind review process.

## Concurrent Submissions

Manuscripts must not have been previously published or accepted for publication in a substantially similar form, nor be under review for any other conference or journal during the HPCA 2025 review period, with specific exceptions for workshops without archived proceedings or venues like arXiv.

## Further Information

For questions regarding topic fit, please contact the program chair at [hpca2025@psu.edu](mailto:hpca2025@psu.edu).

summary: The 32nd IEEE Symposium on High-Performance Interconnects (HotI 2025) will be held virtually from August 20-22, 2025. The conference theme is 'Interconnect Software: You can't touch it but you need it,' focusing on the system software ecosystems that empower interconnect fabrics for various applications, exploring advancements in photonics, chips, and parallel paths, as well as the underlying software necessary to leverage their potential. It serves as a premier forum for researchers and developers in interconnection networks.
callForPapers:
# IEEE HOTI 2025: Call for Papers

Welcome to the 32nd iteration of the IEEE Hot Interconnects symposium. HotI’2025 will be held **virtually from August 20 – 22, 2025**.

## Conference Theme

**Interconnect Software: You can't touch it but you need it**

The latest advancements in photonics, chips, parallel paths, and other cutting-edge interconnect technologies are dazzling. However, the picture is incomplete without the system software needed to exploit their full potential. This edition of Hot Interconnects will explore the underlying software ecosystems that empower interconnect fabrics to support a wide array of applications.

## Topics of Interest

*   Systems software for communication
*   Novel and innovative interconnect architectures
*   Accelerator interconnects, e.g. NVLINK, Infinity Fabric
*   Network software/hardware designed for AI/ML workloads
*   Multi-core processor interconnects
*   System-on-Chip Interconnects
*   Chiplet-interconnect technologies such as UCIe and BOW
*   Advanced chip-to-chip communication technologies
*   Optical interconnects
*   Protocol and interfaces for inter-processor communication
*   Survivability and fault-tolerance of interconnects
*   High-speed packet processing engines and network processors
*   System and storage area network architectures and protocols
*   High-performance host-network interface architectures
*   High-bandwidth and low-latency I/O
*   Pb/s switching and routing technologies
*   Innovative architectures for supporting collective communication
*   Novel communication architectures to support cloud & grid computing
*   Centralized and distributed cloud interconnects
*   Requirements driving high-performance interconnects
*   Traffic characterization for HPC systems and commercial data centers
*   Software-defined networking and software overlay networks
*   Software for network bring-up, configuration and performance management (OpenFlow, OpenSM)
*   Data Center Networking

## Important Dates

*   **Notification of acceptance:** July 3, 2025
*   **Camera-ready due:** July 18, 2025

*(Note: Original deadlines for paper abstract and submission were listed as crossed out and are not included as valid dates.)*

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Paper Format:** Papers need sufficient technical detail to judge quality and suitability for presentation.
*   **Ethics Standards:** Submissions must conform to [IEEE ethics standards](https://conferences.ieeeauthorcenter.ieee.org/author-ethics/guidelines-and-policies/submission-policies/).
*   **Submission Requirements:** Submissions should include title, author, abstract, and paper in double-column format. Please see [IEEE format](https://conferences.ieeeauthorcenter.ieee.org/author-ethics/guidelines-and-policies/submission-policies/) for details.
*   **Submission Platform:** Papers will be submitted electronically through [EasyChair](https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=hoti2025) and will undergo a **single-blind review process**.
*   **Publication:** Accepted papers will be submitted for inclusion into IEEE Xplore subject to meeting IEEE Xplore’s scope and quality requirements. Regular papers with the highest review scores will be invited for an [IEEE Micro](https://www.computer.org/publications/tech-focus/micro) Special issue submission.
*   **Post-Acceptance:** After acceptance, authors must follow the conference and [IEEE CPS guidelines](https://conferences.ieeeauthorcenter.ieee.org/author-ethics/guidelines-and-policies/submission-policies/) for publishing.

## Submission Types

### Regular (Long) Papers

*   Up to **10 pages** (including technical content and figures), excluding references and any appendices.
*   Appendices (if any) are limited to 5 pages (extensions possible upon committee approval).
*   Reproducibility appendices are encouraged.
*   These papers will be considered for the IEEE Micro Special Issue.

### Hot Topic Papers

*   Up to **4 pages** (including technical content and figures) excluding references.
*   Appendices are not allowed.
*   These papers should describe initial research or early first-of-a-kind results (from industry or academia) and will be reviewed independently.
*   Hot topic papers will not be considered for the IEEE Micro special issue.

## Best Papers

High impact papers will be considered for “**Best Industry Paper**” (primary author(s) from industry) and “**Best Academic Paper**” (primary author(s) from academia or non-profit research laboratories) categories.

## Call for Tutorials

*   **Proposals due:** June 3, 2025
*   **Notification of acceptance:** June 10, 2025
*   **Materials due:** August 2, 2025

## Registration Fees

Information regarding registration fees is not available in the provided text.

callForPapers:
# IEEE HealthCom 2025: Call for Papers

Welcome to the IEEE International Conference on E-health Networking, Application & Services (HealthCom) 2025, taking place from **October 21–23, 2025**, in **Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates**.

## Theme: AI and Digital Health: Innovations, Challenges, and Future Perspectives

At IEEE HealthCom 2025, we explore the transformative power of AI and digital health in revolutionizing healthcare delivery. Our theme highlights the synergy between AI and digital health, focusing on their impact on improving healthcare services, enhancing communication systems, and creating more efficient, accessible, and patient-centered care.

## Topics of Interest

Authors are cordially invited to submit their original papers within the eHealth area. The topics include but are not limited to:

### Signal/Data Processing and Computing For Health Systems
*   AI and machine learning for eHealth
*   Machine and deep learning approaches for Health Data
*   Generative AI for eHealth
*   Fog/Edge/Cloud computing for wearable medical devices
*   Virtual tele-rehabilitation
*   Biometric analysis (gait analysis, eye-tracking, falls, mHealth)
*   Signal processing for virus early detection
*   Bioinformatics
*   AI for precision medicine
*   AI-driven drug discovery and development processes
*   Federated learning for privacy-preserving health data analysis

### Communications and Networking
*   Network coding and error detection/correction
*   Delay-tolerant, fault-tolerant, and reliable communication
*   Quality of Service (QoS) and Quality of Experience (QoE)
*   In-hospital networking, body area and cloud-integrated networking
*   B5G-based eHealth solutions
*   Future network designs and deterministic networking for eHealth
*   Semantic communications for eHealth
*   Network security for eHealth

### Medical, Biomedical & Health Communication Systems
*   Medical imaging, image compression and detection
*   Signal processing, data cleansing, management and mining
*   Smart health and big data
*   IoT for eHealth and telemedicine
*   eHealth platforms
*   Digital platforms for biopharmaceutical clinical trials

### Devices
*   Integration of medical devices with eHealth platforms
*   Medical device interoperability
*   Wearable and implantable devices
*   Device Security & Safety
*   Wearable devices against virus infection
*   eDrugs: nano-devices in blood stream
*   Healthcare devices and circuits for AI

### Service & Applications
*   eHealth services/applications for physical and mental health
*   eHealth services/applications for sports and exercise
*   eHealth services/applications for public health (disease prevention, pandemic preparedness)
*   eHealth services/applications for extreme environments
*   mHealth applications and software
*   Quality of experience (QoE) for eHealth services/applications
*   Security, privacy and trust for e-Health services/applications
*   Metaverse and digital twin applications for eHealth
*   Decision support systems for eHealth
*   Real-time genomic counseling and testing
*   Telemedicine services that incorporate genetic counseling and testing

### Medical Studies
*   eHealth case studies & applications
*   eHealth for neurological diseases
*   EEG/MEG in brain network analysis
*   Telehealth in Obstetrician & Gynecology
*   Cardiology tele-health
*   Integration of transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS) with EEG/functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI)

## Submission Guidelines and Publication

*   Accepted and presented technical papers will be published in the IEEE HEALTHCOM 2025 Conference Proceedings and submitted to IEEE Xplore®.
*   Conference proceedings are indexed by Scopus and Web of Science.
*   Authors are invited to submit their original papers. Please refer to the [Author Guidelines](/authors/author-guidelines).
*   Submissions can be made via the website [Submit Your Paper Now](https://healthcom2025.ieee-healthcom.org/authors). A downloadable Call for Papers PDF is also available [DOWNLOAD CALL FOR PAPERS](https://healthcom2025.ieee-healthcom.org/sites/healthcom2025.ieee-healthcom.org/files/CFP%20HealthCom%202025%20Final%20Firm%20Deadline.pdf).

## Important Dates

*   **Paper Submission:** 08 June 2025
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** 01 August 2025
*   **Final Manuscript (Camera Ready):** 30 August 2025

**Workshop Dates:**

*   **Workshop Paper Submission Deadline:** 15 July 2025 {Extended}
*   **Workshop Acceptance Notification:** 15 August 2025
*   **Workshop Proposals Due:** 15 April 2025 {Extended Date}
*   **Proposal Acceptance Notification:** 30 April 2025 {Extended Date}

## Special Issues

Selected papers will be able to submit extended works to one of the conference-related Special Issues at:

*   IEEE IoT Magazine ([https://www.comsoc.org/publications/magazines/ieee-internet-things-magazine](https://www.comsoc.org/publications/magazines/ieee-internet-things-magazine))
*   IEEE E-JES ([https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/xpl/RecentIssue.jsp?punumber=6687308](https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/xpl/RecentIssue.jsp?punumber=6687308))
*   IEEE Transactions on Molecular, Biological and Multi-scale Communications ([https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/xpl/RecentIssue.jsp?punumber=6687308](https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/xpl/RecentIssue.jsp?punumber=6687308))

callForPapers:
# IEEE HPSC 2025: Call for Papers

The 11th IEEE International Conference on High Performance and Smart Computing (IEEE HPSC 2025) will be held from **May 9th to 11th, 2025**, in **New York City**.

This conference provides an academic forum for engineers and scientists in the computing domain to share new research achievements, ideas, and results. It will feature state-of-the-art smart computing applications and experiences in cloud computing and smart computing.

### On-site and Virtual Participation

The IEEE HPSC 2025 conference will mainly take place on-site. However, in recognition of potential barriers to physical attendance, arrangements will be in place for virtual presentations to maintain inclusivity and participation under unforeseen circumstances.

## Important Dates

*   **Paper submission:** March 8th, 2025 (Firm)
*   **Author notification:** March 28th, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready:** April 15th, 2025
*   **Registration:** April 15th, 2025
*   **Conference date:** May 9th-11th, 2025

## Topics of Interest

High performance and smart computing (HPSC) is gaining attention due to the rapid development of computing and communication techniques. Interest in HPSC has emerged from various stakeholders, including national governments, industry players, and consumers. As a promising technology, high performance computing plays an important role not only in traditional computer science domains but also in new branches such as:

*   Internet of Things (IoT)
*   Unmanned vehicles
*   Artificial intelligence

Smart computing provides solutions for complicated computing problems.

# HRI 2025: Call for Papers

The ACM/IEEE International Conference on Human-Robot Interaction (HRI 2025) will be held in **Melbourne, Australia**, from **May 18 to May 22, 2025**. The conference theme is 'Robots for a Sustainable World'.

## Submission Types and Dates

Here are the important dates and submission types for HRI 2025:

### Full Papers
*   **Abstract Submission:** September 24, 2025
*   **Full Paper Submission:** October 1, 2025
*   **Rebuttal Phase:** November 5 - 11, 2025
*   **Final Notification:** December 2, 2025
*   **Format:** 8-page limit (excluding references) + up to 3 optional supplementary materials (appendices, video (1 min, 100MB max), artifacts). Anonymous submissions, peer-reviewed in two stages with rebuttal. Accepted papers are published in the main conference proceedings.

### Short Contributions
*   **Submission:** October 7, 2025
*   **Rebuttal Phase:** November 7 - 14, 2025
*   **Final Notification:** December 2, 2025
*   **Format:** 4-page limit (excluding references) + up to 3 optional supplementary materials. Aim: promote sharing, reuse, and replication of scientific work (datasets, code) or replication studies. Published in the main conference proceedings.

### alt.HRI
*   **Submission:** October 3, 2025 (Extended to October 18, 2025)
*   **Final Notification:** November 19, 2025
*   **Formats:**
    *   Papers: 8-page limit (excluding references).
    *   Videos: 3-minute video + 3-page abstract (including references).
    *   Pictorial: 12-page limit (excluding references), PDF from template + 150-word max abstract.
*   **Content:** For thought-provoking, controversial, unusual, or risk-taking work.

### Workshops
*   **Submission:** October 7, 2025
*   **Final Notification:** November 21, 2025
*   **Format:** 3 pages max (including references) for proposals.

### Tutorials
*   **Format:** 3 pages max (including references) for proposals.

### Late Breaking Reports
*   **Submission:** December 6, 2025
*   **Final Notification:** January 8, 2026
*   **Format:** 4-page limit (excluding references) + optional 2-min video (at camera-ready). Presented as Posters.

### HRI Pioneers
*   **Submission:** October 30, 2025
*   **Final Notification:** December 18, 2025
*   **Format:** Extended abstracts (2-page limit + max 1-page references).

### Student Design Challenge
*   **Submission:** December 2, 2025
*   **Final Notification:** January 6, 2026
*   **Format:** 4 pages max (including references) + video (max 3min/100MB).

### Demos and Videos
*   **Submission:** December 9, 2025
*   **Final Notification:** January 6, 2026
*   **Format:** 3 min video, 70MB max + 3 pages abstract (including references).

### Keynote Talk Abstract
*   **Format:** 1-page limit (for all content).

## Guidelines for Authors

*   **Authorship and Anonymization:** Submissions are anonymous and require careful anonymization. Please see [Authorship and Anonymization](https://humanrobotinteraction.org/2025/anonymization/).
*   **Submission Accessibility:** Information on submission accessibility is available at [Submission Accessibility](https://humanrobotinteraction.org/2025/submission-accessibility/).
*   **Review Process:** Contributions are evaluated through a peer review process, often involving a two-stage review with an author rebuttal opportunity. See [Overview of Review Process](https://humanrobotinteraction.org/2025/overview-of-review-process/) for more details.

## Registration

Registration is available at [REGISTER NOW](https://humanrobotinteraction.org/2025/index.php/registration/).

## Keynote Speakers

Information on keynote speakers can be found at [Keynotes and Lectures](https://humanrobotinteraction.org/2025/keynote-speakers/).

## Partners and Organizers

Information on partners and organizers is available at [Partners](https://humanrobotinteraction.org/2025/partners/) and [Organizers](https://humanrobotinteraction.org/2025/organizers/).

## Venue and Travel

Details about the conference venue and travel information can be found at [Conference Venue](https://humanrobotinteraction.org/2025/conference-venue/).

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - HSI 2025

We warmly invite researchers, practitioners, and thought leaders to share their original insights that delve into groundbreaking research, innovative applications, and essential challenges in human-system interaction for the 2025 edition of the HSI conference. Join us in **Ulsan, South Korea, from July 16 to 19, 2025**, for the 17th International Conference on Human System Interaction. This conference offers a dynamic platform for resounding exchanges of ideas, knowledge, and creativity in this exciting field.

## Technical Tracks

1.  **Deep Learning and Computer Vision**
2.  **Human System Interaction in Biomedical Engineering**
3.  **Advances in AI and Learning in Healthcare**
4.  **Applications**
5.  **Generative AI & NLP**
6.  **Theory and Technologies on Human Factors in Advanced Human-Machine Environment**
7.  **Face & Audio Analysis**
8.  **Machine Learning Applications**
9.  **Neurodegenerative Diseases & Cognitive Assessment**

## Submission Process

Prospective authors are invited to electronically submit full regular papers of their work using the IES submission system: [https://confcomm.ieee-ies.org/app/general/conferences/HSI25/initial-submission](https://confcomm.ieee-ies.org/app/general/conferences/HSI25/initial-submission)

*   Authors need to register to use the system.
*   After registering, wait for the confirmation email and verify your email address.
*   For any problems with submission, please contact `ieee.ies.hsi@gmail.com`.

## Format & Length

*   Regular papers are limited to **six (6) pages** of A4 or letter format.
*   An additional **2 pages** can be included at an extra fee.
*   It is strongly recommended to use the set of templates in MS Word and LaTeX formats provided by IEEE: [https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html](https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html)
*   For more details on formatting for IEEE IES conferences, please visit: [https://www.ieee-ies.org/conferences/paper-format-for-conferences](https://www.ieee-ies.org/conferences/paper-format-for-conferences)

## Originality

*   Only original work (not previously published/copyrighted) should be submitted.
*   The conference will use the CrossCheck automated screening system to verify originality. IEEE takes disciplinary actions for violations.

## Final Submission & Copyright

*   Submit the final version of your paper with the modifications requested by the reviewers via the IES submission system.
*   After submission, a “sign IEEE copyright” option will be available to transfer copyright to IEEE via the IEEE eCF site.
*   Do not add any copyright notice in the bottom margin of your first page.

## Publication

All regular papers presented during the conference will be submitted to **IEEE Xplore Digital Library**.

## Important Dates

*   **Full paper Submission Due:** May 15, 2025
*   **Acceptance Notification:** May 30, 2025
*   **Early Bird Registration Due:** June 15, 2025
*   **Registration Due:** June 30, 2025
*   **Final Paper Submission Due:** June 30, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** July 16-19, 2025

## Topics of Interest

The conference topics include those found on the website. For an expanded list, please refer to: [https://hsi2025.welcometohsi.org/call-for-papers/topics-of-interest/](https://hsi2025.welcometohsi.org/call-for-papers/topics-of-interest/)

## Special Sessions and Tutorials

Proposals are solicited for special sessions and tutorials covering emerging research areas of interest for IES, particularly themes not covered by regular tracks.

**Proposal Process:**
1.  Download the proposal template:
    *   [Special Session Template](https://hsi2025.welcometohsi.org/wp-content/uploads/sites/9/2025/03/HSI2025_special_session_proposal_template.docx)
    *   [Tutorial Template](https://hsi2025.welcometohsi.org/wp-content/uploads/sites/9/2025/03/HSI2025_Tutorial_proposal_template.docx)
2.  Send the completed document to `ieee.ies.hsi@gmail.com`.
3.  Receive an acceptance email for the proposal.
4.  Submit a paper through the submission system.

*   **Proposal Deadline:** April 15, 2025

## Pricing

Detailed pricing can be found at: [https://hsi2025.welcometohsi.org/call-for-papers/pricing/](https://hsi2025.welcometohsi.org/call-for-papers/pricing/)

## Work in Progress (WIP) Publications

*   WIP papers follow the regular paper submission guidelines, with a shorter limit of **4 pages**.
*   WIP papers will **not** be published in the conference proceedings or in the IEEE Xplore Digital Library.

# Call for Papers: ACM SIGGRAPH Symposium on Interactive 3D Graphics and Games (I3DG) 2025

The **ACM SIGGRAPH Symposium on Interactive 3D Graphics and Games (I3DG) 2025** is the leading conference for real-time 3D computer graphics and human interaction. It brings together researchers, engineers, and industry professionals to discuss their latest work. This year marks I3D's 39th year since its inaugural workshop and 29th conference.

**Conference Dates:** May 7-9, 2025
**Location:** NJIT, Jersey City, NJ, USA

## Paper Submissions

We invite you to submit papers about real-time 3D graphics, interaction, and games. All accepted papers will be published in **PACMCGIT Issue I3D 2025** and presented at I3D 2025. Submissions from industry and outside of academia are welcome.

### Topics of Interest

*   Real-time rendering
*   Real-time ray tracing and path tracing
*   Physics-based animation
*   Virtual and augmented reality
*   Deep learning for graphics and simulation
*   Collision detection
*   Real-time computer vision
*   Navigation in virtual environments
*   Texture synthesis
*   Real-time post-processing effects
*   Interactive 3D modeling
*   In-the-wild 3D reconstruction
*   Level-of-detail approaches
*   Pre-computed lighting for real-time applications
*   Visibility computation
*   Real-time surface shading
*   Fast shadows, caustics and reflections
*   Impostors and image-based techniques
*   Motion synthesis and path planning
*   Character and crowd animation and simulation techniques
*   Interaction devices and techniques
*   User studies of interactive techniques
*   Sketch-based 3D modeling and design
*   Video game techniques
*   Content generation techniques for real-time applications

### Submission Information

*   **Format:** Papers should be in ACM conference format using the **ACM small trim journal size (“acmsmall”)**. Videos are required for techniques involving motion or animation.
*   **Length:** At most **sixteen (16) pages** of content, including appendices but excluding references. Shorter submissions are welcome. Optional supplemental material does not count towards this limit.
*   **Anonymity:** Papers must be submitted anonymously.
*   **Review Process:** Papers will be evaluated by **double-blind peer review**. There is no rebuttal process. The review process is two-round.
*   **Submission Link:** [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=i3d2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=i3d2025)
*   **Presentation:** Accepted papers will have a 15-20 minute talk.
*   **Registration:** At least one author from each accepted paper must register for the conference.
*   **Policies:** Authors are subject to ACM Publications Policies, including the policy on Research Involving Human Participants and Subjects. ORCID IDs are required for publication.

## Poster Submissions

*   **Submission Link:** [Poster Submissions](cfp-posters.html)
*   **Poster Notifications:** **March 27, 2025**
*   **Poster Camera-ready deadline:** **April 9, 2025**

## Important Dates

All deadlines are **23:59 Pacific Time (UTC -7)**.

*   **Paper submission deadline:** **January 10, 2025**
*   **Paper notifications:** **February 24, 2025**
*   **Revision deadline:** **March 14, 2025**
*   **PACMCGIT camera-ready deadline:** **April 4, 2025**
*   **Poster notifications:** **March 27, 2025**
*   **Poster camera-ready deadline:** **April 9, 2025**
*   **Extended Poster submission deadline:** **March 21, 2025**
*   **Early registration deadline:** **April 18, 2025**
*   **Conference Dates:** **May 7-9, 2025**

## Contact Information

*   **General inquiries, registration, sponsorship:** `general@i3dsymposium.org`
*   **Paper submissions:** `papers@i3dsymposium.org`
*   **Poster submissions:** `posters@i3dsymposium.org`

## Publication

Accepted papers will be published in **PACMCGIT Issue I3D 2025**.

## Sponsors

More information about corporate sponsors can be found [here](https://research.activision.com).

*   Platinum Sponsors
*   Gold Sponsors
*   Silver Sponsor (NVIDIA)

callForPapers:
# IAAI-25: Call for Papers

The Thirty-Seventh Annual Conference on Innovative Applications of Artificial Intelligence (IAAI-25) is scheduled to be held from **February 27 to March 1, 2025**, in **Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA**. IAAI-25 is collocated with the AAAI-25 conference.

## Objective

The objective of IAAI-25 is to showcase successful applications and novel uses of AI. The conference will feature technical papers, best practice papers, invited talks, and panel discussions to explore issues, methods, and lessons learned in the development and deployment of AI applications.

## Submission Focus

IAAI-25 focuses on applications rather than purely algorithmic descriptions. Papers should describe real-world deployments, practical realizations, and the impact of AI technology.

## Tracks and Topics

1.  **Deployed Highly Innovative Applications of AI:**
    *   Must describe *deployed* applications with measurable benefits that include an innovative use of AI technology.
    *   Papers will be judged on task description, application description, innovative AI use, measurable application use and payoff, and lessons learned.
    *   Page limit: up to 8 pages + 1 page for references.

2.  **Emerging Applications of AI:**
    *   Discusses efforts to apply AI tools, techniques, or methods to real-world problems in novel ways, bridging the gap between basic AI research and deployed applications.
    *   Focuses on potential application and engineering considerations, with a clear path to deployment.
    *   Papers will be judged on significance, relevance of AI technology, innovation, path to deployment, content, evaluation, technical quality, and clarity.
    *   Page limit: up to 6 pages + 1 page for references.

3.  **Deployed Innovative Tools for Enabling AI Applications:**
    *   Solicits papers describing *deployed* tools for improving applied AI innovation and deployment.
    *   Areas include process organization, data cleaning, modeling, meta-algorithmics, platforms, novel computational models, interaction, and trusted AI tools.
    *   Papers will be judged on the tool's demonstrated quality improvements, cost reduction, productivity, error reduction, and scalability.
    *   Page limit: up to 6 pages + 1 page for references.

4.  **Innovative Inter-disciplinary AI Integration:**
    *   Focuses on the integration of AI components, exploring how orchestrating methods from different AI silos requires adaptation for practical application.
    *   Emphasizes engineering considerations and human-computer interaction.
    *   Requires clear, transparent, and reproducible cases demonstrating the value of innovation in integration.
    *   Page limit: up to 6 pages + 1 page for references.

5.  **AI Incidents and Best Practices (Short Paper Track):**
    *   Encourages papers analyzing factors related to AI incidents and best practices for prevention or mitigation.
    *   Papers will be reviewed based on their analysis of development/deployment processes, AI incident trends, or best practices for safe system deployment.
    *   Page limit: up to 6 pages. Papers of at most two (2) pages may be submitted for poster presentation only.

## Submission Instructions

*   Electronic submissions are required in PDF format, formatted for United States letter (8.5” x 11") paper, using the **AAAI two-column format** (refer to the [AAAI 2025 Author Kit](https://aaai.org/authorkit25/)).
*   Supplementary material (technical appendix, multimedia, code, data) may be submitted alongside papers, but papers should be self-contained.
*   Submissions are **single-blind**, so identifying information should be included.
*   Authors should register on the IAAI-25 [OpenReview submission site](https://openreview.net/group?id=AAAI.org/2025/Innovative_Applications_of_AI).
*   Paper submission site opens: **July 15, 2024**.
*   Paper submission deadline: **September 2, 2024**.
*   Notification of acceptance or rejection: **October 31, 2024**.
*   Author feedback window: **November 18-22, 2024**.
*   Final acceptance or rejection notification: **December 2, 2024**.
*   Camera-ready copy due: **December 19, 2024**.

## Paper Awards

*   **Festo Best use of AI in Industrial Engineering:** Recognizes innovative AI use in automation solutions. Prize: $1000 + $1000 travel support for the top paper; $500 for runner-up.
*   **DSRI AI Incidents and Best Practices Paper Award:** Recognizes outstanding contributions in analyzing AI incidents and showcasing best practices. Prize: $1000 + $1000 travel support sponsored by the Digital Safety Research Institute (DSRI).

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The 26th IEEE International Conference on High Performance Switching and Routing (HPSR 2025) will be held from **May 20 to 22, 2025**, in **Suita, Osaka, Japan**.

HPSR 2025 aims to assess groundbreaking services and technologies and their impact on networks, telecommunications, and supporting data communication systems. We are seeking original and thought-provoking works on switching, routing, and networking, including applications of AI/ML for communications and networking, autonomous networks, 5G/6G, IoT, Industry 4.0, cybersecurity, virtualization, and other advanced topics.

## Topics of Interest

### High-Performance Functionality and Architectures

*   Address lookup algorithms, packet classification, scheduling, and dropping
*   Applications of data science and analysis on high-performance networks
*   Applications of GPU on network functions
*   Data center and wide-area networks
*   Efficient data structures for networking applications
*   High-speed packet processors
*   Multiprocessor networks
*   Network management
*   Network traffic analysis and measurements
*   Power-aware switching, bridging, and routing protocols
*   Routing and resource allocation
*   Standardization activities of emerging switching and routing
*   Switching architectures
*   Switching, bridging, and routing protocols
*   Traffic characterization and engineering

### Optical Communication and Networks

*   Disaster-resilient networks
*   Fiber-wireless convergence
*   Free space optics and optical LANs
*   Hollow-core fiber communication
*   Hybrid fiber-wireless networks
*   Optical access networks
*   Optical backhaul for wireless networks
*   Optical data center networks
*   Optical fiber communication and networks
*   Optical network architectures
*   Optical networks for cloud/fog
*   Quantum optical communications
*   Subsea communication and networks
*   Techno-economics and network economics
*   Visible light communication and networks

### Network Technologies and Applications

*   AI/ML for communications and networking
*   Augmented and virtual reality
*   Big data and analytics in smart city
*   Blockchain for communications and networking
*   Cyber-physical systems and networks
*   Defence communications and networking
*   Game theory with networks
*   Network economics and pricing
*   Network function virtualization
*   Open networking
*   Power-line communication
*   Rural and remote connectivity
*   Security, privacy, and trust
*   Signal processing for communications
*   Smart grid communication networks
*   Software-defined networks
*   Spectrum sharing models

### Emerging Technologies

*   5G-advanced and 6G technologies
*   Edge technologies
*   Full-duplex communications
*   Future technologies for IoT
*   Green communications and networking
*   Haptic and holographic technologies
*   ICT enabling technologies for e-health systems
*   Integrated sensing and communication
*   Intelligent meta-surfaces
*   Millimeter-wave communications
*   Molecular communications
*   Nano-networking
*   Quantum communication and networks
*   Satellite internet
*   Semantic communications
*   Testbed and prototype implementation
*   UAV communications and networking
*   Ultra-reliable and low-latency communications
*   Wireless body area networks
*   New paradigms in networking and communication systems

## Important Dates

### Paper Submissions

*   **Paper Submission Due:** **20 February 2025** (FIRM)
*   **Acceptance Notifications:** **20 March 2025**
*   **Camera Ready Due:** **15 April 2025**
*   **Author Registration Deadline:** **15 April 2025**
*   **Final Version Submission Due:** **15 April 2025**

### Workshops (WS)

*   **WS Proposal Submission Deadline:** **25 November 2024**
*   **WS Proposal Acceptance Notification:** **13 December 2024**
*   **Web Posting of Call for WS Papers:** **20 January 2025**
*   **WS Paper Submission Deadline:** **23 March 2025** (FIRM)
*   **WS Paper Acceptance Notification:** **4 April 2025** (Extended)
*   **WS Camera Ready:** **15 April 2025**
*   **WS Author Registration Deadline:** **15 April 2025**

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Page Limits:**
    *   Initial submissions: **SIX (6) printed pages** (10-point font). Submissions longer than six pages will be rejected without review.
    *   Final submissions: Maximum **six (6) printed pages** (10-point font). One (1) additional printed page is allowed with an over-length page charge of USD$100.
*   **Format:** All final submissions must be in English. Papers should be submitted through EDAS. Please refer to the Author Instructions for detailed formatting and submission procedures.
*   **Publication:** Extended versions of selected papers will be fast-tracked to: *Computer Networks* (Impact factor 4.4).

## Accepted Workshops for HPSR 2025

*   Workshop on Distributed In-Network Computing Technologies for Realizing Metaverse Societies (D-NetComp 2025)
*   Workshop on Performance Evaluation of Wireless Networks (PEWiN 2025)
*   Workshop on All-Photonics Network and Related Technologies (APN 2025)
*   Workshop on Cutting-Edge Technologies in Network Switching and Routing for Modern Infrastructures (CTN-SRMI 2025)

## Additional Program Information

HPSR 2025 also includes tutorials, keynotes, a poster session, and a panel session. Please visit the conference website for more details.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: 25th International Conference on Innovations for Community Services (I4CS)

## Motto and Theme

"**Celebrating I4CS' Quarter-Century**" is the motto of the I4CS 2025 conference. We aim to explore the transformative impact of technology on the essence and well-being of our communities.

## Topics of Interest

The conference addresses internet community systems, foundations, technology, applications, and socializations. Topics include, but are not limited to:

### Technology: Emerging Architectures and Frameworks

*   Data architectures and enablers for community services
*   Cryptography and cryptology
*   5G/6G technologies and ad-hoc wireless networks
*   Data models, analytics, and big data management
*   Quantum and cloud computing

### Applications: Smart Communities on the Move

*   Social networks, open data, and distributed coworking
*   Barrier-free collaboration, publishing, and eLearning
*   Recommender solutions and chat bots
*   Virtual & augmented reality, robotics, and mobile e-sports
*   Intelligent traffic, logistics, and connected cars

### Socialization: Ambient Work and Living

*   Distributed work challenges and eHealth-assisted living
*   Machine Learning, human-centered AI, and governance
*   Smart home, energy control, and public infrastructure
*   Internet of things and dynamic sensor networks
*   Cyber- and information security

## Submission and Publication

I4CS solicits submissions of unpublished papers presenting research results, industrial experiences and applications, as well as detailed specifications of open problems.

*   **Electronic submission is required.**
*   **Format:** Full papers should be submitted as PDF files.
*   **Length:** No more than **20 pages**.
*   **Language:** Written in American English.
*   **Submission System:** [EasyChair conference management system](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=i4cs2025)
*   **Review Process:** Single-blind review by at least three members of the program committee. Anonymizing submissions is not necessary.

## Proceedings and Indexing

I4CS Proceedings will be published with **Springer in Communications in Computer and Information Science (CCIS) series**. Papers will be submitted to indexing libraries, e.g., **DBLP, Scopus**, and for consideration by the **Web of Science (WoS) conference proceedings citation index**.

*   **Formatting Instructions:** Refer to [Springer's Conference Proceedings Guidelines](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines).

## Important Dates

*   **Paper submission (extended):** February 23, 2025
*   **Authors' notification:** March 23, 2025
*   **Camera-ready copies:** March 30, 2025
*   **Presenters' registration:** March 30, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** June 11 - 13, 2025

## Hosted by

*   LMU Munich, Germany

## Supported by

*   Ernst-Abbe-Hochschule Jena, University of Applied Sciences
*   Deutsche Telekom AG, Group Technology

summary: The 20th Annual Symposium on Information Assurance (ASIA ‘25), also known as the International Symposium on Information Assurance and Security (IAS), will be held on June 3-4, 2025, at the Empire State Plaza in Albany, NY. This event, co-located with the 29th New York State Cyber Security Conference (NYSCSC), anticipates over 1200 participants. Key themes for this year include threats from artificial intelligence, auditing AI, and using AI for cybersecurity and digital forensics. The conference offers free registration for presenters, authors of accepted papers, and members of government organizations.
callForPapers:
# International Symposium on Information Assurance and Security (IAS) 2025: Call for Papers

The 20th Annual Symposium on Information Assurance (ASIA ‘25) invites authors to submit papers in information assurance and security. The symposium will be held in conjunction with the 29th New York State Cyber Security Conference (NYSCSC) from **June 3-4, 2025**, at the **Empire State Plaza in Albany, NY**.

## Special Themes

*   Threats from artificial intelligence
*   Auditing artificial Intelligence
*   Using artificial intelligence for cybersecurity and digital forensics

## Topics of Interest

Authors are invited to submit papers covering (but not limited to) the following topics:

*   Artificial Intelligence
*   Organizational Security
*   Technological Security
*   Incident Response and Forensics
*   International Security Issues
*   Security and Forensics Education

## Submission Categories

Submissions can be made in the following categories:

*   **Completed Research Papers:** Typically **5,000 words** long (excluding abstract and references).
*   **Research in Progress Papers:** Typically **2,500 words** (excluding abstract and references).
*   **Panel Proposals:** Typically a **1,000 word description**, identifying the panelists to be involved.

## Submission Portal

Submissions should be made through the [ASIA website](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=asia2025).

## Important Deadlines

*   **Submission Deadline:** April 6, 2025
*   **Reviewer Feedback:** April 30, 2025
*   **Final Submission:** May 15, 2025
*   **Symposium Dates:** June 3-4, 2025

## Registration and Publication

Through generous sponsorships, free registration is offered for all selected presenters, authors of accepted papers, and members of government organizations.

## Contact Information

*   **General Symposium Chair:** Sanjay Goel
    *   Phone: 518-956-8323 (Office), 518-956-8333 (Lab)
    *   Email: [goel@albany.edu](mailto:goel@albany.edu)
*   **General Administrative Questions / LISTSERV:** [iasymposium@gmail.com](mailto:iasymposium@gmail.com)
