callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: IC3K 2025

## Scope

The purpose of the IC3K (International Joint Conference on Knowledge Discovery, Knowledge Engineering and Knowledge Management) is to bring together researchers, engineers and practitioners on the areas of Knowledge Discovery, Knowledge Engineering and Knowledge Management. IC3K is composed of three co-located conferences, each specialized in at least one of the aforementioned main knowledge areas.

Although the conference is back to the normal mode (i.e., in-person), speakers are allowed to present remotely if unable to travel to the venue (hybrid support).

## Conference Areas

IC3K is composed of three co-located conferences:

*   **KDIR:** 17th International Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Information Retrieval
*   **KEOD:** 17th International Conference on Knowledge Engineering and Ontology Development
*   **KMIS:** 17th International Conference on Knowledge Management and Information Systems

## Keynote Speakers

*   **Richard Chbeir**, Université de Pau et des Pays de l'Adour (UPPA), France
*   **Henry Prakken**, Utrecht University, Netherlands

## Paper Submission

### General Submission Guidelines

Authors should submit a paper in English, carefully checked for correct grammar and spelling, addressing one or several of the conference areas or topics. Each paper should clearly indicate the nature of its technical/scientific contribution, and the problems, domains or environments to which it is applicable. To facilitate the double-blind paper evaluation method, authors are kindly requested to produce and provide the paper **WITHOUT any reference to any of the authors**, including the authors’ personal details, the acknowledgments section of the paper and any other reference that may disclose the authors’ identity.

Only original papers should be submitted. Authors are advised to read INSTICC's ethical norms regarding plagiarism and self-plagiarism thoroughly before submitting and must make sure that their submissions do not substantially overlap work which has been published elsewhere or simultaneously submitted to a journal or another conference with proceedings. Papers that contain any form of plagiarism will be rejected without reviews.

All papers must be submitted through the online submission platform PRIMORIS and should follow the instructions and templates that can be found under Guidelines and Templates. After the paper submission has been successfully completed, authors will receive an automatic confirmation e-mail.

### Submission Types

*   **Position/Regular Paper:** Representing completed and validated research.
*   **Position Paper:** Portraying a short report of work in progress or an arguable opinion about an issue discussing ideas, facts, situations, methods, procedures or results of scientific research focused on one of the conference topic areas.

## Publications

All accepted papers will be published in the conference proceedings, under an ISBN reference, on paper and on digital support.

*   SCITEPRESS is a member of CrossRef and every paper on our digital library is given a DOI (Digital Object Identifier).
*   The proceedings will be submitted for indexation by SCOPUS, Google Scholar, DBLP, Semantic Scholar, EI and Web of Science / Conference Proceedings Citation Index.
*   A short list of best papers will be invited for a post-conference special issue of the Springer Nature Computer Science Journal.
*   It is planned to publish a short list of revised and extended versions of presented papers with Springer in a CCIS Series book.

## Important Dates

All dates refer to **AOE** time, i.e. "Anywhere on Earth"

### Conference Dates

*   **Conference Date:** **22 - 24 October, 2025**

### Regular Papers

*   **Paper Submission:** June 6, 2025 (expired)
*   **Authors Notification:** July 17, 2025
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** July 31, 2025

### Position Papers / Regular Papers

*   **Paper Submission:** July 3, 2025 (extended)
*   **Authors Notification:** July 31, 2025
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** September 5, 2025

### Special Sessions

*   **Special Session Proposal:** May 27, 2025 (expired)
*   **Paper Submission:** July 31, 2025
*   **Authors Notification:** September 8, 2025
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** September 17, 2025

### Abstracts Track

*   **Abstract Submission:** July 31, 2025
*   **Authors Notification:** September 8, 2025
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** September 17, 2025

### Workshops, Tutorials, Demos, Panels

*   **Workshop Proposal:** May 27, 2025 (expired)
*   **Tutorial Proposal:** September 11, 2025
*   **Demo Proposal:** September 11, 2025
*   **Panel Proposal:** September 11, 2025

## Special Sessions (Example)

*   **Ontologies for Digital Twin - DTO**
    *   Chairs: Fatma Chamekh and Romain Chassagne
    *   Submission: July 31, 2025

## Secretariat

IC3K Secretariat
Address: Avenida de S. Francisco Xavier, Lote 7 Cv. C, 2900-616 Setúbal - Portugal
Tel.: +351 265 520 185
Fax: +351 265 520 186
e-mail: [ic3k.secretariat@insticc.org](mailto:ic3k.secretariat@insticc.org)
Web: [https://ic3k.scitevents.org](https://ic3k.scitevents.org)

## Venue

The conference will take place at the **Barceló Marbella hotel**, located in the heart of the Costa del Sol, Spain.

## Conference Chairs

*   **Jorge Bernardino**, Polytechnic University of Coimbra, Portugal
*   **Ricardo da Silva Torres**, Artificial Intelligence Groupr, Wageningen University & Research, Netherlands

## Program Chair

Available soon.

## Program Committee

Available soon.

## Logistics and Affiliations

IC3K 2025 is sponsored by INSTICC.

IC3K 2025 will be held in conjunction with ICINCO 2025, WEBIST 2025, IN4PL 2025, IJCCI 2025 and CoopIS 2025. Registration to IC3K allows free access to these co-located conferences (as a non-speaker).

callForPapers:
# ICAI'25: Call for Papers

The **27th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence (ICAI'25)** is an integral part of **The 2025 World Congress in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, & Applied Computing (CSCE'25)**. This significant congress will be held from **July 21-24, 2025**, in **Las Vegas, USA**.

ICAI serves as a vital platform for researchers, scholars, professionals, students, and academicians seeking to foster working relationships and access the latest research results in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning. AI is recognized as a crucial multi-disciplinary field that underpins many challenging problems in computer science. The conference aims to provide a platform for sharing novel ideas and research results on the application of human cognition models in practical computing applications, promoting interdisciplinary discussions on innovations and solutions for human brain processes, learning mechanisms, and decision-making processes.

## Publisher and Indexing

All accepted papers will be published by **Springer Nature** (https://www.springernature.com/) in their Research Books/Proceedings. The publications are indexed in major Science Citation Indexation databases, including:
*   Scopus (https://www.scopus.com/)
*   DBLP (https://dblp.org/)
*   EI Engineering Index (Compendex, Inspec databases)
*   Springer Link (https://link.springer.com/)
*   Google Scholar
*   Conference CPCI Citation Index, part of Clarivate Analytics' Web of Science
*   ACM Digital Library
*   IO-Port
*   MathSciNet
*   Zentralblatt MATH
*   And others.

## Submission Details

Prospective authors are invited to submit their papers by uploading them to the evaluation website: [https://american-cse.org/cgi-bin/submit/index.cgi?xprint_submit](https://american-cse.org/cgi-bin/submit/index.cgi?xprint_submit)

### Submission Guidelines:

*   **Draft Paper Format:** ALL REASONABLE FORMATTING/TYPESETTING ARE ACCEPTABLE for draft submissions. Authors of accepted papers will receive specific typesetting instructions for the final version, which should use the standard Springer Nature format (available at https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines).
*   **Originality:** All submissions must be original and not previously published or under consideration elsewhere.
*   **Page Limitations:** Refer to [https://american-cse.org/csce2025/paper_categories](https://american-cse.org/csce2025/paper_categories) for categories and page limitations.
*   **Submission Formats:** Papers must be in either PDF or MS WORD formats.
*   **First Page Requirements:** The first page should include:
    1.  Title of the paper
    2.  Name, affiliation, City, Country, and email address of each author (identify the Contact Author). SCI inclusion prefers traceable email addresses for positive identification.
    3.  Abstract (between 100 and 120 words)
    4.  A maximum of 6 topical keywords (Indexed Terms).
    5.  The type of submission (e.g., "Regular Research Paper", "Short Research Paper", or "Extended Abstract/Poster Research Paper").
    6.  The actual text of the paper can start from the first page.

### Contribution Types:
*   Regular Research Paper
*   Short Research Paper
*   Extended Abstract/Poster Research Paper

## Important Dates

*   **Congress Dates:** July 21-24, 2025
*   **Submission Due Date:** Please refer to [https://american-cse.org/csce2025/deadlines](https://american-cse.org/csce2025/deadlines) for the specific submission due date.

## Presentation Modes

All CSCE'25 conferences will be held simultaneously. While in-person attendance is primary, **online presentation options** will be available for authors and speakers unable to attend physically.

## Contact

Questions and inquiries should be sent to the CSCE'25 Conference Secretariat: [cs@american-cse.org](mailto:cs@american-cse.org)

## Topics of Interest

**Artificial Intelligence:**
*   Brain models, Brain mapping, Cognitive science
*   Natural language processing
*   Fuzzy logic and soft computing
*   Software tools for AI
*   Expert systems
*   Decision support systems

summary: The International Conference on Agents and Artificial Intelligence (ICAART) 2026 is scheduled for March 5-7, 2026. The conference aims to bring together researchers, engineers, and practitioners in the fields of Agents and Artificial Intelligence, focusing on theory and applications. ICAART 2026 will be held in conjunction with MODELSWARD 2026, ICISSP 2026, and PHOTOPTICS 2026, offering hybrid support for remote presentations.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

## Scope

The purpose of the International Conference on Agents and Artificial Intelligence (ICAART) is to bring together researchers, engineers, and practitioners interested in the theory and applications in the areas of Agents and Artificial Intelligence, covering both applications and current (advanced) research work. The scientific goal is to stimulate them in developing new ideas for further progress. ICAART focuses on Agents, Multi-Agent Systems, Software Platforms, and Distributed Problem Solving. It also focuses on Artificial Intelligence, Knowledge Representation, Planning, Learning, Scheduling, and Perception. Applications are in both areas, utilizing Natural Language Processing (NLP), Large Language Models (LLMs), Legal Technologies, and Quantum Computing.

Papers describing original work are invited. Accepted papers, presented at the conference by one of the authors, will be published in the Proceedings of ICAART with an ISBN. Acceptance will be based on quality, relevance, and originality. Both full research reports and work-in-progress reports are welcome. There will be both oral and poster sessions.

Special sessions, dedicated to case-studies and commercial presentations, as well as tutorials dedicated to technical/scientific topics are also envisaged.

## Conference Areas

### AREA 1: AGENTS

*   Agent Communication and Languages
*   Agent Models and Architectures
*   Agent Models in Economics and Finance
*   Agent Oriented Software Engineering
*   Artificial Life
*   Legal Technologies
*   Bias
*   Cognitive Robotics
*   Conversational Agents
*   Distributed Problem Solving
*   Emotional Intelligence
*   Fairness and Reliability
*   Group Decision Making (with cooperation, coordination, negotiation, interaction protocols)
*   Intelligent Auctions and Markets
*   Mobile Agents
*   Multi-Agent Systems
*   Programming Environments and Agent Platforms
*   Robot and Multi-Robot Systems
*   Self Organizing Systems
*   Simulation
*   Swarm Intelligence and Collective Intelligence
*   Task Planning and Execution
*   Web Intelligence and Semantic Web

### AREA 2: ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE

*   AI and Creativity
*   Ambient Intelligence
*   Bayesian Networks
*   Big Data
*   Case-Based Reasoning
*   Cognitive Systems
*   Constraint Satisfaction
*   Data Mining
*   Data Science
*   Deep Learning
*   e-Discovery
*   Evolutionary Computing
*   Explainable Artificial Intelligence
*   Fuzzy Systems
*   Hybrid Intelligent Systems
*   Industrial and Societal Applications of AI
*   Intelligence and Cybersecurity
*   Intelligent User Interfaces
*   Interpretable Artificial Intelligence
*   Knowledge Representation and Reasoning
*   Knowledge-Based Systems
*   Large Language Models (LLMs)
*   Legal Technologies
*   Machine Learning
*   Model-Based Reasoning
*   Natural Language Processing
*   Neural Networks
*   Ontologies
*   Planning and Scheduling
*   Privacy, Safety, Security, and Ethical Issues
*   Quantum Artificial Intelligence
*   Social Network Analysis
*   Soft Computing
*   State Space Search
*   Transparency
*   Uncertainty in AI
*   Validity
*   Valorisation
*   Vision and Perception
*   Visualization

## Contribution Types

Authors can submit their work in the form of a complete paper or an abstract. Accepted abstracts are presented but not published in the proceedings. Complete papers can be submitted as a Regular Paper (completed and validated research) or as a Position Paper (work in progress or arguable opinion).

## Paper Submission

Authors should submit papers in English, carefully checked for grammar and spelling, addressing one or several of the conference areas or topics. Submissions should clearly indicate the technical/scientific contribution and applicability. For double-blind evaluation, papers must be submitted WITHOUT any reference to authors, including personal details, acknowledgments, or anything that might disclose identity.

Only original papers should be submitted. Authors must adhere to INSTICC's ethical norms regarding plagiarism and self-plagiarism. Papers with plagiarism will be rejected without reviews. Excessive self-citation should be avoided.

All papers must be submitted through the online submission platform PRIMORIS following the instructions and templates that can be found under Guidelines and Templates. Automatic confirmation emails will be sent upon successful submission.

## Publications

All accepted complete papers will be published in the conference proceedings, with an ISBN reference, in both print and digital formats. SCITEPRESS is a member of CrossRef (http://www.crossref.org/) and each paper on our digital library is given a DOI (Digital Object Identifier).

Proceedings will be submitted for indexation by SCOPUS, Google Scholar, DBLP, Semantic Scholar, EI, and Web of Science/Conference Proceedings Citation Index.

A short list of revised and extended versions of presented papers is planned for publication with Springer in an LNAI Series book (final approval pending). A short list of best papers will be invited for a post-conference special issue of the Springer Nature Computer Science Journal.

## Important Dates

All dates refer to AOE time ("Anywhere on Earth").

### Conference Dates: **March 5 - 7, 2026**

### Regular Papers
*   **Paper Submission:** **October 2, 2025**
*   **Authors Notification:** **December 4, 2025**
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** **December 19, 2025**

### Position Papers / Regular Papers (Second Submission Window)
*   **Paper Submission:** **November 13, 2025**
*   **Authors Notification:** **December 19, 2025**
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** **January 13, 2026**

### Workshops
*   **Workshop Proposal:** **October 29, 2025**

### Special Sessions
*   **Special Session Proposal:** **October 29, 2025**

### Tutorials
*   **Tutorial Proposal:** **January 23, 2026**

### Demos
*   **Demo Proposal:** **January 23, 2026**

### Panels
*   **Panel Proposal:** **January 23, 2026**

### Abstracts Track
*   **Abstract Submission:** **December 17, 2025**
*   **Authors Notification:** **January 14, 2026**
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** **January 22, 2026**

## Secretariat

ICAART Secretariat
Address: Avenida de S. Francisco Xavier, Lote 7 Cv. C, 2900-616 Setúbal - Portugal
Tel.: +351 265 520 185
Fax: +351 265 520 186
e-mail: [icaart.secretariat@insticc.org](mailto:icaart.secretariat@insticc.org)
Web: [https://icaart.scitevents.org](https://icaart.scitevents.org)

## Venue

Available soon.

## Chairs

### Conference Chair
*   H. Jaap van den Herik, Faculty of Computer Science and Faculty of Law, Leiden University, Netherlands

### Program Co-Chairs
*   Ana Paula Rocha, LIACC / FEUP, University of Porto, Portugal
*   Mattias Wahde, Department of Applied Mechanics, Chalmers University of Technology, Sweden

## Sponsors

Sponsored by: INSTICC

The conference will be held in conjunction with MODELSWARD 2026, ICISSP 2026 and PHOTOPTICS 2026. Registration to ICAART allows free access to these other conferences (as a non-speaker). Although the conference is back to the normal mode (i.e., in-person), speakers are allowed to present remotely if unable to travel to the venue (hybrid support).

summary: The 20th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Law (ICAIL 2025) will be held at Northwestern University in Chicago from June 16 to 20, 2025. ICAIL is the foremost conference addressing research in Artificial Intelligence and Law, organized biennially by the International Association for Artificial Intelligence and Law (IAAIL). callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - ICAIL 2025

The 20th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Law (ICAIL 2025) will be held in **Chicago at Northwestern University, June 16 to 20, 2025**.

Since 1987, ICAIL has been the foremost international conference addressing research in Artificial Intelligence and Law. It is organized biennially by the **International Association for Artificial Intelligence and Law (IAAIL)**, in cooperation with the ACM-SIGAI and Association for the Advancement of Artificial Intelligence (AAAI).

We invite submissions of **papers** for regular and special tracks, **technology demonstrations**, and proposals for **workshops and tutorials**.

## Conference Details

*   **Dates:** June 16 - 20, 2025
*   **Location:** Chicago, Northwestern University
*   **Participation Options:** Onsite and Online Options are available (physical presence or virtual participation).

## Topics of Interest

We invite submission of original papers on Artificial Intelligence & Law, covering foundations, methods, tools, systems and applications. Topics may include, but are not limited to:

*   Argument mining on legal texts
*   Classification and automatic summarization of legal text
*   Computational methods for negotiation and contract formation
*   Computer-assisted dispute resolution
*   Computable representations of legal rules and domain specific languages for the law
*   Decision support systems in the legal domain
*   Deep learning on data and text from the legal domain
*   Dialog systems in the legal domain
*   e-discovery and e-disclosure
*   e-government, e-democracy and e-justice
*   Empirical research (quantitative and qualitative analysis) on the use of AI systems in legal practice (for example in law courts, lawmaking, legal education and legislative/normative or adjudicative activities in public administration)
*   Innovative applications in AI and Law
*   Philosophical and legal-theoretical analysis of the significance and implications of methodologies or technical features of AI systems (particularly in applications to Law) with respect to fundamental legal concepts and ethical issues.
*   Systems and methods designed for compliance checking with respect to normative principles, rules and standards (legal or ethical)
*   Methodologies for the technical design in AI systems of compliance with normative principles, rules and standards of trustworthy or responsible AI
*   Explainable AI for the legal domain
*   Formal and computational models of legal reasoning (e.g., argumentation, case-based reasoning), including deontic logics
*   Formal and conceptual modeling of fundamental legal concepts
*   Formal and computational models of evidential reasoning
*   Formal models of norms and norm-governed systems
*   Information extraction from legal databases and texts
*   Information retrieval, question answering, and literature recommendation in the legal domain
*   Intelligent legal tutoring systems
*   Intelligent support systems for forensics
*   Interdisciplinary applications of legal informatics methods and systems
*   Knowledge acquisition techniques for the legal domain, including related applications of natural language processing, argument, and data mining
*   Knowledge representation, knowledge engineering, and ontologies in the legal domain
*   Legal design involving AI techniques
*   Machine learning and data analytics applied to the legal domain
*   Natural language processing of legal text, including law-specific standard NLP tasks (e.g., Named Entity Recognition, Semantic Role Labeling, Translation, etc.)
*   Applications of generative AI systems (LLMs) to the legal domain in connection to machine learning systems or knowledge representation systems
*   Normative reasoning by autonomous agents
*   Open and linked data in the legal domain
*   Smart contracts and application of blockchain in the legal domain
*   Visualization techniques for legal information and data

## Paper Submission Guidelines

*   **Length:** Up to 10 pages including references for long papers; up to 5 pages including references for short papers.
*   **Content Requirements:** All papers must make clear their relation to legal information, reasoning, or processes. There should be a statement about the novel scientific contribution. The relation to prior work must be well-developed. The paper ought to report a full and satisfying discussion of its findings.
    *   Papers on generative AI, machine learning or data mining should include discussions of the data, methodology, results, and analysis in sufficient depth beyond merely reporting metrics.
    *   Submissions focusing on the reproduction, validation, constructive scrutinization, and extension of previously published works, datasets, and benchmarks are strongly encouraged.
    *   Papers proposing formal or computational models should provide examples and/or reproducible simulations.
    *   Papers on applications should describe the motivations, techniques, implementation, and evaluation.
    *   All papers should include some discussion about the relevance to legal theory, practice, use of legal information, or impact on processes.
*   **Reproducibility:** It is highly recommended that code and data be published alongside the papers. Program committee members will be instructed to take data and code sharing into account in their reviews.
*   **Formatting:** Papers must be formatted using the ACM sigconf template (for LaTeX) or the interim template layout.docx (for Word), available at [http://www.acm.org/publications/proceedings-template](http://www.acm.org/publications/proceedings-template). All papers should be converted to PDF prior to electronic submission.
*   **Submission Platform:** Via conftool platform: [https://www.conftool.net/icail2025/](https://www.conftool.net/icail2025/)
*   **Anonymity (Double-Blind Reviewing):** Papers submitted for review must not include names and affiliations of the authors and must not include an acknowledgments section. Any identifying text in the body of the paper (e.g. citing “our work”) should be removed or rephrased to be non-identifying. These aspects can be added at the camera-ready stage. Prior to submission, authors should register their paper on the conference support system to receive an ID number, which should then replace author names and affiliations in the paper. References should include relevant literature, including previous works of the authors, while preserving anonymity.
*   **Preprints:** Submitted papers may not be published as open access preprints before acceptance notifications have been sent. Papers already published as preprints at the time of submission must be flagged as such and must not reference the preprint in the paper.
*   **Rejection Criteria:** Papers not adhering to the page limitation or the anonymity requirements may be rejected without review.
*   **Questions:** Direct to [icail2025@conftool.net](mailto:icail2025@conftool.net).

## Workshops and Tutorials

*   **Dates:** Monday, June 16th and Friday, June 20th.
*   **Proposal Content:** Title, summary of content, biography of presenter(s). Proposals must contain information for evaluation on importance, quality, and community interest, including:
    *   Topic and goals, significance, and appropriateness for ICAIL 2025.
    *   Intended audience, likely number of participants, and publicity plans.
    *   Organization (format, length).
    *   Organizers’ details (background, complete addresses).
*   **Participant Registration:** All participants, including remote attendees, must be registered for the ICAIL conference.
*   **Proposal Submission Deadline:** December 20th, 2024.
*   **Submission Link:** [Form Access](https://sites.northwestern.edu/icail2025/workshops/)

## Demonstrations

*   A session will be organized for the demonstration of creative, robust, and practical working applications and tools.
*   **For demonstrations not connected to a submitted paper:** Submit a two-page extended abstract for review via the conference support system. Accepted abstracts will be published in the conference proceedings.
*   **For demonstrations connected to a submitted paper:** Send an email to the Program Chair by the demo submission deadline to register interest.

## Doctoral Consortium

*   **Purpose:** To promote idea exchange, provide feedback from leading scholars, mentoring, and career discussion for PhD students in AI & Law.
*   **Eligibility:** Current doctoral student with ideally 8-12 months of work remaining. Sole author submission. Must register for and attend the main conference.
*   **Submission Aspects:** Research question, problem identification, knowledge of domain, preliminary ideas/results, methodology, contribution, differentiation from existing approaches.
*   **Submission Format:** Max 10 pages, English, LNCS format, PDF. Submit jointly with a maximum 3-page CV.
*   **Submission Platform:** [https://www.conftool.net/icail2025/](https://www.conftool.net/icail2025/)
*   **Award:** Best Paper of ICAIL 2025 Doctoral Consortium Award.
*   **Chair:** Réka Markovich, University of Luxembourg.

## Important Dates

*   **Workshop and Tutorial Proposals Submission:** December 20, 2024
*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** **January 28, 2025** (Extended)
*   **Demonstration Submission:** January 28, 2025
*   **Notification of Acceptance (Papers & Demonstrations):** April 24, 2025
*   **Registration Opens:** April 24, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Papers Due:** May 5, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** June 16-20, 2025

## Organizers

*   **Program Chair:** Juliano Maranhão (University of São Paulo)
*   **Local Chair:** Dan Linna (Northwestern University)
*   **Local Co-Chair:** Kris Hammond (Northwestern University)
*   **IAAIL Secretary-Treasurer:** Michał Araszkiewicz (Jagiellonian University)

## Sponsors

For a full list of sponsors, please visit the [Sponsors page](https://sites.northwestern.edu/icail2025/sponsors/).

## Registration

Information can be found on the [Registration page](https://sites.northwestern.edu/icail2025/registration/).

## Location and Venue

Information can be found on the [Venue page](https://sites.northwestern.edu/icail2025/venue/) and [Accommodations page](https://sites.northwestern.edu/icail2025/accomodations/).

callForPapers:
# ICANN 2025: Call for Papers

The 34th International Conference on Artificial Neural Networks (ICANN 2025) invites prospective authors to submit original and innovative papers.

## Conference Details

*   **Dates:** September 9 – 12, 2025
*   **Venue:** Kaunas, Lithuania
*   **Organizers:** European Neural Network Society (ENNS)
*   **Proceedings Publisher:** Springer in Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS)

## Conference Topics

### AI and Machine Learning

*   Theory and Foundations of Neural Networks
*   Novel Neural Network Architectures
*   Topics in Neural Networks
*   Large Language Models
*   Explainable AI
*   Machine Learning for Graphs
*   Graph Neural Networks
*   Clustering
*   Reinforcement Learning
*   New Topics in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
*   Neurorobotics

### Neuroscience

*   Cognitive and Theoretical/Computational Neuroscience
*   Brain-Inspired Computing
*   Neuromorphic Systems
*   Digital Twins and Virtual Brain models

### Applications

*   Human-Computer Interaction
*   Biosignal Processing
*   Medicine and Physiology
*   Speech and Language Processing
*   Computer Vision
*   Robotics
*   Climate and Environment
*   General Applications of Machine Learning

## Submission Guidelines

Authors are invited to submit:

1.  **Full Paper:** 6-12 pages (including references). These will be published in Springer-Verlag Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) series with an individual DOI.
2.  **Extended Abstract:** Maximum 2 pages. These will be published in Springer-Verlag Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) series, without individual indexing.

*   Papers must be written in **English**.
*   All papers must conform to the format defined in the Author’s Kit, available at: [https://e-nns.org/icann2025/submission](https://e-nns.org/icann2025/submission)
*   ICANN 2025 is an **in-person conference**. At least one co-author of each paper must physically attend the conference in Kaunas to present the work.

## Important Dates

All deadlines are Anywhere on Earth (AoE):

*   **Opening of submission portal:** February 15, 2025
*   **Deadline for full paper submission:** March 29, 2025
*   **Notification of Acceptance or Rejection:** May 29, 2025 (May 15, 2025 for revision required)
*   **Camera-ready paper upload:** June 15, 2025 (June 28, 2025 for revision required)
*   **Deadline for author registration and early registration:** June 29, 2025

## Call for Special Sessions, Workshops, and Tutorials

Prospective organizers are invited to submit proposals until **March 15th**.

For details, please check: [https://e-nns.org/icann2025/call-for-papers-2/call-for-workshops-and-special-sessions/](https://e-nns.org/icann2025/call-for-papers-2/call-for-workshops-and-special-sessions/)

## Contact Information

For all questions regarding ICANN 2025, send an email to: [icann-2025-program-committee@googlegroups.com](mailto:icann-2025-program-committee@googlegroups.com).

## Keynote Speakers

*   Emmanuel Bengio (Valence Labs/Recursion, Canada)
*   Viktor Jirsa (Aix-Marseille Université, France; EBRAINS)
*   Christiane Woopen (University of Bonn, Germany)

*Other keynote speakers to be announced.*

summary: The 35th International Conference on Automated Planning and Scheduling (ICAPS 2025) will be held in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia, from November 9-14, 2025. It is the premier forum for research on planning and scheduling technology, with applications in various fields like Industry 4.0, aerospace, and robotics. ICAPS 2025 will be co-located with KR-2025 and CPAIOR-2025, and will also feature a Planning and Optimisation Summer School.
callForPapers:
# ICAPS 2025: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Automated Planning and Scheduling (ICAPS) is the premier forum for new research results on the theory and applications of planning and scheduling technology.

The 35th edition of the ICAPS conference series will be held in Melbourne, Victoria (Australia), from **November 9th to 14th, 2025**.

The program committee of ICAPS 2025 invites paper submissions on all aspects of automated planning and scheduling. Contributions are welcome in the following categories:

*   **Theoretical papers:** Broaden or improve analytical tools for planning and scheduling problems and algorithms (e.g., complexity results, expressiveness, new theoretical frameworks).
*   **Algorithmic papers:** Describe novel perspectives and substantial improvements for solving planning and scheduling problems (e.g., new optimizations, specializations of existing algorithms, new propagators).
*   **Modelling papers:** Describe new representations of planning and scheduling problems and their solutions (e.g., new mathematical frameworks, emerging problems, refinements of knowledge representation).
*   **Position papers:** Contribute critiques or bold new perspectives of the field (e.g., meta-analysis of research trends, new challenge problems, historical perspectives).
*   **Tools papers:** Describe systems useful to the planning and scheduling community, built using novel algorithmic and engineering techniques (e.g., integrated planning systems, model checkers, visualization tools).

## Topics of Interest

All submissions to the main technical track must be classified in terms of one or more high-level topics and relevant subject-matter keywords. A list of these is available from the [ICAPS 2025 homepage](/organisation/paper_classification_system).

## Key Dates

The reference timezone for all deadlines is UTC-12.

*   **October 1, 2024:** Submission site opens
*   **October 25, 2024:** Abstracts due
*   **November 1, 2024:** Full papers due (electronic submission, PDF)
*   **November 15, 2024:** Desk reject notification
*   **December 16, 2024:** Phase 1 author notification
*   **January 30 to February 4, 2025:** Author feedback period
*   **February 5 to February 28, 2025:** Discussion phase
*   **March 1, 2025:** Notifications are sent to authors

## Author Guidelines

*   All types of papers can be submitted as either **long** (8 pages AAAI style plus one page of references) or **short** (4 pages plus one page of references).
*   Whether the paper is long or short must be indicated at submission time.
*   Over-length papers will be rejected without review.
*   All papers that satisfy length and formatting requirements will be reviewed against standard criteria such as relevance, originality, significance, clarity, and soundness.
*   Submissions are expected to meet the high standards of publication expected by ICAPS. Please refer to the for further details and reviewing guidelines.
*   The review process has three possible outcomes: (1) acceptance for oral presentation and inclusion in the archival proceedings; (2) acceptance for poster presentation and non-archival extended abstract; (3) rejection.
*   Papers submitted to ICAPS 2025 may not be submitted to other conferences or journals during the ICAPS 2025 review period, nor may they be already under review, accepted, or published in other conferences or journals.
*   Authors making multiple submissions must ensure that each submission has significant, unique content. Papers sharing co-authors and substantial overlap will be rejected.
*   The format of ICAPS 2025 will be **in-person**. At least one author of each accepted paper is expected to register and present their work in person, unless exceptional circumstances prevent this.

## Use of Generative AI

*   Papers that include text generated from an LLM are prohibited unless the produced text is presented as part of the paper’s experimental analysis.
*   This policy DOES NOT prohibit authors from using these technologies for editing or polishing author-written text.
*   No AI system satisfies the criteria for authorship of papers published by AAAI Press (ICAPS’ publisher) and, as such, also cannot be used as a citable source in such papers.
*   Authors assume full responsibility for the content of submitted work, including checking for plagiarism and authenticity of all text.

## Ethical / Societal Impact

Authors are encouraged to include a statement of the potential broader impact of their work, including its ethical aspects and future societal consequences.

## Best Paper Awards and Journal Fast Track

Best non-student and student papers will be awarded. These papers may also receive an invitation to submit an extended version to a top AI journal, such as the Journal of Artificial Intelligence Research (JAIR) or the Artificial Intelligence Journal (AIJ).

## Submission Instructions

*   All submissions will be made electronically via [OpenReview](https://openreview.net/group?id=icaps-conference.org/ICAPS/2025/Conference).
*   Submitted papers must be anonymous for double-blind reviewing.
*   Papers must adhere to the page limits of the relevant submission type (long or short) and follow the author kit instructions for formatting. The author kit can be found [here](/files/icaps2025-author-kit.zip).
*   Authors can submit supplementary material (videos, technical proofs, additional experimental results) in addition to the PDF paper.

Failure to comply with the submission instructions will result in desk rejection.

## Double-blind Requirements

*   Omit names and institutions.
*   Refer to prior work by themselves or others in the third person.
*   Ensure that acknowledgement notices or ethics statements do not include information that may identify them.
*   Authors are not discouraged from posting manuscripts onto Arxiv.org or other similar repositories, but should avoid doing so during the bidding and paper assignment process.

## Program Chairs and Contact

*   Daniel Harabor, Monash University, Australia
*   Miquel Ramirez, University of Melbourne, Australia

For inquiries, please contact: [icaps25pc@googlegroups.com](mailto:icaps25pc@googlegroups.com)

## Other Calls

*   [Main Track](/calls/main_track)
*   [Tools Papers](/calls/tools_papers_call)
*   [Previously Published Papers Track](/calls/previously_published_papers)
*   [Call for Tutorial Proposals](/calls/tutorial_call)
*   [Call for Workshop Proposals](/calls/workshop_call)
*   [Call for System Demonstrations](/calls/demos)
*   [Call for Doctoral Consortium](/calls/dc)
*   [Call for LaunchPad Workshop](/calls/lp_call)
*   [Call for Partnership](/calls/partnership_call)

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The 25th IEEE International Conference on Advanced Learning Technologies (ICALT 2025) invites submissions of original academic or industrial research in the area of Advanced Learning Technologies and Technology-enhanced Learning. The conference offers both onsite and online participation options.

## Tracks

*   **Doctoral Consortium**
*   **Track 1: Technologies for Open Learning and Education (i-OPENLearn)**
*   **Track 2: Adaptive and Personalised Technology-Enhanced Learning (APTeL)**
*   **Track 3: Mobile Applications of Learning Technologies for Education and Development (MALT)**
*   **Track 4: Digital Game and Intelligent Toy Enhanced Learning (DIGITEL)**
*   **Track 5: Computer Supported Collaborative Learning (CSCL)**
*   **Track 6: Big Data in Education and Learning Analytics (BDELA)**
*   **Track 7: Technology-Enhanced Science, Technology, Engineering and Math Education (TeSTEM)**
*   **Track 8: Technology-Enhanced Language Learning (TELL)**
*   **Track 10: Technology-supported education for people with disabilities (TeDISABLE)**
*   **Track 11: Artificial Intelligence and Smart Learning Environments (AISLE)**
*   **Track 12: Augmented Reality and Virtual Worlds in Education and Training (ARVWET)**
*   **Track 13: Motivational and Affective Aspects in Technology-enhanced Learning (MA-TEL)**
*   **Track 14: Technology-Enhanced Technology-enhanced Assessment in Formal and Informal Education (TeASSESS)**

## Submission Types and Guidelines

All papers will be double-blindly peer-reviewed. Author guidelines and formatting templates can be accessed at the [ICALT Author guidelines webpage](https://tc.computer.org/tclt/icalt-2025-author-guidelines/). Complete papers are required to be reviewed.

The expected types of submissions include:

*   **Full paper:** 5 pages
*   **Short paper:** 3 pages
*   **Discussion paper:** 2 pages
*   **Doctoral Consortium paper:** 3 pages

These page limits include authors’ information, abstract (no more than 200 words), all tables, figures, and references.

## Submission

Please submit your manuscript (in only PDF format) at: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icalt2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icalt2025)

If you have any problems with the web submission form, you can contact IEEE TCLT Office at: [ieeetclt@gmail.com](mailto:ieeetclt@gmail.com) (with subject “ICALT 2025 Submission Enquiry”).

## Proceedings

Conference Proceedings are published by: The IEEE Computer Society Conference Publishing Services.
Proceedings accepted in Xplore are available to indexing partners, including EI, Scopus, and Conference Proceedings Citation Index.

## Keynote Speakers

*   Wen-Lian Hsu (Asia University, Taiwan)
*   Kinshuk (University of North Texas, United States)
*   Tanja Mitrovic (University of Canterbury, New Zealand)

## Important Dates

*   **June 13, 2025:** In-person non-author registration deadline
*   **June 27, 2025:** Online non-author registration deadline
*   **July 14-17, 2025:** ICALT 2025 Conference

*Note: The provided text indicates that previous submission deadlines have passed or are not currently listed. Please refer to the official conference website for the most up-to-date submission information.*

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: ICRA 2025

The **2025 IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA 2025)** will take place in **Atlanta, USA on May 19-23, 2025**.

ICRA is the flagship conference of the IEEE Robotics and Automation Society (RAS), bringing together the world’s top researchers and leading companies to share ideas and advances in Robotics and Automation. The conference will include plenary sessions, contributed paper sessions, workshops and tutorial sessions, forums, exhibitions, and robot competitions.

## Important Dates

*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** **16 September 2024** (23:59 PST)
*   **Submission of accompanying videos:** Window 1: **August 5 - September 9, 2024**; Window 2: **September 17 - September 22, 2024** (23:59 PST)

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Submission Platform:** Papers can be submitted on the [PaperPlaza Portal](https://ras.papercept.net/conferences/conferences/ICRA25/program/).
*   **Page Limit:** A maximum of **6 pages** for the paper (including text, figures, tables, and acknowledgements) plus any number of pages for bibliography/references. Papers exceeding the (6+n) page limit will be returned without review.
*   **Format:** All papers must be submitted in **PDF** and must follow the **ICRA double-column format**. Information and templates are available [here](https://2025.ieee-icra.org/contribute/paper-submission-instructions/).
*   **Video Submission:** Strongly encouraged, with the following guidelines:
    *   File size: up to 20MB
    *   Format (only one): mpeg, mp4, mpg
    *   Maximum duration: 180 sec.
    *   Minimum height: 480
    *   Minimum frame rate (fps): 20
    *   Scan type: Progressive
*   **Templates:** [PPT Template Available for Download](https://2025.ieee-icra.org/ICRA_Template_Master.pptx)

## Guidelines Regarding the Use and Disclosure of AI Tools for Authors

*   Generative AI tools and technologies, such as ChatGPT, may not be listed as authors of a paper submitted to ICRA 2025.
*   The use of content generated by AI in an article (including text, figures, images, and code) must be disclosed in the **acknowledgments section**.
*   The AI system used must be identified, and specific sections of the article that use AI-generated content should be specified and accompanied by a brief explanation regarding the manner in which the AI system was used.
*   The use of AI systems for editing and grammar enhancement is generally outside the scope of this policy.

## Guidelines Regarding the Use and Disclosure of AI Tools for Reviewers

*   Information or content contained in or about a manuscript under review shall not be processed through an AI system. Doing so is considered a breach of confidentiality and is not permitted.

## Presentation of RA-L, T-ASE, T-RO and RAM papers

All published papers from RAM and non-evolutionary published RA-L, T-ASE and T-RO papers are eligible for presentation at ICRA, during an eligibility time window. Authors are automatically offered the option to present their paper upon notification of final acceptance. Please check the respective journal webpages for eligibility window details.

## CC BY Open Access License

Authors requiring a CC BY open access license (e.g., those funded by UKRI) should follow the guidelines described on the following website: [https://open.ieee.org/ieee-compliance-with-ukri/](https://open.ieee.org/ieee-compliance-with-ukri/)

## Topics

ICRA traditionally covers **all areas of robotics research**. Authors must select at least three keywords from the official [ICRA keywords list](https://www.ieee-ras.org/keywords).

## Registration

ICRA 2025 Registration is **Now Open**. (Specific registration fees or detailed registration information are not provided in this excerpt).

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: ICCC'25

The 16th International Conference on Computational Creativity (ICCC’25) will be held in **Campinas, Brazil**, from **June 23rd to June 27th, 2025**. ICCC is the sole scientific conference dedicated to computational creativity, covering all its facets, from theoretical frameworks to practical applications.

Computational creativity is defined as the art, science, philosophy, and engineering of computational systems which, by taking on particular responsibilities, exhibit behaviours that unbiased observers would deem to be creative. The field is thriving with advancements in formalizing machine creativity and exciting applications across sciences, arts, literature, and gaming.

## Themes and Topics

Original research contributions are solicited in all areas related to Computational Creativity research and practice, including but not limited to:

*   **Applications of Computational Creativity:** in music, language, games, visual arts, design, architecture, entertainment, education, mathematical invention, scientific discovery, programming.
*   **Human-Machine Co-Creativity:** systems, studies, frameworks, or methodologies related to co-creativity between humans and AI, emphasizing machine as a creative partner.
*   **Computational Creativity Evaluation:** metrics, frameworks, formalisms, and methodologies for evaluating creativity in computational systems or their societal perception.
*   **Social Models:** computational models of social aspects of creativity, including social creativity, diffusion of ideas, collaboration, team dynamics, and creativity in social settings.
*   **Computational Paradigms:** computational approaches for modelling cognitive aspects of creativity, such as heuristic search, analogical and meta-level reasoning, cognitive architectures, and re-representation.
*   **Interdisciplinary Perspectives:** drawing from philosophy and/or sociology in the context of creative AI systems.
*   **Data and Creativity:** data science approaches, resource development, and data gathering/knowledge curation for creative AI, with a focus on scalable, extensible, and open-source datasets.
*   **Societal Impact:** ethical considerations in the design, deployment, or testing of creative AI systems, and studies on the societal impact of computational creativity and generative AI.
*   **Psychological Factors:** computational models of psychological factors enhancing creativity (emotion, surprise, reflection, motivation, etc.), as well as social or experiential factors related to novelty and originality.
*   **Provocations:** raising new issues that question the foundations of the discipline or shed new light on debates.

A note on generative AI models: While welcomed, applications must be properly situated in the CC literature and evaluated according to field standards.

## Paper Types

We welcome five types of full papers:

*   **Technical papers:** Focus on hypotheses about creative behaviour in computational systems, requiring solid experimentation, models, proof, or argumentation, with strong evaluation.
*   **System or Resource description papers:** Describe the building and deployment of a creative system or resource, emphasizing engineering achievement, technical challenges, reusable resources, and some evaluation.
*   **Study papers:** Draw on allied fields (psychology, philosophy, etc.) or appeal to broader AI/CS areas, providing novel perspectives on CC systems or their evaluation.
*   **Cultural application papers:** Present the use of creative software in a cultural setting (art exhibitions, concerts, literature, games, etc.), detailing the system's role, results, and feedback.
*   **Position papers:** Present opinions on CC research, future directions, speculative explorations, or current issues, requiring careful argumentation and thorough knowledge of the field.

## Important Dates

All deadlines are 23:59 anywhere on Earth time.

*   **Abstracts due:** February 21, 2025
*   **Submissions due (Full Papers):** February 28, 2025
*   **Acceptance Notification (Full Papers):** April 11, 2025
*   **Camera-ready copies due (Full Papers):** May 9, 2025
*   **Short Paper Submissions:** April 25, 2025
*   **Short Paper Acceptance Notification:** May 13, 2025
*   **Short Paper Camera-ready Copies:** May 19, 2025
*   **Conference:** June 23–27, 2025

## Submission Instructions

Submissions are a two-stage process:

1.  **Initial Submission:** Title and abstract (100–200 words). Submit via EasyChair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=iccc202501](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=iccc202501)
2.  **Full Paper Submission:** Update the EasyChair abstract with your manuscript file.

*   **Page Limit:** 8 pages + up to 2 pages for references.
*   **Anonymity:** Papers must be anonymous for double-blind review. Remove institutional references and refer to past work in the third person.
*   **Formatting:** PDF document formatted according to ICCC style. Templates available:
    *   [LaTeX Template](https://computationalcreativity.net/ICCC-author-kit-2022.zip)
    *   [Word Template](https://computationalcreativity.net/ICCC-author-kit-Word.zip)
*   **Presentation:** Accepted papers must be presented at the conference by an author, requiring registration and live participation. Full papers require a 15-minute talk plus 10 minutes for Q&A; short papers require an 8-minute talk plus Q&A.
*   **Double Submissions:** Work submitted must not be under review elsewhere.

callForPapers:
# IEEE International Conference on Blockchain and Cryptocurrency (ICBC) 2025: Call for Papers

The **IEEE International Conference on Blockchain and Cryptocurrency (ICBC) 2025** will be held from **June 2nd to 6th, 2025**, in **Pisa, Italy**. Sponsored by the IEEE Communications Society, ICBC 2025 is the 7th edition of this conference.

ICBC 2025 is seeking submissions for technical papers (both full and short), posters, tutorial proposals, workshop proposals, and demos in areas related to Blockchain and Cryptocurrencies.

## Review Process

ICBC 2025 employs a **DOUBLE-BLIND review process** with a **REBUTTAL period**.

## Topics of Interest

Areas related to Blockchain and Cryptocurrencies, including but not limited to:

*   Distributed Consensus & Fault Tolerance Algorithms
*   Blockchain Platforms & Offchain Technologies
*   Distributed Database Technologies for Blockchain
*   Storage Solutions and Data Availability Verification
*   Blockchain Interoperability & Cross-chain Mechanisms
*   Performance, Scalability & Sustainability Issues
*   Transaction and Network Monitoring, Measurement, and Analysis
*   Simulation Tools
*   Blockchain-based Applications & Services
*   Decentralised App Development
*   Smart Contracts and Verification
*   Security, Privacy, Forensics
*   Token Economy
*   Regulations & Policies in Cryptocurrencies
*   Novel Mechanisms for the Creation, Custody, and Exchange of Crypto Assets
*   Anonymity and Criminal Activities of Cryptocurrency
*   Managing the Risks of Cryptocurrency
*   Distributed Trust
*   Decentralised Internet Infrastructure
*   Decentralised Financial Services
*   Blockchain for Internet of Things/Cyber Physical Services
*   Blockchain and Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence
*   Blockchain for Metaverse & Digital Twins

## Submission Instructions

*   **Ethical Considerations**: For papers involving human participants, personal data, or security/privacy attacks, ethical considerations must be discussed, and institutional ethical approval must be in place before submission.
*   **Originality**: Authors are invited to submit original papers, written in English, that have not been published or submitted for publication elsewhere.
*   **Formatting**: Technical papers must be formatted using the **IEEE 2-column format**. Templates are available on IEEE Manuscript Templates for Conference Proceedings.
    *   **Full Papers**: Not exceeding 8 pages (excluding references).
    *   **Short Papers**: Not exceeding 4 pages (excluding references).
    *   **Poster Papers**: Not exceeding 2 pages (excluding references).
    *   **Systemisation of Knowledge (SoK) papers**: Not exceeding 16 pages (excluding references).
*   **Submission Portal**: All papers must be submitted through EDAS via the URL: [https://edas.info/N32838](https://edas.info/N32838).
*   **File Type**: Only **PDF files** will be accepted for the review process.
*   **Anonymisation**: The paper should be anonymised, removing all identifying information (explicit self-citations, acknowledgments, and funding sources).
*   **AI Content Generation Guidelines**: [https://icbc2025.ieee-icbc.org/ai-content-generation-guidelines](https://icbc2025.ieee-icbc.org/ai-content-generation-guidelines)

## Important Dates

*   **Paper/Poster Submission Deadline:** **10 January 2025** (AoE, firm)
*   **Reviews Released to Authors:** **21 February 2025**
*   **Rebuttals Due:** **28 February 2025** (AoE)
*   **Acceptance Notification:** **12 March 2025**
*   **Camera Ready:** **21 April 2025**
*   **Demo Submission Deadline:** **5 April 2025**
*   **Demo Acceptance Notification:** **15 April 2025**
*   **Tutorial Submission Deadline:** **28 February 2025**
*   **Tutorial Acceptance Notification:** **7 March 2025**
*   **Workshop Submission Deadline:** **16 March 2025** (AoE)
*   **Workshop Acceptance Notification:** **14 April 2025**

## Registration

*   Author registration deadline: **21st April 2025**.
*   For registration fees and policy, please refer to the conference website.

## Student Travel Grants

A limited number of student travel grants are available. The application deadline is **April 25th, 2025**.

## Invited Extended Versions

Authors of the best accepted papers will be invited to submit extended versions of their papers to a fast-tracked special issue of a prestigious journal.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

[Download the call for papers](https://2026.ieeeicassp.org/wp-content/uploads/sites/4/2019/08/ICASSP2026_CfP.pdf)

The 51th IEEE International Conference on Acoustics, Speech, and Signal Processing (ICASSP) will be held in Barcelona, Spain, from May 4 to 8, 2026, at the Centre de Convencions Internacional de Barcelona (CCIB). The flagship conference of the IEEE Signal Processing Society will offer a comprehensive technical program presenting the latest developments in signal processing research and applications. Featuring world-class oral and poster sessions, keynotes, exhibitions, demonstrations, tutorials, and short courses, the conference will attract leading researchers and global industry figures, providing great networking opportunities. Exceptional papers and contributors will be selected and recognized at ICASSP 2026.

## Important Dates

*   **Special Session Proposals:** July 9, 2025
*   **Grand Challenge Proposals:** July 9, 2025
*   **Workshop Proposals:** July 9, 2025
*   **Paper Submissions (regular papers and OJSP):** **September 17, 2025**
*   **Tutorial and Short Course Proposals:** October 22, 2025
*   **Author Response Deadline:** December 24, 2025
*   **Published Journal Presentation Request:** January 9, 2026
*   **Paper Acceptance:** January 16, 2026
*   **Camera Ready Paper Deadline:** February 13, 2026
*   **Author Registration:** February 13, 2026
*   **Open Preview Starts:** April 7, 2026

## Technical Program Chairs

*   Christian Jutten
*   Markus Rupp
*   Tülay Adali

## Technical Committee Members

*   Applied Signal Processing Systems: Brian Telfer (Chair)
*   Audio & Acoustic Signal Processing: Minje Kim (Chair)
*   Bio Imaging and Signal Processing: Mathews Jacob (Chair)
*   Computational Imaging: Justin Haldar (Chair)
*   Image, Video, and Multidimensional Signal Processing: Xiao-Ping (Steven) Zhang (Chair)
*   Information Forensics and Security: Anderson Rocha (Chair)
*   Machine Learning for Signal Processing: Danilo Comminiello (Chair)
*   Multimedia Signal Processing: Giuseppe Valenzise (Chair)
*   Sensor Array and Multichannel: Elias Aboutanios (Chair)
*   Signal Processing for Communications and Networking: Urbashi Mitra (Chair)
*   Signal Processing Theory and Methods: Xavier Mestre (Chair)
*   Speech and Language Processing: Shinji Watanabe (Chair)

## Technical Scope

We invite submissions of original, unpublished technical papers on topics including but not limited to:

*   Applied Signal Processing Systems
*   Audio & Acoustic Signal Processing
*   Biomedical Imaging & Signal Processing
*   Compressive Sensing, Sparse Modeling
*   Computational Imaging
*   Computer Vision
*   Green Signal Processing
*   Image, Video & Multidimensional Signal Processing
*   Information Forensics, Security & Privacy
*   Internet of Things
*   Machine Learning and Generative AI
*   Multimedia Signal Processing
*   Neuromorphic Computing
*   Quantum Signal Processing
*   Remote Sensing & Signal Processing
*   Sensor Array & Multichannel SP
*   Signal Processing Theory & Methods
*   Speech & Language Processing
*   Signal Processing for Big Data
*   Signal Processing for Communications
*   Signal Processing Education
*   Signal Processing for Manufacturing
*   Signal Processing for Memory and Storage
*   Signal Processing for Robotics
*   Signal Processing over Graphs
*   Signal Processing in Emerging Technologies

## Submission Types and Publication

*   **Regular Papers:** Accepted papers will be published in the conference proceedings and available in the IEEE Xplore Digital Library.
*   **OJSP Papers:** Submissions of 8+1 pages. Accepted papers will be published in the IEEE Open Journal of Signal Processing (OJSP) and presented at the conference, but will not be included in the conference proceedings. Authors planning to submit an OJSP paper are kindly requested to fill in [this form](https://2026.ieeeicassp.org/event/paper-submissions-icassp-and-icassp-ojsp/).
*   **Published Journal Paper Presentations:** Authors of papers published or accepted in IEEE SPS and Eurasip journals may present their work at ICASSP 2026. These papers will not be re-reviewed or included in the proceedings.

Open Preview: Conference proceedings will be available in IEEEXplore, free of charge, to everyone, 30 days prior to the conference start date until its end.

## Other Calls

*   [Call for Special Sessions](https://2026.ieeeicassp.org/call-for-special-sessions/)
*   [Call for Satellite Workshops](https://2026.ieeeicassp.org/call-for-satellite-workshops/)
*   [Call for Tutorials](https://2026.ieeeicassp.org/call-for-tutorials/)
*   [Call for Show & Tell Demos](https://2026.ieeeicassp.org/call-for-show-tell-demos/)
*   [Call for Short Courses](https://2026.ieeeicassp.org/call-for-short-courses/)
*   [Call for SP Grand Challenge Proposals](https://2026.ieeeicassp.org/call-for-sp-grand-challenge-proposals/)

## Contact

For inquiries related to this call for papers, please email: [techprogramchairs@2026.ieeeicassp.org](mailto:techprogramchairs@2026.ieeeicassp.org).

callForPapers:
# ICCCN 2025: Call for Papers

The 34th International Conference on Computer Communication and Networks (ICCCN 2025) will be held from **August 4 - 7, 2025**, in **Tokyo, Japan**. ICCCN 2025 is technically co-sponsored by the IEEE and IEEE Communication Society.

ICCCN is a premier international conference for presenting novel ideas and fundamental advances in computer communications and networks, fostering communication among researchers and practitioners to improve the field through scientific and technological innovation. ICCCN 2025 will be conducted in person.

## Scope

The primary focus of ICCCN 2025 is on new and original research results in the areas of design, implementation, and applications of computer communications and networks.

## Technical Tracks

ICCCN 2025 covers the following technical tracks:

*   **Track 1: Infrastructure Networking Technologies**
    *   Noriaki Kamiyama, Ritsumeikan University, Japan, `kamiaki@fc.ritsumei.ac.jp`
    *   Ke Xu, Tsinghua University, China, `xuke@mail.tsinghua.edu.cn`
    *   Paolo Bellavista, University of Bologna, Italy, `paolo.bellavista@unibo.it`
*   **Track 2: Network Architecture, Algorithm, Protocol, and Evaluation**
    *   Go Hasegawa, Tohoku University, Japan, `hasegawa@riec.tohoku.ac.jp`
    *   Subhramoy Mohanti, Interdigital, USA, `subhramoy.mohanti@interdigital.com`
    *   Berk Canberk, Edinburgh Napier University, U.K., `B.Canberk@napier.ac.uk`
*   **Track 3: IoT and Cyber-Physical Systems**
    *   Marco Di Felice, University of Bologna, Italy, `marco.difelice3@unibo.it`
    *   Yingshu Li, Georgia State University, USA, `yili@gsu.edu`
    *   Enrico Natalizio, Technology Innovation Institute, UAE, `enrico.natalizio@tii.ae`
*   **Track 4: Edge and Cloud Computing**
    *   Rajkumar Buyya, University of Melbourne, Australia, `rbuyya@unimelb.edu.au`
    *   Schahram Dustdar, TU Wien, Austria, `dustdar@dsg.tuwien.ac.at`
    *   Huaming Wu, Tianjin University, China, `whming@tju.edu.cn`
*   **Track 5: Pervasive Communications, Networking and Sensing**
    *   Hirozumi Yamaguchi, Osaka University, Japan, `h-yamagu@ist.osaka-u.ac.jp`
    *   Sara Garcia Sanchez, IBM Research, USA, `sara.garcia.sanchez@ibm.com`
    *   Jia Hu, University of Exeter, U.K., `J.Hu@exeter.ac.uk`
*   **Track 6: Social Networks, Extended Reality, and Metaverse**
    *   Maria Gorlatova, Duke University, USA, `maria.gorlatova@duke.edu`
    *   Eirini Eleni Tsiropoulou, Arizona State University, USA, `eirini@asu.edu`
    *   Bin Cao, University of Posts and Telecommunications, China, `caobin@bupt.edu.cn`
*   **Track 7: AI-Enabled Communications and Networks**
    *   Hongjian Sun, University of Durham, U.K., `hongjian.sun@durham.ac.uk`
    *   Tugba Erpek, Nexcepta, USA, `terpek@vt.edu`
    *   Wei Bao, University of Sydney, Australia, `wei.bao@sydney.edu.au`
*   **Track 8: Security, Privacy, and Trust**
    *   Rui Zhang, University of Delaware, USA, `ruizhang@udel.edu`
    *   Abderrahim Benslimane, University of Avignon, France, `Abderrahim.benslimane@univ-avignon.fr`
    *   Haojin Zhu, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, China, `zhu-hj@cs.sjtu.edu.cn`
*   **Track 9: Emerging Topics in Networking**
    *   Ranga Rao Venkatesha Prasad, TU Delft, Netherlands, `r.r.venkateshaprasad@tudelft.nl`
    *   Richard Li, Southeast University, China, `richard.li@seu.edu.cn`
    *   Rahman Doost-Mohammady, Rice University, USA, `doost@rice.edu`

## Instructions for Authors

*   **Format:** Submitted manuscripts must be formatted in standard IEEE camera-ready format (double-column, 10-pt font).
*   **Submission Platform:** Via EasyChair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icccn2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icccn2025)
*   **Paper Length:**
    *   Conference Papers: No longer than **9 pages** (including figures/tables and references).
    *   Short Papers (for borderline conference papers): No longer than **6 pages**.
    *   Poster Papers: No longer than **2 pages**.
    *   Workshop Papers: No longer than **6 pages**.
*   **Originality:** Submitted papers should not be previously published or under consideration for publication in another conference or journal.
*   **Authorship Changes:** Title and/or author names cannot be changed after the submission deadline or in the camera-ready version.
*   **Review Process:** Single-blind.
*   **Presentation Requirement:** Each accepted paper must be presented at the conference venue by a registered author at the full registration rate. One full registration covers up to two conference papers by the registered author.
*   **Awards:** ICCCN’25 will select the Best Paper and a runner-up paper.

## Workshops

Workshops are forums to present and discuss specialized topics and emerging research. Workshop papers should not exceed **6 pages**. More details can be found at [http://www.icccn.org/icccn25/workshop/list-of-workshops/](http://www.icccn.org/icccn25/workshop/list-of-workshops/).

## Poster Papers

ICCCN 2025 offers an opportunity to present in-progress work, early implementations, prototypes, or commercial products. Poster submissions must be no longer than **2 pages**.

## Important Dates

*   **Conference Papers Submission Due:** **March 23, 2025** (Extended)
*   **Poster Papers Submission Due:** **March 29, 2025**
*   **Workshop Papers Submission Due:** **April 6, 2025** (Extended)
*   **Acceptance Notification:** **May 10, 2025**
*   **Conference Dates:** **August 4 - 6, 2025**
*   **Workshop Dates:** **August 6 - 7, 2025**
*   **Camera-Ready Papers Due (All):** **June 2, 2025** (Hard deadline)

## Keynote Speakers

*   **Keynote Speaker #1 (Monday, August 4, 2025):**
    *   Title: "Building the Next-Generation Social Infrastructure through AI-RAN and 6G Innovations"
    *   Speaker: Mr. Ryuji Wakikawa, AI-RAN, Softbank, Japan
*   **Keynote Speaker #2 (Tuesday, August 5, 2025):**
    *   Title: "The Future of Connectivity: The Interplay of Resilience, Sustainability, and Efficiency in 6G"
    *   Speaker: Prof. Matti Latva-aho, Director for 6G Flagship, University of Oulu, Finland
*   **Keynote Speaker #3 (Wednesday, August 6, 2025):**
    *   Title: "Revolutionizing Datacenter Networks via Reconfigurable Topologies"
    *   Speaker: Prof. Stefan Schmid, TU Berlin

## Panels

*   **Panel #1 (Monday, August 4, 2025):**
    *   Title: "Develop a Next Generation Cyber Resilient Mobile Digital Infrastructure"
    *   Moderator: Dr. Abhimanyu Gosain, Northeastern University
    *   Panelists: Dr. Arupjyoti Bhuyan (Idaho National Laboratory), Richard Russell (Radisys Corporation), Dr. Aki Nakao (University of Tokyo)
*   **Panel #2 (Tuesday, August 5, 2025):**
    *   Title: "Challenges and Opportunities of NTN networks deployments"
    *   Moderator: Dr. Maria Guta, European Space Agency
    *   Panelists: Luca Lodigiani (Aalyria Technologies), Masamitsu Tsukui (Rohde & Schwarz), Dr. Klaus Michel (Airbus Defence and Space), Muneaki Ogawa (SKY Perfect JSAT)

## Contacts

*   **Executive Chair:** Krishna Kant, Temple University, USA (`kkant@temple.edu`)
*   **General Chair:** Akihiro Nakao, University of Tokyo, Japan (`nakao@nakao-lab.org`)
*   **TPC Co-Chairs:**
    *   Ruidong Li, Kanazawa University, Japan (`liruidong@ieee.org`)
    *   Kaushik Chowdhury, University of Texas-Austin, USA (`kaushik@utexas.edu`)
*   **Workshops General Co-Chairs:**
    *   Kewei Sha, University of North Texas, USA (`comersha@gmail.com`)
    *   Zehui Xiong, Singapore Univ of Technology and Design, Singapore (`zehui_xiong@sutd.edu.sg`)
*   **Poster Co-Chairs:**
    *   Neeraj Kumar, Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology, India (`neeraj.kumar@thapar.edu`)
    *   Peng Li, Aizu University, Japan (`pengli@u-aizu.ac.jp`)
*   **Local Arrangement Chairs:**
    *   Kazuya Sakai, Tokyo Metropolitan University, Japan (`ksakai@tmu.ac.jp`)
    *   Taku Yamazaki, Shibaura Institute of Technology, Japan (`taku@shibaura-it.ac.jp`)
*   **Publications Chair:**
    *   Ning Zhang, University of Windsor, Canada (`ning.zhang@uwindsor.ca`)
*   **Publicity Co-Chairs:**
    *   (America) Mostafa Fouda, Idaho State University, ID, USA (`mfouda@ieee.org`)
    *   (Europe) Zhengxin Yu, Lancaster University, U.K. (`z.yu8@lancaster.ac.uk`)
    *   (Japan) Makoto Misumi, Fukuoka University, Japan (`mmisumi@fukuoka-u.ac.jp`)
    *   (Asia) Qiao Xiang, Xiamen University, China (`qiaoxiang@xmu.edu.cn`)
    *   (Oceania) Wei Xiang, La Trobe University, Australia (`W.Xiang@latrobe.edu.au`)
*   **Publicity Chair for Workshops:**
    *   Guan Gui, Nanjing University of Post and Telecomm., China (`guiguan@njupt.edu.cn`)

# ICCHP 2024: Call for Papers

The **International Conference on Computers Helping People with Special Needs (ICCHP) 24** will be held at **JKU Linz, Austria** from **July 8-12, 2024**.

ICCHP focuses on computers helping people with special needs, covering assistive technologies, accessibility, and (e)Inclusion.

## Submission System

All submissions and registrations are managed through the Conference Management System: [https://www.conftool.com/icchp2024/index.php?page=index#menu](https://www.conftool.com/icchp2024/index.php?page=index#menu)

## Deadlines and Contribution Types

### Special Thematic Sessions (STS)

*   **Deadline for proposing Special Thematic Sessions (STS):** January 19, 2024
*   **Deadline for camera-ready version of STS Introduction:** April 12, 2024

### Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) & Open Access Compendium (OAC)

*   **Deadline for Extended Abstracts:** February 2, 2024
*   **Deadline for reviews:** March 1, 2024
*   **Notification of acceptance:** March 15, 2024
*   **Deadline for camera-ready papers and speaker registration:** April 12, 2024

### Contributions to Innovation Area

(Posters, Presentation of Prototypes, Products, Services, and Projects, Meetings in open and closed formats)

*   **Deadline for Proposals:** May 3, 2024
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** May 31, 2024

### Young Researchers' Consortium (YRC)

*   **Deadline for submissions to the Young Researchers´ Consortium:** May 3, 2024
*   **Notification of Acceptance Young Researchers´ Consortium:** May 14, 2024

### Awards

*   **Deadline for Nominations for the ICCHP OCG Roland Wagner Award:** June 14, 2024

## Key Conference Dates

*   **Preliminary Program:** May 10, 2024
*   **Early Registration Deadline:** May 15, 2024
*   **Conference Dates:** July 8-12, 2024

## Publication

Contributions will be published in **Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS)** and the **Open Access Compendium (OAC)**.

## Cooperation

ICCHP is run in co-operation with JKU, MUNI, and Austrian Computer Society.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: ICCCI 2025

The **17th International Conference on Computational Collective Intelligence (ICCCI 2025)** is an international scientific conference dedicated to research in the field of Computational Collective Intelligence. The conference will be held from **November 12-15, 2025**, in **Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam**.

ICCCI 2025 aims to provide a respected international forum for scientific research in computer-based methods of collective intelligence and their applications. The conference scope encompasses all topics related to processing data and knowledge from autonomous sources, with a particular focus on:

*   Collective processing
*   Knowledge integration
*   Data integration
*   Group decision making
*   Multi-criteria decision making
*   Consensus computing
*   Social networks

## Submission Information

We invite submissions for regular papers and special session proposals. All accepted papers must be presented in person during the conference in Vietnam, as the event will take place exclusively on-site.

## Important Dates

*   Special session proposals: **December 1, 2024**
*   Special session acceptance: **December 7, 2024**
*   Paper submission: **April 1, 2025**
*   Notification of acceptance: **June 2, 2025**
*   Camera-ready papers: **June 16, 2025**
*   Registration & payment: **June 16, 2025**
*   Conference dates: **November 12-15, 2025**

## Publication

The proceedings of ICCCI 2025 will be published by **Springer** in the series Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence (LNCS/LNAI) and Communications in Computer and Information Science (CCIS).

## Registration

Registration and payment details can be found at: [https://iccci.pay.kis.pwr.edu.pl/](https://iccci.pay.kis.pwr.edu.pl/)

## Contact Information

For academic matters:
[iccci@pwr.edu.pl](mailto:iccci@pwr.edu.pl)

For organizational issues:
[iccci@pwr.edu.pl](mailto:iccci@pwr.edu.pl)

Webmaster:
marek.kopel@pwr.edu.pl

summary: The 33rd International Conference on Computers in Education (ICCE 2025) will be held from December 1-5, 2025, at the Indian Institute of Technology Madras in Chennai, India. Organized by the Asia-Pacific Society for Computers in Education (APSCE), ICCE 2025 is an in-person event focusing on bringing together minds, ideas, and innovations in computers in education. callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: ICCE 2025

The 33rd International Conference on Computers in Education (ICCE 2025) will be hosted by the Indian Institute of Technology Madras (IITM) in Chennai, India, from **December 1-5, 2025**. ICCE 2025 is planned as an **in-person event only**.

We encourage submissions that contribute to the field of computers in education, fostering collaboration and innovation.

## Conference Details

*   **Conference Name:** 33rd International Conference on Computers in Education (ICCE 2025)
*   **Dates:** December 1-5, 2025
*   **Location:** Indian Institute of Technology Madras, Chennai, India
*   **Format:** In-person event only

## Topics of Interest / Tracks

ICCE 2025 invites submissions covering various aspects of computers in education, including but not limited to the following tracks:

*   **C1: AIED/ITS:** Artificial Intelligence in Education / Intelligent Tutoring Systems
*   **C2: CSCL:** Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning
*   **C3: ALT:** Adaptive Learning Technologies
*   **C4: TEML:** Technology-Enhanced Mobile Learning
*   **C5: EGG:** Educational Games and Gamification
*   **C6: TELL:** Technology-Enhanced Language Learning
*   **C7: PTP:** Teacher Professional Development

## Other Submission Categories and Events

*   SATULEC (Showcase of Advancements in Technology-Enhanced Learning in Underrepresented Countries)
*   Extended Summary
*   Workshops
*   Panels Proposal
*   Doctoral Student Consortium
*   APSCE Excellence Scholarship Award
*   Early Career Workshop
*   Workshops/Tutorials/Interactive Event Proposals
*   Work-in-Progress Posters

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Page Limits:**
    *   Full paper: 8-10 pages
    *   Short paper: 5-6 pages
    *   Poster: 2-3 pages
*   **Formatting:** Authors must adhere to the formatting instructions in the provided paper template file. Please download the latest version.
*   **Review Process:** The conference will have a **single-blind review** process. Authors' identities will not be known to referees, but referees' identities will be known to authors. Anonymization is not required.
*   **Submission System:** All papers must be submitted via EasyChair.
    *   **EasyChair Site:** Go to the EasyChair ICCE 2025 site.
    *   **Account:** Login to your existing EasyChair account or create a new one.
    *   **Submission Process:** Click the 'enter as an author' link or 'New Submission' button and choose the appropriate sub-conference (track).
*   **Copyright:** Authors of accepted papers will be required to complete a "Transfer of Copyright Agreement."

## Important Dates

Specific submission deadlines, notification dates, and other key dates are not detailed in the provided text, but an "Important Dates" section is available on the conference website.

## Publication

*   Accepted papers from the main conference, workshops, Early Career Workshop, Doctoral Student Consortium, SATULEC, and Work-in-Progress Posters will be published in proceedings.
*   These proceedings will be submitted to **Elsevier for inclusion in Scopus**.
*   Proceedings of the main conference will also be submitted to **Thomson Reuters for inclusion in the Conference Proceedings Citation Index**.

## Message from the Local Organizing Committee (LOC)

The LOC addresses concerns regarding geopolitical developments, reassuring participants that Chennai is over 2,000 kilometers from affected border areas and that life in Chennai continues normally. There are no travel advisories in place for the region. The message also notes that across India, major academic events and conferences have resumed. The LOC is committed to the safety and well-being of all participants and encourages authors to proceed with submissions.

## Contact Us

*   **Program-related queries:** [icce2025.program@gmail.com](mailto:icce2025.program@gmail.com)
*   **Location-related queries:** [icce2025.loc@code.iitm.ac.in](mailto:icce2025.loc@code.iitm.ac.in)
