callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: IEEE VIS 2025

IEEE VIS 2025 solicits novel research contributions and innovative applications in all areas of visualization and visual analytics. The conference convenes an international community of researchers and practitioners from universities, government, and industry to exchange recent findings on the design and use of visualization tools.

## Areas of Focus

*   **Area 1: Theoretical & Empirical:** Theoretical and empirical research topics that aim to define the foundation of VIS as a scientific subject.
*   **Area 2: Applications:** All forms of application-focused research.
*   **Area 3: Systems & Rendering:** Building systems, algorithms for rendering, and alternate input and output modalities.
*   **Area 4: Representations & Interaction:** The design of visual representations and interaction techniques for different types of data, users, and visualization tasks.
*   **Area 5: Data Transformations:** Algorithms and techniques that transform data from one form to another to enable effective and efficient visual mapping as required by the intended visual representations.
*   **Area 6: Analytics & Decisions:** Design and optimization of integrated workflows for visual data analysis, knowledge discovery, decision support, machine learning, and other data intelligence tasks.

## Submission Types

*   Papers
*   Short Papers
*   Posters
*   Tutorials
*   Workshops
*   Panels
*   Doctoral Colloquium

## Important Dates

All deadlines are at 11:59pm (23:59) AoE Anywhere on Earth (AoE).

*   **Abstract submission (MANDATORY):** March 21, 2025
*   **Paper submission:** March 31, 2025
*   **Notification of results of first review cycle:** June 6, 2025
*   **Paper submission for second review cycle:** July 1, 2025
*   **Final notification:** July 15, 2025
*   **Camera-ready copy:** August 8, 2025

## Submission Guidelines and Reviewing Criteria

Submissions will be judged on their scientific quality and novelty, potential impact, degree to which the evidence supports the findings, appropriateness of methodology, and the research process followed. After the initial notification of review results, selected papers are only conditionally accepted and will undergo a full revision and review cycle; only papers that improve according to the required changes will be accepted after the second round review.

Please carefully read and adhere to the [paper submission guidelines](https://ieeevis.org/year/2025/info/call-participation/paper-submission-guidelines).

Reviewers should be familiar with the [guidelines for reviewing papers for VIS](https://ieeevis.org/year/2025/info/call-participation/review-instructions).

## Accessibility

We highly recommend screen reader accessible final submissions. Please see the [VIS Accessibility Guide](https://ieeevis.org/year/2025/info/call-participation/make-pdf-accessible) to learn how you can make your contribution accessible.

## Open Access Policy

Authors are encouraged to share their accepted paper in an open-access repository in accordance with IEEE copyright regulations. Please see the [VIS Open Practices Guidelines](https://ieeevis.org/year/2025/info/open-practices/open-practices).

## Publication Venue

Full papers accepted to IEEE VIS will appear in a special issue of the **IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics (TVCG)** and will be indexed in **IEEE Xplore**.

callForPapers:
# UMAP 2025: Call for Full and Short Papers

We invite prospective authors to submit contributions to the 33rd ACM International Conference on User Modeling, Adaptation and Personalization (UMAP 2025). UMAP 2025 is the premier international conference bringing together research in AI and HCI to support effective human-AI collaboration via interactive systems that can model, adapt and personalize to their users.

The conference is sponsored by ACM SIGCHI and SIGWEB. The main conference proceedings, published by ACM, will be part of the ACM Digital Library.

## Theme

The theme of ACM UMAP 2025 is **“Shaping Personalization and FATE (Fairness, Accountability, Transparency, and Ethics) in Human-Centered Generative AI”**.

ACM UMAP 2025 will bring together researchers, practitioners, and policymakers to discuss the latest developments in human-centered approaches to design and use AI systems that adapt to human needs while ensuring user control, fairness, accountability, transparency, inclusivity, and sustainability.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract submission:** January 23, 2025
*   **Paper submission:** January 30, 2025
*   **Rebuttal phase:** March 3-7, 2025
*   **Notification of acceptance:** March 26, 2025
*   **Camera-ready papers:** April 7, 2025
*   **Registration deadline for authors:** April 7, 2025
*   **Conference:** June 16-19, 2025

*Note: The submission deadline is at 11:59 pm AoE (Anywhere on Earth) time.* For special tracks, please consult the respective calls.

## Topics of Interest

Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Recommender systems
*   Data mining techniques for user modeling, adaptation, and personalization
*   Generative AI techniques for user modeling, adaptation, and personalization
*   Large Language Models and Natural Language Processing methods for user modeling, adaptation, and personalization
*   Knowledge graphs, Linked Data, and semantics for user modeling, adaptation, and personalization
*   Intelligent user interfaces
*   Intelligent and personalized e-learning applications and educational games
*   Personalized behavior change and persuasive applications
*   Modeling and adapting to human affective states
*   Virtual assistants, conversational agents, personalization in augmented reality
*   Group modeling and collaborative team formation
*   Ethical issues of personalization and human-centered AI systems: Privacy, Fairness, Accountability, Transparency
*   Creativity in User Modeling, Adaptation, and Personalization
*   Sustainability-aware methods and Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) for user modeling, adaptation, and personalization
*   Personalized approaches for preventing eco-chambers, user manipulation, and disinformation
*   Research methods and reproducibility

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Language:** All submissions must be written in English.
*   **Format:** PDF format.
*   **Submission System:** Submit electronically through EasyChair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=umap2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=umap2025), selecting the “UMAP25 Full and Short Papers” track.
*   **Contribution Types:**
    *   **Long papers:** Up to 8 pages (plus additional pages for references; all content counts toward the page limit). Should report substantial contributions of lasting value.
    *   **Short papers:** Up to 4 pages (plus additional pages for references; all content counts toward the page limit). Typically discuss exciting new work that is not yet mature enough for a long paper.
*   **Supplementary Material:** Recommend linking to an external source using an anonymized link.
*   **Anonymity:** Submissions must be anonymous due to the double-blind review process. Omit names, affiliations, and identifying statements. Cite prior work in the third person. Failure to anonymize may result in desk rejection. Anonymous repositories like [https://anonymous.4open.science](https://anonymous.4open.science) can be used for code/materials.
*   **Templates:**
    *   **LaTeX:** Use the latest version of the Primary Article Template – LaTeX. Start with `\documentclass[sigconf,review,anonymous]{acmart}` for double-column output. Follow ACM's LaTeX best practices guide. Do not use the "manuscript" option.
    *   **Overleaf:** Use `\documentclass[sigconf,review,anonymous]{acmart}` for double-column. Follow ACM's instructions for preparing articles with Overleaf.
    *   **Word:** Use the double-column Word template. Follow ACM's instructions for preparing articles with Microsoft Word.

## Accessibility

Authors are strongly encouraged to provide "alt text" for floats (images, tables, etc.) and follow ACM Accessibility Recommendations for Publishing in Color and SIG ACCESS guidelines.

## Submission Policy

*   ACM UMAP has a no dual submission policy. Submitted manuscripts should not be under review at another publication venue.
*   Authors must comply with all ACM Publications Policies, including those on Research Involving Human Participants and Subjects.
*   Authors are required to obtain an ORCID ID.

## Review Process

*   **Review:** ACM UMAP uses a **double-blind review process**. Submissions must be anonymous.
*   Reviewers evaluate papers based on significance, originality, rigor, and contribution.
*   Papers out of scope, incomplete, or lacking sufficient evidence may be rejected without full review.
*   A rebuttal stage will be available for authors to optionally discuss the initial decision.
*   The ACM Code of Ethics will be considered; papers perpetuating harmful stereotypes or employing unethical research practices may be rejected.

## Registration and Presentation Policy

*   Each accepted paper must be accompanied by a **distinct full author registration** by the early registration date.
*   Each accepted paper **must be presented in person** to be included in the conference proceedings and the ACM Digital Library.

## Camera-ready Submission

*   Instructions for preparing camera-ready versions will be provided after acceptance.
*   LaTeX/Overleaf is strongly recommended for minimal reformatting.
*   Camera-ready versions will be submitted using ACM’s new production platform.

## Ethical & Human Subjects Considerations

*   Papers should discuss ethical considerations and the impact of the work.
*   Authors must comply with ethical standards and regulatory guidelines for human subjects research.
*   Papers reporting on human subjects research must include a statement identifying regulatory review approval or explaining the lack thereof.

## Program Chairs

*   Cataldo Musto, University of Bari Aldo Moro, Italy
*   Julita Vassileva, University of Saskatchewan, Canada

## Contact Information

*   Email: [umap2025-program@um.org](mailto:umap2025-program@um.org)

## Follow Us

*   [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/acm-umap-conf)
*   [X](https://x.com/UMAPconf)
*   [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/acmumap)
*   [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/umapconf.bsky.social)

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - IEEE ICIP 2025

The 2025 IEEE International Conference on Image Processing (ICIP) will be held in **Anchorage, Alaska, USA**, from **September 14 – 17, 2025**. This flagship conference of the IEEE Signal Processing Society explores the latest technical innovations in image and video processing and covers cutting-edge topics involving computer vision.

## Conference Theme

"*Imaging in the Age of GenAI*"

## Submission Options

IEEE ICIP 2025 offers several ways for authors to present their latest research:

1.  **Submit a conference paper:**
    *   Up to **five pages** for technical content and a sixth page containing only references.
    *   Accepted papers will be submitted for inclusion in the IEEE Xplore® digital library and will be freely accessible and downloadable.
    *   Top papers will be highlighted in Spotlight Oral Sessions and invited to submit extended versions for expedited review in select SPS journals.

2.  **Submit a journal paper to the IEEE Open Journal of Signal Processing (OJ-SP):**
    *   Up to **eight pages** of technical content and one page for references.
    *   For publication in OJ-SP instead of the conference proceedings.
    *   Papers submitted by the deadline and designated for conference presentation will receive expedited review.

3.  **Present an accepted or published SPS journal paper:**
    *   Authors who have published or accepted a paper(s) in an eligible journal within the last year may submit a request to present at the conference.
    *   For eligibility requirements, visit the [IEEE Signal Processing Society website](https://signalprocessingsociety.org/publications-resources/information-authors).

## Topics of Interest

*   Sensing, Representation, Modeling, & Registration
*   Synthesis, Rendering, & Visualization
*   Texture Image Representation & Classification
*   Computational Imaging
*   Restoration & Enhancement
*   Filtering & Multi-resolution Processing
*   Compression, Coding, & Transmission
*   Color, Multi-spectral, & Hyper-spectral Imaging
*   Image & Video Interpretation & Understanding
*   Document Analysis & Processing
*   Stereoscopic, Multi-view, and 3D Processing
*   Image & Video Quality Models
*   Motion Estimation, Registration, & Fusion
*   Deep Learning for Images & Videos
*   Learning with Limited Labels
*   Image & Video Analysis
*   Detection, Recognition, Retrieval, & Classification
*   Biometrics, Forensics, & Security
*   Image Processing for Public Health & Safety
*   Biomedical & Biological Image Processing
*   Trustworthy AI
*   Explainable AI
*   AI-Powered Image & Video Processing
*   Emerging Applications & Systems
*   Datasets and Benchmarks

## Important Dates

*   **Special Session Proposal Deadline:** 18 December 2024
*   **Special Session Acceptance Notification:** 6 January 2025
*   **Tutorial Proposal Deadline:** 8 January 2025
*   **Regular & Special Session Paper Submission Deadline (6 pages Inclusive):** 5 February 2025

*   **Tutorial Acceptance Notification:** 26 February 2025
*   **Grand Challenge Session Proposal Deadline:** 19 March 2025
*   **Reviews Made Available to Authors:** 23 April 2025
*   **Grand Challenge Session Acceptance Notification:** 02 April 2025
*   **Author Rebuttal Deadline:** 30 April 2025
*   **Regular Paper Acceptance Notification (6 pages):** 20 May 2025
*   **Journal Track Paper Acceptance Notification (9 pages):** 20 May 2025
*   **Satellite Workshop Paper Submission Deadline:** 4 June 2025
*   **Journal Paper Presentation Request Deadline:** 28 May 2025
*   **Final Regular Paper Submission Deadline:** 28 May 2025

*   **Grand Challenge Final Paper Submission Deadline:** 2 July 2025
*   **Final Industry Demo Notification of Acceptance/Rejection:** 3 July 2025
*   **Grand Challenge, Satellite Workshop, and Demo Author Registration Deadline:** 16 July 2025

## Review Process

*   Rigorous review process using **double-anonymous review**.
*   Includes an **author rebuttal period**.

## Special Tracks and Initiatives

*   **Datasets and Benchmarks Track:** Aims to advance research by providing a platform for high-quality, publicly available image and video datasets. Accepted papers are presented alongside main conference papers and follow the same deadlines and review process.
*   **Call For Industry Demonstrations**

## Paper Kit and Submission

*   **Submit a Paper to OJSP Track:** [https://2025.ieeeicip.org/ojsp-track/](https://2025.ieeeicip.org/ojsp-track/)

## Inquiries

All inquiries should be sent via e-mail to [papers@2025.ieeeicip.org](mailto:papers@2025.ieeeicip.org).

## Publication and Recognition

*   Accepted papers will be submitted for inclusion in the IEEE Xplore® digital library.
*   Top accepted papers will be invited to submit extended versions for expedited review in select SPS journals.

callForPapers:
# VEHITS 2026: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Vehicle Technology and Intelligent Transport Systems (VEHITS) 2026 is an event dedicated to bringing together engineers, researchers, and practitioners interested in the advances and applications in the field of Vehicle Technology and Intelligent Transport Systems.

VEHITS 2026 will be held from **May 18 to May 20, 2026**, and is sponsored by INSTICC – Institute for Systems and Technologies of Information, Control and Communication.

## Scope

This conference focuses on innovative applications, tools, and platforms across all technology areas related to vehicles and intelligent transportation systems. Papers describing advanced prototypes, systems, tools, techniques, and survey papers indicating future directions are encouraged. Both full research reports and work-in-progress reports are welcome.

## Conference Areas

1.  **Connected Vehicles**
2.  **Data Analytics**
3.  **Intelligent Transport Systems and Infrastructure**
4.  **Intelligent Vehicle Technologies**
5.  **Smart Mobility and Sustainable Transport Services**

## Paper Submission

Authors can submit their work as a complete paper or an abstract. Accepted abstracts are presented but not published in the proceedings.

*   **Language:** English, carefully checked for correct grammar and spelling.
*   **Content:** Papers should indicate the nature of their technical/scientific contribution and their applicability.
*   **Anonymity:** To facilitate double-blind evaluation, authors must produce papers without any reference to authors' personal details, acknowledgments, or other identifying information.
*   **Originality:** Only original papers should be submitted. Submissions must not substantially overlap with work published elsewhere or simultaneously submitted.
*   **Submission Platform:** All papers must be submitted through the online submission platform PRIMORIS.
*   **Ethical Norms:** Authors must adhere to INSTICC's ethical norms regarding plagiarism and self-plagiarism.

## Publications

*   All accepted complete papers will be published in the conference proceedings, available in the SCITEPRESS Digital Library, with an ISBN reference and DOI.
*   A short list of best papers will be invited for a post-conference special issue of the Springer Nature Computer Science Journal.
*   It is planned to publish a short list of revised and extended versions of presented papers with Springer in a CCIS Series book (final approval pending).

## Important Dates

All dates refer to AOE time, i.e. "Anywhere on Earth"

### Regular Papers

*   **Paper Submission:** January 5, 2026
*   **Authors Notification:** March 3, 2026
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** March 17, 2026

### Position Papers / Regular Papers

summary: The thirteenth IEEE Working Conference on Software Visualization (VISSOFT 2025) will be co-located with ICSME 2025. The conference focuses on enhancing and promoting the theory, realization, and evaluation of approaches to visually encode and analyze software systems, including development practices, evolution, structure, and runtime behavior. VISSOFT brings together researchers from software engineering, information visualization, human-computer interaction, computer graphics, and data science.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: IEEE VISSOFT 2025

The thirteenth IEEE Working Conference on Software Visualization (VISSOFT 2025) is principally a venue for publishing and discussing research related to software visualization. It brings together a community of researchers from software engineering, information visualization, human-computer interaction, computer graphics, and data science to discuss theoretical foundations, algorithms, techniques, tools, and applications related to software visualization.

VISSOFT 2025 will be held from **September 7-8, 2025**, and is co-located with ICSME 2025.

## Topics of Interest

Software visualization is a broad research area. Topics include, but are not limited to, the visualization of:

*   **Software Engineering data:** source code, dependencies, repositories, developer social networks (e.g., StackOverflow, GitHub), mobile app reviews, documentation, runtime logs, and DevOps data.
*   **Software development activities:** design, requirements engineering, software maintenance, program comprehension, software performance, software testing, and debugging.
*   **Software analytical approaches** based on data science concepts.
*   **Empirical evaluations** of software visualizations, including eye-tracking studies.
*   **Tools, techniques, and frameworks** that include visual programming languages.
*   **Interactive and immersive techniques and algorithms** related to software development.
*   **Integrating tools** with development environments.
*   **Industrial experience** with using software visualization.
*   **Techniques used in Software Engineering Education**.
*   **Application of trendy techniques** such as Machine Learning and AI-assisted models (Large Language Models, Large Multi-Modal Models with Software).
*   **Application of techniques** such as Augmented and Virtual Reality, and Sonification, to software engineering activities.

## Submission Types

### Research Track

*   **Description:** In-depth and mature research results relevant to software visualization.
*   **Page Limit:** Maximum of 10 pages (including figures, tables, appendices), plus up to two additional pages for the bibliography.
*   **Submission Link:** [https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025](https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025)
*   **Important Dates (AoE):**
    *   Paper Abstract: **May 16, 2025**
    *   Paper Submission: **May 23, 2025**
    *   Notification: **July 4, 2025**
*   **Supplementary Materials:** Submission of a video (up to 5 minutes) and/or reproduction packages is highly encouraged.
*   **Awards:** Distinguished technical papers may be awarded and invited for extended submission to the IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics journal.
*   **Artifact Evaluation:** Authors are encouraged to submit artifacts for evaluation.

### New Ideas and Emerging Results (NIER) Track

*   **Description:** Work-in-progress, preliminary, and exciting ideas and results. Encourages open questions and provocative hypotheses for early feedback.
*   **Page Limit:** Maximum of 5 pages (including bibliography).
*   **Submission Link:** [https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025](https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025)
*   **Important Dates (AoE):**
    *   Paper Abstract: **May 16, 2025**
    *   Paper Submission: **May 23, 2025**
    *   Notification: **July 4, 2025**
*   **Awards:** Distinguished NIER papers may be awarded.

### Tools Track

*   **Description:** Submissions describing already implemented and functional tools, focusing on architecture or use for new insights. Evolutions of previously presented tools are also welcome.
*   **Page Limit:** Short papers: 4 pages (+ 1 page for bibliography). Long papers: 10 pages (+ 2 pages for bibliography).
*   **Submission Link:** [https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025](https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025)
*   **Important Dates (AoE):**
    *   Paper Abstract: **May 16, 2025**
    *   Paper Submission: **May 23, 2025**
    *   Notification: **July 4, 2025**
*   **Video Submission:** Mandatory (up to 5 minutes).
*   **Showcase Session:** Informal tool demonstration session.
*   **Artifact Evaluation:** Authors are encouraged to submit tools and artifacts for evaluation.

### Journal-First Track

*   **Description:** Presentation of papers accepted by relevant journals published between July 1, 2023, and July 11, 2025, reporting new research results.
*   **Submission Requirements:** A one-page presentation proposal including paper title, authors, statement on criteria satisfaction, and a pointer to the original journal paper.
*   **Publication:** Journal-first manuscripts are published through journals, not conference proceedings.
*   **Submission Link:** [https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025](https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025)
*   **Important Dates (AoE):**
    *   Paper Submission: **July 11, 2025**
    *   Notification: **July 16, 2025**

### Poster Track

*   **Description:** Opportunity for researchers and practitioners to present new and innovative preliminary work in an informal, interactive setting.
*   **Manuscript:** Two-page documents.
*   **Publication:** Poster manuscripts will be part of the Conference proceedings.
*   **Submission Link:** [https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025](https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025)
*   **Important Dates (AoE):**
    *   Paper Submission: **July 11, 2025**
    *   Notification: **July 16, 2025**

### Visualization Challenge Track (NEW!)

*   **Description:** Contribution of expertise focused on a single software system (this year: the Linux kernel) to reveal new understandings.
*   **Submission:** Short abstract, video (up to 5 minutes), optional link to tool demo.
*   **Evaluation:** Primarily novelty and interest.
*   **Post-Notification Submission:** 2-4 page paper describing the tool/visualization.
*   **Submission Link:** [https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025](https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=vissoft2025)
*   **Important Dates (AoE):**
    *   Abstract Submission: **June 13, 2025**
    *   Notification of invitation to submit: **June 17, 2025**
    *   Short Paper Submission: **July 11, 2025**
    *   Feedback from PC Chairs: **July 16, 2025**

## How to Submit

*   Papers must strictly adhere to the two-column IEEE conference proceedings format. Use the available IEEE Manuscript Templates for Conference Proceedings: [https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html](https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html)
*   At least one author of an accepted paper must register and present at the conference.
*   Supplemental material (e.g., video, data, software) can be linked in your paper. Archiving artifacts in an open access archive is encouraged.
*   **Review Process:** VISSOFT uses a **single-blind review process**.

## Important Dates Summary (AoE)

| Track                               | Paper Abstract   | Paper Submission | Paper Notification |
| :---------------------------------- | :--------------- | :--------------- | :----------------- |
| Research, NIER, and Tools Track   | May 16, 2025     | May 23, 2025     | July 4, 2025       |
| Journal-First, and Poster Track   | --               | July 11, 2025    | July 16, 2025      |
| **Visualization Challenge Track**   | **June 13, 2025**| **July 11, 2025**| **July 16, 2025**  |
| *(Abstract Submission)*             |                  |                  | *(Notification)*   |
| *(Short Paper Submission)*          |                  |                  | *(Feedback)*       |

callForPapers:
# VLDB 2025: Call for Contributions

The 51st International Conference on Very Large Data Bases (VLDB 2025) is seeking contributions for various tracks. The conference will be held in **London, United Kingdom, from September 1-5, 2025**.

## Tracks and Deadlines

### Research Track
*   **Submissions Open:** 20th of every month, starting March 2024
*   **Submissions Deadline:** 1st of every month, until March 2025
*   **Notifications:** 15th of the next month following the deadline
*   **Camera-Ready Submissions:** Proceedings chairs will contact authors with CR instructions by the 5th of the next month following acceptance notification.

### Industrial Track
*   **Submissions Deadline:** March 17, 2025
*   **Notifications:** May 17, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Submissions:** July 14, 2025

### PhD Workshop
*   **Submissions Deadline:** May 22, 2025
*   **Notifications:** June 30, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Submissions:** June 23, 2025
*   **Final Camera-Ready:** July 22, 2025

### Workshops
*   **Submissions Deadline:** January 17, 2025
*   **Notifications:** January 31, 2025

### Tutorials
*   **Submissions Deadline:** April 15, 2025
*   **Notifications:** May 30, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready:** July 1, 2025
*   **Slides Availability:** August 20, 2025

### Demonstrations
*   **Submissions Deadline:** March 30, 2025
*   **Notifications:** May 27, 2025

### Panels
*   **Submissions Deadline:** May 15, 2025 / May 30, 2025
*   **Notifications:** May 30, 2025 / June 15, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready:** June 31, 2025 / July 15, 2025

## About VLDB

VLDB is a premier annual international forum for data management, scalable data science, and database researchers, vendors, practitioners, application developers, and users. The conference covers a spectrum of research topics related to all aspects of data management, with a significant focus on systems issues.

## Key Areas of Interest

*   Data mining and analytics
*   Data privacy and security
*   Database engines
*   Database performance and manageability
*   Distributed database systems
*   Graph and network data
*   Information integration and data quality
*   Languages, machine learning, AI, and databases
*   Novel database architectures
*   Provenance and workflows
*   Specialized and domain-specific data management
*   Text and semi-structured data
*   User interfaces

## Submission Links

*   [Research Track](https://vldb.org/2025/?call-for-research-track)
*   [Industrial Track](https://vldb.org/2025/?call-for-industrial-track)
*   [PhD Workshop](https://vldb.org/2025/?call-for-phd-workshop)
*   [Workshops](https://vldb.org/2025/?2025-call-for-workshops)
*   [Tutorials](https://vldb.org/2025/?call-for-tutorials)
*   [Demonstrations](https://vldb.org/2025/?call-for-demonstrations)
*   [Panels](https://vldb.org/2025/?call-for-panels)

## Formatting and Submission Guidelines

Please refer to the official VLDB 2025 website for detailed formatting and submission guidelines: [https://vldb.org/2025/](https://vldb.org/2025/)

callForPapers:
# VMCAI 2025: Call for Papers

VMCAI 2025 is the 26th International Conference on Verification, Model Checking, and Abstract Interpretation, taking place from **January 20-21, 2025**, in **Denver, Colorado, United States**. The conference is co-located with POPL 2025.

VMCAI provides a forum for researchers from the communities of Verification, Model Checking, and Abstract Interpretation, facilitating interaction, cross-fertilization, and advancement of hybrid methods that combine these and related areas.

## Scope

The program will consist of refereed research papers, invited lectures, and tutorials. Research contributions can report new results as well as experimental evaluations and comparisons of existing techniques.

## Topics of Interest

Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Program Verification
*   Model Checking
*   Abstract Interpretation
*   Abstract Domains
*   Program Synthesis
*   Static Analysis
*   Type Systems
*   Deductive Methods
*   Program Logics
*   First-Order Theories
*   Decision Procedures
*   Interpolation
*   Horn Clause Solving
*   Program Certification
*   Separation Logic
*   Probabilistic Programming and Analysis
*   Error Diagnosis
*   Detection of Bugs and Security Vulnerabilities
*   Program Transformations
*   Hybrid and Cyber-physical Systems
*   Concurrent and distributed Systems
*   Analysis of numerical properties
*   Analysis of smart contracts
*   Analysis of neural networks
*   Case Studies on all of the above topics

Submissions can address any programming paradigm, including concurrent, constraint, functional, imperative, logic, and object-oriented programming.

## Submission Categories and Page Limits

Submissions are required to follow Springer’s LNCS format. The page limit depends on the paper’s category. Additional material beyond the page limit may be placed in a clearly marked appendix.

*   **Regular papers:** Clearly identify and justify an advance to the field. Supported by experimental validation where applicable. **20 pages** (not counting references).
*   **Tool papers:** Present a new tool, component, or extensions. Emphasize design and implementation. **12 pages** (not counting references).
*   **Case studies:** Describe the use of techniques in new application domains or industrial settings. Expected to contain novel applications and evaluations. **20 pages** (not counting references).

## Important Dates (AoE / UTC-12)

*   **Paper submission deadline (extended):** October 1, 2024
*   **Notification:** November 11, 2024
*   **Camera-ready version due:** November 22, 2024

## Artifact Submission

*   **Artifact Registration Deadline:** October 1, 2024
*   **Artifact submission deadline:** October 3, 2024
*   **Artifact Evaluation Notification:** November 8, 2024

Artifacts should not be anonymous and will be evaluated based on consistency with the paper, replicability, completeness, documentation, and ease of use.

## Registration

*   Registration is handled through [easyconferences](https://www.easyconferences.org/vmcai2025/register).
*   **Early registration deadline:** December 20, 2024.
*   At least one author of each accepted paper must register for the conference.

### Registration Rates (USD):

| Type of Registration | Early Rate | Regular Rate |
|----------------------|------------|--------------|
| Student              | 395        | 425          |
| Regular              | 535        | 635          |

## Proceedings

Proceedings for VMCAI 2025 are published in two Springer LNCS volumes: 15529 and 15530. Conference participants can download the proceedings from Springer for up to 4 weeks.

## Contact

For questions, use the [VMCAI contact form](https://conf.researchr.org/contact2/VMCAI-2025/VMCAI-2025-papers).

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

## IEEE VR 2025: The 32nd IEEE Conference on Virtual Reality and 3D User Interfaces

**Dates:** March 8-12, 2025
**Location:** Saint-Malo, France

### Overview

IEEE VR 2025 seeks original, high-quality papers in all areas related to virtual reality (VR), including augmented reality (AR), mixed reality (MR), and 3D user interfaces (3DUIs). There is a unified review process for both IEEE TVCG and conference-only papers, with possible outcomes including acceptance as an IEEE TVCG paper (with presentation at IEEE VR 2025), acceptance as an IEEE VR 2025 conference paper (with presentation), acceptance as an IEEE VR 2025 poster, or rejection.

### Inquiries

*   Contact: [program2025@ieeevr.org](mailto:program2025@ieeevr.org)

### Important Dates

*   Abstracts due: **September 11, 2024** (AoE)
*   Submissions due: **September 18, 2024** (AoE)
*   Initial notifications: **December 10, 2024** (AoE)
*   Revised submissions due: **January 6, 2025** (AoE)
*   Final notifications: **January 13, 2025** (AoE)
*   Camera-ready materials due: **January 20, 2025** (AoE)

### Submission Guidelines

*   **Submission Platform:** Submissions will be accepted through Precision Conference Solutions at [https://new.precisionconference.com/vr25a](https://new.precisionconference.com/vr25a).
*   **Review Process:** IEEE VR 2025 uses a **DOUBLE-BLIND** review process. Failure to anonymize submissions will result in desk rejection.
*   **Contribution Categories:** Papers should cover one or more of the following: methodological, technical, applications, and systems.
    *   **Methodological papers:** Describe advances in theories and methods of AR/VR/MR and 3DUI.
    *   **Technical papers:** Describe advancements in algorithms or devices critical to AR/VR/MR and 3DUI development.
    *   **Application papers:** Explain how existing ideas were applied to solve a problem, including an evaluation of success.
    *   **System papers:** Indicate how techniques and technologies were integrated to produce an effective system and convey lessons learned.
*   **Evaluation:** Each paper must include an evaluation of its contributions (e.g., user studies, benchmarking).
*   **Submission Length:** Between 4 and 9 pages (excluding references), with an additional 2 pages for references. Supplementary materials and videos are encouraged.
*   **Formatting:** Papers must be formatted using the [IEEE Computer Society VGTC conference format](https://tc.computer.org/vgtc/publications/conference/).

### Topics

IEEE VR 2025 seeks contributions in VR/AR/MR and 3DUI including, but not limited to:

*   360° video
*   3D and volumetric display and projection technology
*   3D authoring
*   3D user interfaces
*   Accessibility of immersive interfaces
*   Audio interfaces and rendering
*   Collaborative interactions
*   Computer graphics techniques
*   Crowd simulation
*   Cybersickness
*   Diversity and gender issues
*   Embodied agents, virtual humans and (self-)avatars
*   Ethical issues
*   Evaluation methods
*   Haptic interfaces and rendering
*   Human factors and ergonomics
*   Immersive analytics and visualization
*   Immersive applications and games
*   Input devices
*   Locomotion and navigation
*   Mediated and diminished reality
*   Mobile, desktop or hybrid 3DUIs
*   Modeling and simulation
*   Multi-user and distributed systems
*   Multimodal capturing and reconstruction
*   Multimodal/cross-modal interaction and perception
*   Multisensory interfaces and rendering
*   Perception and cognition
*   Presence, body ownership, and agency
*   Redirection
*   Software architectures, toolkits, and engineering
*   Teleoperation and telepresence
*   Therapy and rehabilitation
*   Touch, tangible and gesture interfaces
*   Tracking
*   User experience and usability
*   XR technology infrastructure

### Review Process

The review process has two cycles:

*   **Review Cycle I (Submission to Initial notification):** Submissions are assigned to two IPC members. Early rejection for submissions violating guidelines or receiving low scores. Double-blind stage. Striving for at least three reviews per submission. Initial recommendations: Conditionally accept as IEEE TVCG paper, Conditionally accept as conference paper, Recommend as a two-page poster, or Reject.
*   **Review Cycle II (Initial notification to Final decision):** Revision of conditionally accepted papers reviewed by the coordinator for final recommendation.

### Additional Guidelines

*   **Abstract Submission:** Abstract must be uploaded seven days prior to the paper submission deadline.
*   **Ethics and Responsibility:** All research experiments with human participants must follow institutional ethical guidelines and secure ethics committee approval. Approval details must be reported in the submission system.
*   **Participant Diversity:** Research with human participants should strive for participant diversity and report demographics. Submissions making general claims with imbalanced participant groups may be negatively impacted.
*   **Review Duties for Authors:** One author per submitted paper must register to review up to three papers through PCS.
*   **Presentation at the Conference:** All accepted submissions must be presented orally at the conference. In-person presentation is expected; online presentations are accommodated only in exceptional cases.
*   **Submission Language:** All submissions must be in English.
*   **Previous Publication and Plagiarism:** Submitted manuscripts must not have been previously published or simultaneously under consideration elsewhere. Builds upon prior work can be submitted with additional papers and an explanation letter (seen by primary reviewer). Plagiarism will be checked using IEEE Crosscheck and may lead to rejection.
*   **AI-generated Text:** Large-scale language models (LLMs) can only be used for grammar editing.
*   **Submission Anonymity:** IEEE VR uses a DOUBLE-BLIND review process. Submissions must not contain author identifying information. Citations to authors' previous work must be in the third person. Failure to adhere to the double-blind policy will result in desk rejection.
*   **Pre-dissemination:** Uploading manuscripts to online repositories before the review process does not constitute a reason for rejection but can compromise anonymity.
*   **Videos:** Videos must be submitted according to instructions, free of identifying information. Accepted videos for the video proceedings will require a revised version.

### Contacts

*   **Technical Papers Chairs:** Daisuke Iwai, Luciana Nedel, Tabitha Peck, Voicu Popescu.

The VLSID 2026 conference theme is 'Global Synergy in Silicon: VLSI and Embedded AI for Next-Gen Electrified Mobility Powering Sustainable Future'. Recognized as a 'Sister Conference' of the Design Automation Conference, it attracts over 2000 participants from industry, academia, and government.
callForPapers:
# VLSID 2026: Call for Papers

The International Conference on VLSI Design (VLSID) provides a platform for researchers and practitioners to explore how VLSI and Embedded Systems can drive disruptive advancements for the next generation. VLSID 2026 will explore the frontiers of **VLSI & Embedded Systems**, with a special emphasis on **VLSI and Embedded AI for Next-Gen Electrified Mobility Powering Sustainable Future**.

## Submission Information

*   **Paper Submission:** Authors are invited to submit full-length papers (maximum 6 pages) along with an abstract of at most 200 words.
*   **Anonymity:** Double anonymous review is employed. Authors should not reveal their identity directly or indirectly. Previously published or under-review papers will not be considered.
*   **Format:** Electronic submission in PDF format is required. Papers should be in camera-ready IEEE two-column format, following IEEE proceedings specifications.
*   **Submission Portal:** Submissions are to be made electronically via [SoftConf](https://softconf.com/vlsi/vlsid2026/login/).
*   **Brochure:** For further details, download the brochure [here](https://vlsid.org/call-for-papers/).
*   **Enquiries:** Please [Contact Us](https://vlsid.org/contact-us/) for any questions.

## Topics of Interest

*   Hardware for Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
*   Analog & Mixed Signal and, RF Circuits
*   Sensors interfacing circuits and systems
*   Test, Verification and Reliability
*   Embedded Systems, Internet of Things (IoT), and Cyber-Physical System Design
*   Low power Digital Systems
*   Electronic design automation
*   Hardware and Systems Security
*   Photonic Integrated Circuits & Optical Communication
*   Power & Energy Management
*   Emerging Technologies: in-memory/near-memory computing, neuromorphic computing, Post-CMOS Technologies
*   Quantum computing – hardware, algorithms and security
*   3D IC and Advanced Packaging
*   Emerging Memory Technologies
*   Wireless systems 5G and beyond
*   Reconfigurable computing and processor design
*   VLSI circuits and systems for manufacturing, automotive and EVs

## Important Dates

*   **Submission Opens:** July 2, 2025
*   **Final Submission Deadline:** July 25, 2025
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** September 25, 2025

## Paper Publication and Presenter Registration

*   Papers will be accepted for regular or poster presentations.
*   At least one author MUST register for the conference by the time the camera-ready paper is submitted.
*   At least one author is expected to attend the conference and present the paper.

For more details on specific tracks, please refer to [Track Details](https://vlsid.org/track-details/).

The symposium focuses on recent advances and research challenges in GIScience, particularly those arising from the integration of artificial intelligence, big data, and social networks within GIS, with a special emphasis on addressing environmental problems and sustainable development goals in urban contexts.
callForPapers:
# W2GIS 2025: Call for Papers

The 22nd International Symposium on Web and Wireless Geographical Information Systems (W2GIS 2025) invites high-quality submissions of three types of contributions: full papers, work in progress papers, and showcase papers. The conference will take place in **Mexico City, Mexico, from September 8-9, 2025**.

## Focus and Topics

The integration of artificial intelligence, big data, and social networks within GIS presents new opportunities for urban planning, transportation, and sustainability. However, these advancements also bring significant research challenges. As the conference takes place for the first time in Mexico City and Central America, a key focus is to explore how GIScience, combined with these technologies, can address emerging environmental problems in urban contexts, particularly in relation to sustainable development goals.

Topics to be addressed include, but are not limited to:

*   Geospatial databases and spatio-temporal data management.
*   Mobile spatial interaction and movement analysis.
*   Spatial search, GeoWeb search engines and services.
*   Location-based social networks.
*   Spatial social networks.
*   On-line spatial data mining.
*   GeoSensor data acquisition, processing, management and analysis.
*   Smart environments, Internet of Things and ambient spatial intelligence.
*   Exploratory cartography and Web and wireless geo interfaces.
*   GIS visualization techniques for Web and mobile location-based applications.
*   Cyber-geography & augmented reality.
*   Map personalization and adaptation.
*   3D modelling of cityscapes for location-based services.
*   Ubiquitous and wireless GIS.
*   Security, privacy, and usability issues of Web and wireless environments.
*   Semantic geospatial Web and interoperability.
*   User studies and evaluations of online geoservices.
*   Indoor and outdoor wayfinding and navigation.
*   Crowdsourcing and volunteered geographic information.
*   Telematics, GIS and location-based applications.
*   LBS and transportation applications.
*   Wireless-based location-aware applications.
*   Integration of AI and LLMs.

## Submission Types

*   **Full papers:** To present scientific results (limited to 16 pages).
*   **Short papers:** To present ongoing work (limited to 10 pages).
*   **Industry papers:** For works with a larger focus on industrial impact and at least one author with an industrial affiliation (10 to 16 pages).
*   **Showcase papers:** For live presentations of research prototypes and products (limited to 4 pages).

## Important Dates

*   **Submission deadline:** 8 March 2025 (extended to 23 March 2025)
*   **Notification of acceptance:** 20 May 2025
*   **Camera-Ready copy due:** 5 June 2025 (extended to 8 June 2025)
*   **Author registration deadline:** 25 July 2025
*   **Early-bird registration:** 25 May 2025

## Submission Instructions

Authors are invited to submit full, original, unpublished research papers. Each paper must be written in English, submitted in PDF format, and formatted using the Springer camera-ready templates available at the Springer Lecture Notes in Computer Science website.

All contributions must be uploaded through the submission site at [EasyChair](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=w2gis2025).

All papers must be original and not simultaneously submitted to another conference or journal.

All submissions will be refereed for quality, originality, and relevance by the Program Committee.

## Doctoral Symposium

W2GIS 2025 will also feature a Doctoral Symposium, providing a valuable platform for Ph.D students to receive feedback and guidance from well-known researchers and industry experts.

## Dissemination

All accepted papers will be published in the conference proceedings in the **Springer Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS)** series, which is indexed on Clarivate Analytics’ Web of Science, Scopus, EI Engineering Index, Google Scholar, DBLP and other platforms.

The authors of selected papers will be invited to submit an extended version of their work for consideration in a dedicated Special Issue of the Cuadernos de Geografía: Revista Colombiana de Geografía journal (Q4 on Scopus).

## Awards and Grants

*   **Awards:** Two 500 € prizes will be awarded for the best paper and the best presentation.
*   **Grants:** W2GIS 2025 offers two grants for Ph.D and master students, covering the conference registration fees. Apply Here [Apply Here link not provided in source text, use a placeholder or omit if not available].

## Registration

All information is available on the [Registration page](/view/w2gis-2025/registration). Please register at [EventBrite](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/w2gis-2025-tickets-1397246585149?aff=oddtdtcreator).

# IEEE VTC2025-Spring Oslo: Call for Papers

The 2025 IEEE 101st Vehicular Technology Conference: VTC2025-Spring will be held in **Oslo, Norway, from 17 to 20 June 2025**.

This semi-annual flagship conference of IEEE Vehicular Technology Society will bring together individuals from academia, government, and industry to discuss and exchange ideas in the fields of wireless, mobile, and vehicular technology.

Prospective authors are invited to submit **5-page, original, and unpublished full papers**. A full paper can be up to **7 pages** in length, with additional page charges for pages longer than 5 pages. Papers submitted for review should not exceed 8 pages.

callForPapers:
# VRST 2025: Call for Participation

The ACM Virtual Reality Software and Technology (VRST) 2025 conference will be held on **November 12, 13 & 14, 2025**. VRST is a key venue for presenting cutting-edge research and development in virtual reality software and technology.

## Important Dates

*   **Paper Abstracts Due:** Monday 7 July 2025
*   **Papers (all materials) Due:** Monday 14 July 2025
*   **Author Notification for Papers:** Monday 1 September 2025
*   **Revised Papers:** Monday 8 September 2025
*   **Final Author Notification for Papers:** Friday 12 September 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Papers:** Monday 15 September 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** Wednesday 12 – Friday 14 November 2025

*Note: Each deadline is 23:59:59 AoE (Anywhere on Earth) == GMT/UTC-12:00 on the stated day.*

## Topics

VRST 2025 welcomes paper submissions relating to the following XR areas:

*   Display technology and interaction devices
*   Low-latency and high-performance software and applications
*   Multi-user and distributed XR
*   XR software environments and authoring systems
*   Interaction techniques
*   Tracking and sensing
*   Multimodal XR including haptics, smell, taste, and brain-computer interfaces
*   Audio & music processing, sound synthesis, and sonification
*   XR-related computer vision, computer graphics, and rendering techniques
*   Immersive analytics
*   Diversity and Inclusion in XR
*   XR-related modeling and simulation techniques
*   Avatars and virtual humans, virtual embodiment, and body-ownership illusions
*   Teleoperation and telepresence
*   Performance testing, user experience, and empirical studies
*   Locomotion and navigation
*   Perception, presence, and cognition
*   XR applications, e.g. training, medical, fabrication
*   Multi-disciplinary research projects involving innovative use of XR

## Submission Guidelines

All accepted papers will be published in the ACM Digital Library in the VRST collection.

### Format

*   Paper submissions must be **anonymous** for a double-blind review process.
*   All submissions should be prepared using the Word or LaTeX templates from the official ACM Master article template packages and TAPS.
*   **For LaTeX authors:** Submissions should be made using the double-column format with `\documentclass[sigconf,review,anonymous]{acmart}`.
*   **For Word submissions:** Please use the provided single-column template.
*   Authors should prepare their materials using numbered citations and references.

### Submission Lengths

*   **LaTeX:** 4 to 9 pages, double column, excluding references.
*   **Word:** Approximately 8,000 words including space for figures, tables, etc.

### Anonymity Guidelines

*   Remove all author and institution information.
*   Remove any clues that would directly identify authors (e.g., institution names, acknowledgments).
*   Anonymize all PDF files, including file metadata.
*   Citations of the authors’ own published work must be in the third person and not traceable to the authors' identity.
*   Failure to comply will result in automatic desk rejection.

## Contribution Types

*   Research papers
*   Posters
*   Demos
*   Reproduction Challenge
*   Student Volunteers

## Supplementary Materials

*   Optional materials (images, videos, documents) up to 50MB are allowed.
*   Content should be in portable formats (PDF, HTML, PNG, JPEG, QuickTime, MPEG).
*   These materials do not form part of the official submission and will be viewed at the reviewers' discretion.

## Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Researchers are encouraged to use representative participant samples for user evaluations and to discuss limitations if non-representative samples are used. Reporting participant demographic information is recommended.

## Accessibility

Authors are asked to make submissions as inclusive as possible, providing alt-text for figures and tables, and accessible supplemental videos with subtitles. Authors facing difficulties can contact the VRST 2025 Accessibility Chairs at [accessibility@vrst2025.org](mailto:accessibility@vrst2025.org).

## Policies

*   At least one author of each accepted paper must register for the conference and present their work **in person**. Remote presentations are not possible.
*   All standing ACM policies apply, including ACM Policy on Authorship and ACM Policy on Prior Publication and Simultaneous Submissions.
*   Authors must obtain an ORCID ID.

## Submission System

Please use the Precision Conferences System (PCS) to submit your work: [https://new.precisionconference.com/vrst2025](https://new.precisionconference.com/vrst2025)

*   Choose “SIGCHI” from the “Society” drop-down list.
*   Then choose “VRST 2025” from the “Conference/Journal” drop-down list.

## Contact

For paper-related inquiries, please contact: [papers2025@vrst.acm.org](mailto:papers2025@vrst.acm.org)

*   Daniel Zielasko, Trier University, Germany
*   Kangsoo Kim, University of Calgary, Canada
*   Rick Skarbez, La Trobe University, Australia

It is held in conjunction with MODELSWARD 2025 and ROBOVIS 2025, and offers hybrid participation options.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - VISIGRAPP 2025

The purpose of VISIGRAPP is to bring together researchers and practitioners interested in both theoretical advances and applications of computer vision, computer graphics, human-computer interaction and information visualization.

VISIGRAPP 2025 will be held in conjunction with **MODELSWARD 2025** and **ROBOVIS 2025**. Registration to VISIGRAPP allows free access to the MODELSWARD and ROBOVIS conferences (as a non-speaker).

Although the conference is back to the normal mode (i.e., in-person), speakers are allowed to present remotely if unable to travel to the venue (hybrid support).

## Keynote Speakers

*   **Julien Pettré**, Inria, France
*   **Daniel Archambault**, Newcastle University, United Kingdom
*   **Katherine J. Kuchenbecker**, Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems, Germany
*   **Diane Larlus**, Naver Labs Europe, France

## Program Co-chairs (for affiliated conferences)

### GRAPP (20th International Conference on Computer Graphics Theory and Applications)
*   Thomas Bashford-Rogers, University of Warwick, United Kingdom
*   Daniel Meneveaux, University of Poitiers, XLIM, France

### HUCAPP (9th International Conference on Human Computer Interaction Theory and Applications)
*   Mehdi Ammi, University of Paris 8, France
*   Mounia Ziat, Bentley University, United States

### IVAPP (16th International Conference on Information Visualization Theory and Applications)
*   Stefan Jänicke, Department of Mathematics and Computer Science, University of Southern Denmark, Denmark
*   Helen C. Purchase, Monash University, Australia

### VISAPP (20th International Conference on Computer Vision Theory and Applications)
*   Petia Radeva, Universitat de Barcelona, Spain
*   Antonino Furnari, University of Catania, Italy

## Tutorials

*   **On the Turning Away: Enhancing Stroke Survivors Rehabilitation with Virtual Reality**
    *   Instructors: Bernardo Marques, Beatriz Sousa Santos and Sérgio Oliveira
*   **Egocentric Vision: Exploring User-Centric Perspectives**
    *   Instructor: Francesco Ragusa

## Publications

All papers presented at the conference venue will be available at the **SCITEPRESS Digital Library**.

It is planned to publish a short list of revised and extended versions of presented papers with **Springer** in a **CCIS Series book**.

A short list of best papers will be invited for a post-conference special issue of the **Springer Nature Computer Science Journal**.

## Important Dates, Topics of Interest, and Submission Guidelines

Specific details regarding submission deadlines, topics of interest, and detailed submission guidelines are not provided in the input text.

callForPapers:
# WEBIST 2025: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Web Information Systems and Technologies (WEBIST) aims to bring together researchers, engineers, and practitioners interested in the technological advances and business applications of web-based information systems.

### Conference Tracks:

1.  **Internet Technology**
2.  **Web Intelligence and Semantic Web**
3.  **Social Network Analytics**
4.  **HCI in Mobile Systems and Web Interfaces**

## Paper Submission

Authors can submit their work in the form of a **complete paper** (Regular Paper or Position Paper) or an **abstract**.

*   **Regular Papers:** Represent completed and validated research.
*   **Position Papers:** Portray a short report of work in progress or an arguable opinion about an issue.
*   **Abstracts:** Presented but not published in the proceedings.

### Submission Guidelines:

*   Papers must be in English, carefully checked for grammar and spelling.
*   Submissions should indicate the nature of their contribution and applicability.
*   **Double-blind paper evaluation method:** Papers must be submitted WITHOUT any reference to the authors, including personal details, acknowledgments, or any other identifying information.
*   Only original papers should be submitted. Authors must read INSTICC's ethical norms regarding plagiarism and self-plagiarism.
*   Papers must be submitted through the online submission platform **PRIMORIS**.
*   Follow the instructions and templates found under [Guidelines](https://www.scitepress.org/Guidelines.aspx?y=2025) and [Templates](https://www.scitepress.org/Templates.aspx?y=2025).

## Publications

*   All accepted complete papers will be published in the conference proceedings, available in the [SCITEPRESS Digital Library](https://www.scitepress.org/PublishedPapers/2025).
*   Papers receive a DOI (Digital Object Identifier) and are submitted for indexation by SCOPUS, Google Scholar, DBLP, Semantic Scholar, EI, and Web of Science/Conference Proceedings Citation Index.
*   A short list of best papers will be invited for a post-conference special issue of the Springer Nature Computer Science Journal.
*   It is planned to publish a short list of revised and extended versions of presented papers with Springer in a LNBIP Series book.

## Important Dates

*   **Conference Dates:** October 21 - 23, 2025

### Regular Papers:
*   **Paper Submission:** June 6, 2025 (expired)
*   **Authors Notification:** July 17, 2025
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** July 31, 2025

### Position Papers / Regular Papers:
*   **Paper Submission:** July 3, 2025 (expired)
*   **Authors Notification:** July 31, 2025
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** September 5, 2025

### Late-Breaking:
*   **Paper Submission:** July 24, 2025
*   **Authors Notification:** September 3, 2025
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** September 11, 2025

### Abstracts Track:
*   **Abstract Submission:** July 31, 2025
*   **Authors Notification:** September 8, 2025
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** September 17, 2025

*(Note: All dates refer to AOE time, i.e., "Anywhere on Earth")*

## Secretariat

WEBIST Secretariat
Address: Avenida de S. Francisco Xavier, Lote 7 Cv. C, 2900-616 Setúbal - Portugal
Tel.: +351 265 520 184
Fax: +351 265 520 186
e-mail: [webist.secretariat@insticc.org](mailto:webist.secretariat@insticc.org)
Web: [https://webist.scitevents.org](https://webist.scitevents.org)

## Venue

The conference will take place at the **Barceló Marbella hotel** in Marbella, Spain.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: Workshop on Computational Optimization (CO)

The Workshop on Computational Optimization (CO) is a thematic session within the Conference on Computer Science and Intelligence Systems (FedCSIS 2025), taking place in **Kraków, Poland, from September 14-17, 2025**.

### Aim and Scope

This workshop aims to stimulate communication between researchers working on different fields of optimization and practitioners who need reliable and efficient computational optimization methods. We invite original contributions related to both theoretical and practical aspects of optimization methods.

### Topics of Interest

The list of topics includes, but is not limited to:

*   Combinatorial and continuous global optimization
*   Unconstrained and constrained optimization
*   Multiobjective and robust optimization
*   Optimization in dynamic and/or noisy environments
*   Optimization on graphs
*   Large-scale optimization, in parallel and distributed computational environments
*   Meta-heuristics for optimization, nature-inspired approaches and any other derivative-free methods
*   Exact/heuristic hybrid methods, involving natural computing techniques and other global and local optimization methods
*   Numerical and heuristic methods for modeling

### Applications of Interest

The applications of interest are included in the list below, but are not limited to:

*   Classical operational research problems (knapsack, traveling salesman, etc.)
*   Computational biology and distance geometry
*   Data mining and knowledge discovery
*   Human motion simulations; crowd simulations
*   Industrial applications
*   Optimization in statistics, econometrics, finance, physics, chemistry, biology, medicine, and engineering
*   Environment modeling and optimization

### Submission Rules

*   Authors should submit their papers as Postscript, PDF or MSWord files.
*   The total length of a paper should not exceed **12 pages IEEE style** (including tables, figures and references). More pages can be added, for an additional fee.
*   IEEE style templates are available [here](/for_authors/instructions).
*   Papers will be refereed and accepted on the basis of their scientific merit and relevance to the Topical Area.
*   Preprints containing accepted papers will be published online.
*   Only papers presented at the conference will be published in Conference Proceedings and submitted for inclusion in the IEEE Xplore® database.
*   Conference proceedings will be published in a volume with ISBN, ISSN and DOI numbers and posted at the conference WWW site.
*   Conference proceedings will be submitted for indexation.
*   Organizers reserve the right to move accepted papers between FedCSIS Sessions.

### Important Dates

*   **Thematic Session proposal submission:** ~~26.11.2025~~ (Past)
*   **Paper submission (no extensions):** ~~25.05.2025~~ (Past)
*   **Position paper submission:** ~~10.06.2025~~ (Past)
*   **Author notification:** 8.07.2025
*   **Final paper submission, registration:** 15.07.2025
*   **Early registration discount:** 6.08.2025
*   **Conference date:** September 14-17.09.2025

### Submission Platform

CFP in EasyChair system: [https://easychair.org/cfp/fedcsis2025](https://easychair.org/cfp/fedcsis2025)

### Publication Opportunities

Extended versions of selected papers presented during the conference will be published as a volume in the **Studies in Computational Intelligence Springer series**.

callForPapers:
# Call For Papers: WAFR 2024

The Workshop on the Algorithmic Foundations of Robotics (WAFR) is a biannual multi-disciplinary single-track meeting for international researchers presenting the latest advances on algorithmic problems in robotics. In 2024, we celebrate **30 years of WAFR** and are planning special events.

WAFR's focus is on the design and analysis of robot algorithms from both theoretical and practical angles. These algorithms process inputs from noisy sensors, build geometric and physical models of the world, plan high- and low-level actions, and execute them on actuators with limited precision. The design and analysis of robot algorithms draw from fields including control theory, computational and differential geometry, and computer science.

## Topics of Interest

The conference encourages submissions on a broad range of topics, including:

*   Algorithmic approaches to human-robot interaction
*   Computational geometry and topology
*   Control theory and optimization
*   Distributed and parallel methods
*   Decision theory and game theory
*   Geometrical and physical modeling
*   Machine learning (supervised, unsupervised, reinforcement, representation, imitation learning)
*   Planning and reasoning under uncertainty
*   Probabilistic and sampling-based algorithms
*   Sensing and perception
*   Task and motion planning
*   Theoretical computer science

Additionally, papers on applications of robot algorithms to important or new domains, including those beyond traditional robotics, are welcome:

*   Assistive and service robotics
*   Brain-controlled robots
*   Computational biology
*   Computer animation, graphics and animation, VR/AR
*   Legged locomotion
*   Manufacturing and automation
*   Multi-agent systems
*   Sensor networks and IoT devices
*   Surgical robots, intelligent prosthetics, rehabilitation robots
*   Transportation networks and systems

## Important Dates

*   **Paper submission deadline:** June 13, 2024
*   **Acceptance notification:** August 17, 2024
*   **Final manuscript for website:** September 16, 2024
*   **Early Registration:** September 23, 2024
*   **Travel Grants Applications (preference):** September 23, 2024
*   **WAFR 2024 Conference Dates:** October 7-9, 2024
*   **Camera-ready manuscript for SPAR book:** December 9, 2024

## Information for Authors

Information on manuscript preparation and the submission process is available at [this link](authors.php).

## Guidelines Regarding the Use and Disclosure of AI Tools for Authors

*   Generative AI tools and technologies, such as ChatGPT, may not be listed as authors of a paper submitted to WAFR.
*   The use of content generated by AI in an article (including but not limited to text, figures, images, and code) must be disclosed in the acknowledgments section.
*   The AI system used must be identified, and specific sections of the article that use AI-generated content should be specified and accompanied by a brief explanation regarding the manner in which the AI system was used to generate the content.
*   The use of AI systems for editing and grammar enhancement is common practice and, as such, is generally outside the intent of the above policy. Even so, in this case, disclosure is still recommended as the lines between these uses can be difficult to distinguish.

## Guidelines Regarding the Use and Disclosure of AI Tools for Reviewers

Information or content contained in or about a manuscript under review shall not be processed through an AI system. Doing so is considered a breach of confidentiality and as such is not permitted.

## Contact

*   **Email:** [wafr2024@gmail.com](mailto:wafr2024@gmail.com)
*   **Sponsors:** UIUC Center for Autonomy, Siebel School of Computing and Data Science, Parasol Lab

## Committee Co-Chairs

*   Nancy Amato
*   Katie Driggs-Campbell
*   Chinwe Ekenna
*   Marco Morales
*   Jason O'Kane

callForPapers:
# WiMob 2025: Call for Papers

The 21st International Conference on Wireless and Mobile Computing, Networking and Communications (WiMob 2025) will take place in **Marrakech, Morocco, from October 20 - 22, 2025**.

WiMob is an International forum for the exchange of knowledge and experience among researchers, developers, and practitioners of wireless and mobile technology. This year, the conference will focus on **5G, IoT, Cyber Security, and the use of Artificial Intelligence for mobile and wireless Networks**.

## Submission Topics

WiMob 2025 is soliciting high-quality technical papers addressing research challenges in the areas of wireless communications, wireless networking, mobility, nomadicity, ubiquitous computing, services, and applications. Papers should present original work validated via analysis, simulation, or experimentation. Practical experiences and testbed trials are also welcome.

WiMob 2025 will host FIVE parallel symposia, including topics such as:

### Wireless Communications (WC)
*   Broadband Wireless Communication Systems
*   Multimedia Communications over Wireless
*   Advances in Satellite Communication
*   Modulation and Coding
*   Multiple Access Techniques
*   Channel Measurement and Characterization
*   Location Estimation and Tracking
*   MIMO Channels
*   Multirate and Multicarrier Communications
*   Cognitive and Cooperative MAC
*   Heterogeneous Cellular Networks
*   Energy Harvesting Communication Systems
*   Large Scale Massive MIMO Systems
*   Reconfigurable Intelligent Surface

### Next Generation Mobile Networking (NGMN)
*   Next Generation Mobile Networking
*   5G Wireless and Mobile Networks
*   6G Wireless and Mobile Networks
*   Cellular Systems, PCS Modeling and Configuration
*   Wireless Sensor Networks
*   Cross-layer Design and Optimization
*   Congestion and Admission Control
*   Mobility patterns, Location and Handoff Management
*   Design and Analysis of Wireless LAN/WAN
*   Wireless multicasting, broadcasting and geocasting
*   Wireless Sensors and Actuators/Robots Networks
*   Energy-efficient Protocols for Wireless Networks
*   Opportunistic Networks
*   Vehicular Wireless Networks
*   Wireless Mesh Networks
*   Delay Tolerant Networks
*   Integration of Ad hoc Networks with Wireless Access Networks
*   QoS Support for Mobile Networks
*   RFID Networks and Protocols
*   WPAN, LOWPAN
*   Optimization Models and Algorithms
*   Portable Devices and Wearable Computers
*   Virtualization in Wireless Networks
*   Software defined Wireless Networks
*   Swarms of Unmanned Vehicles
*   Space Networks
*   Green Data Storage, Data Centers and Cloud Computing, Content Distribution Networks

### Artificial Intelligence based Communications & Networking (AICN)
*   Artificial Intelligence for Mobile and wearable computing
*   Artificial Intelligence for Mobile enterprises and eCommerce
*   Artificial Intelligence and Ubiquitous collaborative & social services
*   Artificial Intelligence for Internet-of-things and edge computing
*   Artificial Intelligence and Cyber-physical integration
*   Artificial Intelligence and Big data analytics for mobility-enabled services
*   Artificial Intelligence for Mobile Health and Services
*   Large Language Model for Wireless and Mobile Networks

### Blockchain and Cryptocurrency in Mobile Networks (BCMN)
*   Distributed Trust
*   Decentralised Internet Infrastructure
*   Decentralised Financial Services
*   Blockchain for Internet of Things/Cyber Physical Services
*   Blockchain and Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence
*   Blockchain for Metaverse and Digital Twins
*   Distributed Consensus and Fault Tolerance Algorithms
*   Blockchain Platforms & Offchain Technologies
*   Decentralized Finance and payments

### Trust, Security and Privacy in Wireless and Mobile Networks (SWMN)

*   Cross-layer Design Security
*   Cryptographic Algorithms and Applications
*   Identity Management, Key distribution and management
*   Information System Security
*   Intrusion Detection and Prevention
*   Mobile and Wireless Network Security
*   Network Security Protocol Design
*   Other Topics on Security on Wireless and Mobile Networks
*   Physical Layer Security
*   Privacy and Security in Clouds and Contents Distribution Networks
*   Resource Allocation, Incentives, and Game-Theoretic Models
*   Security and Privacy in Crowd Sensing and Crowd Sourcing
*   Security and Privacy of Big Data
*   Security and Privacy of Cloud Services
*   Security and Privacy of D2D
*   Security and Privacy of Location-based services
*   Security and Privacy of Social Networks
*   Security in Cognitive Radio Networks and Cooperative Communication Systems
*   Security of Cyber Physical Systems
*   Security of Femtocells and Macrocells
*   Security of Mobile Multimedia and Cloud Media
*   Security, Privacy and Anonymity in Mesh, Vehicular and Mobile Networks
*   Security, Trust and Privacy of Internet of Things
*   Smart Grids Security
*   Smart Phone Security and Privacy
*   Threat and Vulnerability Analysis for Mobile Communication
*   Trust Models, Security Modeling and Protocol Design
*   Trust, Privacy and Security: Application, Network and MAC layers.

## Important Dates

*   **Submission Date:** June 25, 2025
*   **Notifications Date:** July 30, 2025
*   **Camera ready Date:** September 15, 2025
*   **Registrations for Authors:** September 15, 2025

## Paper Submission Guidelines

*   Authors are required to submit fully formatted, original papers (PDF), with graphs, images, and other special areas arranged as intended for the final publication.
*   Papers should be written in English conforming to the IEEE standard conference format (two-column, 10 pt font, etc., including figures, tables, and references).
*   Review submissions are limited to **six pages**, with two additional pages for final papers (additional charges may apply for additional pages).
*   Conference content will be submitted for inclusion into IEEE Xplore as well as other Abstracting and Indexing (A&I) databases.
*   Each accepted paper must be presented at the conference by one of the co-authors or a third party, otherwise it will not be indexed and archived through IEEE Xplore.
*   Only timely submissions through EDAS ([https://edas.info/](https://edas.info/)) will be accepted.

## Registration and Contact

*   For registration details, please refer to the registration section on the official website.
*   **Contact Email:** [wimob2025@wimob.org](mailto:wimob2025@wimob.org)

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

We invite authors to submit papers describing original research of theoretical or practical significance to the 51st International Workshop on Graph-Theoretic Concepts in Computer Science (WG2025).

WG2025 is the 51st edition of the WG series and will take place from **June 11 to 13, 2025**, with a reception on the evening of **June 10**, at **Europäische Akademie Otzenhausen, Germany**.

This conference is dedicated to the memory of Hartmut Noltemeier, who passed away on May 10, 2025. He was one of the co-founders of WG and organized and chaired the conference three times.

## Aims and Scope

WG is mainly concerned with efficient algorithms of various types (e.g., sequential, parallel, distributed, randomized, parameterized) for problems on graphs and networks. The goal is to present recent results and to identify and explore directions for future research. Submitted papers should describe original results in any aspects of graph theory related to computer science, including but not restricted to:

*   design and analysis of sequential, parallel, randomized, parameterized algorithms
*   distributed graph and network algorithms
*   structural graph theory with algorithmic or complexity applications
*   computational complexity of graph and network problems
*   graph grammars, graph rewriting systems and graph modeling
*   graph drawing and layouts
*   computational geometry
*   computational biology
*   graph mining
*   random graphs and models of the web and scale-free networks
*   support of the above concepts by suitable implementations and applications.

## Important Dates

All times are Anywhere on Earth (AoE).

*   **Abstract submission deadline:** February 14, 2025
*   **Paper submission deadline:** February 20, 2025
*   **Notification of paper acceptance:** April 15, 2025
*   **Symposium:** June 11-13, 2025
*   **Final versions due:** July 1, 2025

## Submissions And Proceedings

Contributors are invited to submit an **extended abstract of at most 12 pages** in Springer LNCS format (www.springer.com/lncs) including title and abstract, but excluding references. Proofs omitted due to space restrictions must be placed in an appendix, to be read by program committee members at their discretion.

All papers must be original and not simultaneously submitted to another journal or conference. At least one author of each accepted paper will be expected to register and present the paper in person at the conference.

Accepted contributions will be published in the conference post-proceedings in the Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) series of Springer-Verlag.

The submission server is: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=wg2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=wg2025)

## Awards

WG 2025 will offer awards for the **best paper** and the **best student paper**. The awards will be decided by the program committee. Papers eligible for the best student paper can have non-student co-authors, but the main work must be done by students at the time of submission. It must be indicated at the time of submission whether a paper is a candidate for this award.

callForPapers:
# WISA 2025: Call for Papers

The 26th World Conference on Information Security Applications (WISA 2025) will be held from **August 20-22, 2025**, at **MAISON GLAD, Jeju Island, Korea**.

WISA is the premier security research venue co-hosted by the Korea Institute of Information Security and Cryptology (KIISC) and the Electronics & Telecommunications Research Institute (ETRI), and co-sponsored by several key organizations including the National intelligence service (NIS), the Ministry of Science and ICT (MSIT), the Korea Internet & Security Agency (KISA), and the National Security Research Institute (NSR) by the Korea Institute of Science and Technology Information (KISTI).

This year, WISA will explore the innovative possibilities of various technologies in enhancing (and threatening) cyber security, focusing on:

*   **Artificial intelligence (AI)** and blockchain-driven security
*   **Hardware cryptography**
*   And all other technical and practical aspects of security applications.

We invite participants from a diverse group of researchers and practitioners who are passionate about advancing the state of the art, as well as addressing fundamental security challenges. Join us at WISA 2025 and be part of the conversation that shapes the future of information security.

## Important Dates

*   **Paper submission deadline:** June 13, 2025 (23:59 GMT+9)
